loans.name: Uktamjon

texts.ru: 25 летный будущий фармацевт и врачом. Уктамчон. Он учится в Медицинском университете в городе Душанбе. Уктамчон из города Вахдат. Он в городе живет вместе с матерью и женой. Уктамчон с детство мечтает стать хорошим врачом и помочь людям. Его дядя тоже врач. Уктамчон после занятия работает в аптеке, чтобы взять опыта и зарабатывать на жизнь. Он учится, и работай, и помогает маме обеспечить семью. Его мама занимается торговлей деятельности на рынке.  Уктамчон обратился за кредитом с большими надеждами. Ему надо оплатит договор  за обучения. Ваша помощь поможет ему продвигать учебы и достичь своих целей. Уктамчон заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
This 25 year old future pharmacist and doctor is Uktamjon. He studies at the Medical University in the city of Dushanbe. Uktamjon is from the city of Vahdat. He lives together with his mother and his wife.

Uktamjon has dreamed of becoming a good doctor and help people since his childhood. his grandfather was a doctor too. After his classes, Uktamjon works at a pharmacy, in order to get experience and earn a living. He studies and works and helps his mother support the family. His mother works with retail sales at the market.

Uktamjon applied for a loan with great hopes. He needs to pay his tuition. Your help will allow him to continue his education and reach his goal. Uktamjon extends his gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is an intelligent, enthusiastic young woman who runs her own mobile money transfer business in Lusaka, Zambia. With the recent depreciation of the Zambian currency, Rhoda’s business has been struggling financially.

Inflated transport and rent costs are only two of the factors affecting her business at the present time. The state of the Zambian economy has caused the price of basic items to double. Rhoda feels that she needs some assistance to build her business so she can continue to meet her household needs.

Rhoda is 21 and she helps out financially at home. She comes from a family of nine. Six of her sisters are still in school and she helps to pay for their school fees. Rhoda is reaching out to Kiva lenders because it is the only way for her to get funding to grow her business. Other local banks and lending institutions require collateral to approve her loan.

Rhoda is challenged by the constant float shortages she experiences, especially when assisting a client who needs to send a large sum of money. This results in her losing clients to other mobile money transfer competitors and her clients losing faith in her services. These are not the values she wishes to embody nor is it the type of rapport she wants to build with her clients and community members. Rhoda has requested a loan to add to her working capital for floating so that she is able to make more transactions and earn more profits.

Rhoda states that accessing this capital from Kiva will change her life. She currently struggles to provide basic needs for herself and pay for her sisters' school fees. Rhoda thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To generate enough capital to grow her mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Shafiu

texts.en:
Shafiu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shafiu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Shafiu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Shafiu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Shafiu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Luka has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Luka would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Luka can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Luka will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Luka is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

texts.en:
Garba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Garba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

loans.name: Swag, Vijana Na Maendeleo Youth Group

texts.en: Swag Vijana na Maendeleo Youth Group was formed one year ago. The group consists of seven group members who run small-scale business enterprises which include a hardware store. Recently, they learned about the Fresh Life Toilets franchise through their area's County Government Official who is also the group's mentor. As Shalla, the group's chairman says, joining the Fresh Life Toilets movement is an opportunity for the group to expand their business ventures and provide their neighborhood's entrepreneurs with clean hygienic toilets. They hope to embark on the project by installing one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.use: To pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en:
Magaji is a Babban Gona maize farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, Magaji is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

With the potential to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Magaji now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and his family. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ma. Helen

texts.en: Helen is a resident of Calape, Bohol. She is 48 years old, married woman with four children; two adults and two-school-aged. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps her husband by selling the fish. Helen and her husband are doing this livelihood for 23 years. This livelihood is their main sources of income since they started their married life. With this, they want to improve this livelihood for their sustainability. And they also want to have enough money for their children to finish their studies. To do this, Helen is asking an amount to buy fishing boat and fishing nets.

loans.use: to buy fishing boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earn as well for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she has seek financial help to purchase variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.In the future, Analiza wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is married with school age children whom she raised through her retailing business in Silanga, Tangub City. She is an active member of Paglaum MPC where she access her additional capital on her existing business. Recently, she asks a loan from the cooperative to restock store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and others.

loans.use: to restock store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and others

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam is 40 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at teen and school age. Meriam earns her living from sales of her sari-sari store, hog fattening and hog raising business activities. She earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing these types of business activities. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional sacks of booster and grower feeds for her hog fattening and raising business, additional stocks of groceries for retail. Meriam has been a member of PMPC for almost 5 years. In the future, she hopes to become a major supplier of meat in the area.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing additional sacks of booster and grower feeds, purchase of groceries

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Sale

texts.en:
Sale is a maize farmer from Sabon Garu village. As a Babban Gona member, Sale is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Sale would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Sale can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Sale no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Sale hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita has been raised by a carpenter father. As she grows up, she assisted her father on carpentry works especially on making furniture which now become a source of her income. Unable to sustain her business due to financial constraints, she sign up to Paglaum MPC for additional capital. Now that she successfully repaid all her loans without records of defaults, she applies for an amount to expand her furniture production. The amount of PHP 20,000.00 to purchase lumber, varnish, paints & carving tools for furniture making business.

loans.use: to purchase lumber, varnish, paints & carving tools for furniture making business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 51 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children who are adults. For her means of living, she is engaged in managing a sari-sari store business. She has been in this business for one year already. She earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month in doing this business. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing canned goods, drinks and other groceries for her sari-sari store business. She's been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Lydia hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, drinks and other groceries for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three children two of whom attend  school . They live at their own house that has electricity and  piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food.

She has operated a Khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Senona

texts.en: Senona is 45 years old and is known in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental of her delicious and palatable food. She delivers her food products for snacks on different school canteens and operates her snack inn just outside her house. She had expanded and had increased her production due to high orders from her local customers. In order to meet the demands, she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC the amount of PHP 14,000.00 to purchase ingredients for snack vending like flour, milk, sugar, butter, cheese and others. Senona believes having enough inventories of the raw materials will not hamper her daily operation.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snack vending like flour, milk, sugar, butter, cheese and others

loans.name: Alh. Isiya

texts.en:
Alhaji Isiya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Isiya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Isiya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alhaji Isiya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Isiya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Isiya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hard working woman, and is very busy making native baskets. She is a 32-year-old married woman and has a ten-year old son.

Nine years ago she started , making baskets to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their household. She is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her child.

She has requested a loan to invest in materials like wicker (pliable twig),nito and buli ( a kind of palm). In that way, she could produce more basket and gain higher earnings.

Hanan hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own beauty salon to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

She is dreaming that someday, her business will become successful coupled with her hard work and determination.

loans.use: to invest in materials like wicker (pliable twig),nito and buli ( a kind of palm)

loans.name: Runela

texts.en:
34-year-old Runela engages in fishing. She has sold, fish, crabs and clams for more than 10 years now. She is married and has four young children. She is striving hard to improve her income. She lives in the town of Talibon.

She would like to avail a loan to purchase crab nets, weights and floater. These would serve as fuel that would help improve her on going catch. She continues to provide for the needs of her family and supports her children's respective studies, too.

Runela is determined that in the future, she would be productive in handling her main source of income successfully.

loans.use: to purchase crab net, weights and floater

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is a 32-year-old woman and lives in the municipality of Catigbian, Bohol. She is married with four children, ages 12, 9, 6 and 1-year-old whom she wanted to raise well. She wants to give them good educations. Emelyn ’s husband is a carpenter while she operates a small restaurant known as “carenderia”. She is good in cooking so she managed to start this small restaurant business. And this is the reason why she is asking for a loan.She needs an additional capital to buy food ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices and cooking oil. In the future, Emelyn dreams of improving this business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices and cooking oil

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hard-working woman who earns a living through fishing. Her work is done  by peddling fish to the neighbors in the community. She is also seeking ways to improve her quality of life so she wants to begin selling ice candy, as, at the moment,  ice candy sales are on the rise. 
She is married and has five children, whom two are still attending school.

She is asking for a loan from CEVI to purchase fishing net and ingredients like sugar and milk . In this way she hopes to improve her financial income. With that, she could able to prepares high volume of ice candy to cater the peak season. In that way, she could able to augment her income and start to invest other business opportunities.

Myrna is looking forward to continue improve her livelihood to support the needs of her growing children and also to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and ingredients like sugar and milk

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now at their adult age.

Jocelyn is engaged in powdered coffee processing and vending activity. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work in which the said amount is so helpful to meet their needs.

She has requested a loan to purchase additional coffee beans for her powdered coffee processing business. Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for almost four years.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes to expand her business to other nearby towns and cities.

loans.use: to purchase additional coffee beans.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets too tired to support her family. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. 

In addition to her project of concreting the pig pens, she is thinking of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Welly

texts.en: Welly is married and had six children lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidentalwith his family. He is operating his own farm to make a living. To improve his farm, he took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his banana plantation. In the future, he wants to expand his farm to secure better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es un campesino muy trabajador, honesto y honrado, se dedica a la apicultura, actividad que lleva desempeñan ando hace 6 años y en la cual ha encontrado excelentes resultados que no solo le dan para mantener a su familia, ha progresado a pequeños pasos pero se siente muy agradecido por los buenos resultados que ha obtenido.
Vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene tres hijos de 15, 10 y 6 años de edad.
Su principal sueño es mantener el negocio con el cual está brindando educación a sus seres amados y en un futuro comprar una vivienda, una fruta de sus esfuerzo y trabajo y la cual con orgullo pueda heredarla a sus hijos.
Pensando en mejorar sus ventas y aumentar su utilidad el señor Jaime solicita un préstamo para la construcción de más cajones (ver foto) con los cuales desarrolla su actividad y comprar materia prima para el desarrollo de su actividad de producción de miel.
texts.en:
Jaime is a very hardworking, honest and honorable farmhand who works in agriculture, an activity that he has engaged in for 6 years and in which he has obtained excellent results. This has not only enabled him to support his family, it's also enabled him to progress little by little and he feels very grateful for the outcome that he's achieved.

He cohabitates with his partner and has three children ages 15, 10, and 6. His big dream is to keep going with the business with which he's providing an education to his loved ones and purchase a home in the future. This would be the reward for his efforts and his work and would be something that he could proudly pass on to his children.

Jaime is requesting a loan to build more of the boxes (see photo) that he uses to do his work and also buy raw materials to develop his honey production, with the goal of improving his sales and revenue.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for boxes (see photo), he's a honey producer

loans.name: Maria Rubiela

texts.es:
Maria es una luchadora mujer de 60 años de edad, responsable, honesta, honrada, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene un hijo adolescente de 19 años de edad, el cual quiere apoyar para que estudie y se convierta en un profesional en el área que elija, se dedica a atender un negocio de venta de abarrotes cuanta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio.

Pensando en que se encuentra en temporada alta la seora María quiere solicitar un préstamo para aprovecharla de la mejor manera, dicho dinero será para la compra de surtido de snacks, dulces, chocolates, frituras, bebidas y cerveza.

El préstamo se convertirá fundamental para la cliente ya que de las ganancias espera pagar la matrícula de su amado hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking 60 year old woman who's responsible, honest, honorable and cohabitates with her partner. They have a 19 year old teenage son who they want to help to continue his studies and become a professional in the field of his choice. She runs a grocery store and has 10 years of experience in this business.

With the busy season approaching Maria wants to request a loan to take advantage of the season, said loan would go towards buying an assortment of snacks, candies, chocolates, fried foods, beverages and beer.

The loan will be fundamental for her because she hopes to use the profits to pay for her beloved son's tuition.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of snacks, candies, chocolates, fried foods, beverages and beer for the New Year's season.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
La socia Lida sigue dedicándose al trabajo como contadora, este trabajo es su pasión, y ella esta gustosa de tener su estudio contable, ahora ella desea implementar su oficina para poder brindar un mejor servicio  a sus clientes.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar sillas y estantería.
La socia está muy agradecida y contenta por  el crédito, ya que ahora ella podrá mejorar su oficina, y continuar con sus proyecciones de vida.
texts.en:
The partner Lida continues to make a living working as an accountant. This work is her passion and she is happy to have her accounting office. Now she wants to improve her office in order to offer a better service to her customers.

The partner is requesting a loan in order to buy chairs and bookshelves.

The partner is very grateful and content with the loan, since now she will be able to improve her office and continue with her life projections.

loans.use: to buy chairs and bookshelves.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 53 years old. She’s married and is dedicated to trade in fruit and vegetables in Otavalo city’s market, which is located in southern Imbabura. This population is mostly indigenous. She’s mother of four children, all of them grown.

She’ll use the loan to purchase vegetables and fruits and increase her shop’s products. The most demanded products are apples, onions, and oranges. The loan will allow to her to buy directly from the producer and avoid intermediaries. In this way, she can increase her income and profits.

She works all week, starting at 7am or 8am, and finishes at 5pm, depending on the day. Her shop is renowned because she has been working there almost 30 years. 

Francisca and her husband will be happy with your support, and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits and increase her shop’s products.

loans.name: Alba Sorelly

texts.es:
Sorelly es una mujer de 37 años de edad, una mujer que quiere salir adelante, ella es soltera, se dedica a confeccionar, buscar por todos los medios posibles dinamizar su profesión, salir adelante, ella anteriormente era empleada una experiencia muy nutritiva pero que no quiere repetir, ella es feliz siendo su propia jefe y batalladora todas las peleas necesarias para mantener su estilo de vida con la cual se siente muy a gusto y más que puede ayudar al ser más amado por ella su madre.
Su principal sueño es tener una línea de ropa deportiva, un sueño que está próximo a cumplir pero necesita de tu apoyo, un pequeño impulso económico para comprar una máquina plana y telas para confeccionar.
Ella es humilde pero tiene toda la disposición y ganas de trabajar por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Sorelly is a 37 year old woman, a woman who wants to get ahead. She's single and her job is producing clothes. She's looking for any way possible to spark her business and move forward. Previously she was an employee, it was a very enriching experience but she doesn't want to repeat it, as she's happy being her own boss and she'll fight every battle she needs to in order to keep up the standard of living that she's very comfortable with. She's especially happy about being able to help the person she loves the most, her mother.

Her big dream is to have her own line of athletic apparel, a dream that she's on the verge of reaching but she needs your support, a small financial push to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics for making clothes. She's humble but she has the attitude and the desire to work for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and fabrics to produce her clothing line.

loans.name: Abdurasheed

texts.en:
Abdurasheed is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, Abdurasheed would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support and a 47,420 NGN loan he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abdurasheed will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to store his maize at harvest, then sell it at a later date at a higher price.

loans.name: Rosa De Jesus

texts.es:
Rosa, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, debido a la escasees económica que vivía su familia, actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, es madre de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian y uno trabaja, económicamente dependen de ella sus hijos y esposo.   

Rosa desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta coronas y flores, ella aprendió este negocio de su mama,  aparte de este negocio se dedica al comercio de carne de cerdo, para poder comercializar sus productos  se desplaza por  toda la ciudad caminando aproximadamente 8 km en el día.

Rosa utilizara el préstamo para ampliar más su negocio y comprara diversidad de listones, papel celofán, canastas entre otros material que se utiliza para la elaboración de flores. Ella espera aumentar sus ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.

Rosa sueña con poder ayudar a culminar los estudios de sus hijos para que sean profesionales, con el préstamo ella espera mejorar su negocio y tener un local fijo donde tenga todos sus productos y lo lograra mediante la inversión que ara con este préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosa, aged 45, studied up to sixth grade due to her family's poor financial circumstances. She is currently married and her husband works in agriculture and raising cattle. She is the mother of three children, of whom two are studying and one is working. Her children and husband depend on her financially.

For two years, Rosa has been selling garlands and flowers. She learned this business from her mother. Apart from this business, she also sells pork. In order to sell her products she moves throughout the entire city, walking approximately 8 km every day.

Rosa will use the loan to expand her business further and buy a range of ribbons, tissue paper, baskets, etc., which she will use for flower arrangements. She hopes to increase her sales and use the earnings to improve her and her family's quality of life.

Rosa dreams of being able to help her children complete their studies so that they can become professionals. With the loan, she hopes to improve her business and have a fixed location in which to store all of her products. She will do this using the investment from this loan.

loans.use: to expand her business further and buy a range of ribbons, tissue paper, baskets, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La socia Rita es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora ella se dedica  a brindar servicio de enseñanza en una institución pública. Con esta actividad sustenta su hogar.

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Hatun Sayhua”, tiene 55 años de edad, su sueño de la socia es  progresar y mejorar sus servicios por el bien de nuestra niñez.
Rita solicito el préstamo para comprar  cartulinas, plumones y cuadernos.

La socia está contenta  con el préstamo porque así ella seguirá adelante y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas acordadas previamente.
texts.en:
Rita is an enterprising and hard-working woman who works, teaching in a public institution. With this work she supports her household.

This member belongs to the communal bank "Hatun Sayhua". She is 55 years old and her dream is to improve her services for the good of our children. She is asking for the loan to buy poster board, felt pens and notebooks.

Rita is happy with the loan because with it she will continue forging ahead. She promises to make her payments on the agreed upon schedule.

loans.use: to buy poster board, felt pens and notebooks.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс молодой отец двоих маленьких детишек. Детям 4 и 1.5 года. Они прекрасные детишки. Фирдавс заботливый и жизнелюбивый отец. Он работает учителем в средней школе. Фирдавс еще учится в университете, он хочет получить высшую образованию. Фиравс зарабатывает на обучения, и кормить семью. Ему нелегко обеспечить семью с заработной платы учителя, но Фирдавс терпеливый человек. Он не любить сдаваться и старается идти вперед. Фирдавс просит кредит для оплаты за обучения. Из-за нехватки денежных средств, он был вынужден, обратится за кредитом. Фирдавс верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Поддержите Фирдавса!
texts.en: Firdavs is a young father of two small children. His children are 4 and 1.5 years old. They are beautiful kids. Firdavs is a caring and happy father. He works as a secondary school teacher. Firdavs still attends a university and wants to obtain a higher education. Firdavs earns a living by teaching and provides for his family. It is difficult for him to provide for the family with a teacher's salary, but Firdavs is a patient man. He does not like to give up and always tries to move forward. Firdavs is requesting this loan to pay for his education. Due to a shortage in money, he had to request a loan. Firdavs believes in You and Your support. Please support Firdavs!

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Nuska

texts.ru: Нуска  52 года. Она из района Яван. Нуска занимается растениеводством. Сеет на своем земельном участке пшеницу. Сезон их работы начинается ранней весной, они собирают зимний урожай, обрабатывают землю и сажают весенний урожай. В начале осени они собрали посаженный урожай и теперь активно готовятся к осеннему посеву. Нуска просит кредит, чтобы закупить нужное количество минеральных удобрений, горючей смеси и семян. Такие продукты помогут ей скорее обработать землю и посадить урожай. Нуска верит и надеется, что они получат богатый урожай и их труд не остается без награды.
texts.en: Nuska is 52 years old. She is from the Yavan district. Nuska is involved in farming. She plants wheat on her plot of land. Their work season starts in early spring and continues with the winter harvest picking, land cultivation and planting of spring crop. They picked the planted crop at the beginning of autumn and are now preparing for the autumn planting. Nuska is requesting this loan to buy the necessary quantity of mineral fertilizers, fuel and seeds. These items will help her cultivate the land faster and plant her crop. Nuska believes and hopes that they will obtain a rich harvest, and their labor will be rewarded.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel and seeds

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia Justina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Gracias a esta actividad saca delante a su familia.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Hatun Sayhua”, tiene 36  años de edad, su sueño de la socia es  progresar y ampliar su negocio, por esa razón solicito el préstamo.
Justina solicito el préstamo para comprar  cuyes y gallinas.
La socia esta agradecida con los inversionista de KIVA , ya que le ayudaran a conseguir sus metas, ella se compromete a pagar su cuotas en el plazo debido.
texts.en:
Justina is an enterprising and hardworking woman. She works in the breeding and sales of animals. Thanks to this occupation she is raising her family.

She belongs to the communal bank “Hatun Sayhua”; she is 36 years old. Her dream is to progress and expand her business; for that reason she applied for the loan.

Justina applied for the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens. She is grateful to KIVA investors, since they will help her achieve her goals. She agrees to pay the fees within the established timeframe.

loans.use: buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
La socia Teofila es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales como ovejas y vacas. Gracias a esta actividad saca delante a su familia.

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Hatun Sayhua”, tiene 45   años de edad, el sueño de la socia es incrementar las cabeza de ganado que tiene para poder tener mas ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Teofila solicito el préstamo para comprar granos y heno.

La socia esta agradecida con los inversionista de KIVA , ya que le ayudaran a conseguir sus metas, ella se compromete a pagar su cuotas en el plazo debido.
texts.en:
Member Teofila is an enterprising and hard-working woman. She raises animals like sheep and cows. Thanks to this work, she is helping her family to forge ahead.

This member belongs to the communal bank Hatun Sayhua. She is 45 years old, and her dream is to increase the heads of cattle she has in order to have more revenue and improve the condition of her life.

Teofila is requesting this loan to purchase grain and hay. This member is grateful for her loans through Kiva because they have helped her to meet her goals. She promises to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase grain and hay.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
La socia Narcisa es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y ovinos.
Gracias a esta actividad saca delante a su familia.

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Hatun Sayhua”, tiene 46  años de edad, su sueño de la socia es  progresar e incrementar sus animales, por esa razón solicito el préstamo.
Narcisa solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz y alfalfa.

La socia esta agradecida con los inversionista de KIVA , ya que le ayudaran a conseguir sus metas, ella se compromete a pagar su cuotas en el plazo debido.
texts.en:
The member Narcisa is an enterprising and hardworking woman. She works raising small animals and sheep. Thanks to this occupation she is able to raise her family.

She belongs to the communal bank “Hatun Sayhua”; she is 46 years old. Her dream is to progress and increase her animals; for that reason she applied for the loan.

Narcisa applied for the loan to buy corn and alfalfa.

The member is grateful to KIVA investors, since they will help her achieve her goals. She agrees to pay the fees within the established timeframe.

loans.use: buy corn and alfalfa.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 46-year-old woman who lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is a mother of two children, one of adult age and a fourteen-year-old child. Her husband is involved in agriculture. Three years ago, Elvira successfully started a rice retailing business.

Elvira dreams of being a successful businesswoman in the future because she wants to have a better and more comfortable way of life. To do this, she has applied for a 30,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy rice from farmers and sell it to merchants. In this way, she will be able to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy rice from farmers and sell it to merchants.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es: John de 40 años se ha dedicado toda su vida a la venta de pescados pero hace poco decidió complementar su actividad con la venta CD de música y afiches, él está casado y su punto de venta está ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, allí atiende todos los días a partir de las 9 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. a centenares de transeúntes y clientes fijos, así mismo los vecinos del barrio donde reside también le realizan encargos de sus productos. En la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar variedad de pescados; mojarra, bocachico, bagre, tilapia entre otros, puesto que su capital le es insuficiente para contar con un inventario más surtido y mediante esta financiación logrará fortalecer esa debilidad.  A futuro John espera tener otros puntos de venta para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: John, 40 years old, has worked his whole life selling fish but a little while ago he decided to complement his work with the sale of music CDs and posters. He is married and his sales point is located in the center of the city of Baranquilla. There, he works every day from 9 am to 6 pm serving hundreds of passers-by and regular customers, as well as for the neighbors in the neighborhood where he also lives, he does deliveries of his products. Currently, he applied for a loan, a Kiva loan, an opportunity to become part of the financial world through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase a variety of fish: mojarra [sea bream], boccacio, catfish, tilapia, and others, since his capital isn't enough for him to have a more well-stocked inventory and through this loan he will manage to strengthen this weakness. In the future, John hopes to have other sales points to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish: mojarra [sea bream], boccacio, catfish, tilapia, and others.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, de 38 años de edad, logro estudiar hasta sexto grado, esta acompañada y su esposo es agricultor por cuenta propia y jornalero, tienen 4 hijos de los cuales solo 2 dependen económicamente de ellos, en su casa solo vive ella, su esposo y sus hijos.

Marina, tiene un molino de nixtamal desde hace 1 año, esta actividad la aprendió con su esposo ya que el era el operador del molino de un hermano y ella decidió poner su propio molino para ayudarle a su esposo con los ingresos del hogar, anteriormente ella tenia una tienda frente a la escuela del cantón pero ya no se pudo sostener por las pocas ventas, ahora además de su molino ha iniciado nuevamente con la tienda esperando que la clientela que posee con el molino haga que crezca, estas actividades las realiza en su casa y su esposo le ayuda en con el negocio por las tardes después de su trabajo.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar azúcar, arroz, aceite, gaseosa, etc. porque tiene muy poca variedad y hay muchos artículos por los que las personas de la comunidad le preguntan y ella no los tiene, al surtir su negocio estará mejorando los ingresos para su familia.

Marina sueña con volver a tener su tienda como en el pasado, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y ayudar a su esposo a que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, este deseo podrá lograrlo con el préstamo, ya que estará incrementando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marina, aged 38, studied up to sixth grade. Her husband is a self-employed farmer and day labourer. They have four children, of whom two are financial dependants, and she lives with her husband and children.

Marina has had a corn mill for one year. She learned this activity with her husband, as he operated one of his brother's mills, and she decided to set up her own mill in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She previously owned a shop opposite the district school but was unable to maintain it due to low sales. She has now restarted the business along with her mill, hoping that the mill's customers will grow the business. She does these activities at home and her husband helps her in the afternoons after finishing work.

She will use the loan to buy sugar, rice, oil, soda, etc. due to the small variety of goods she has. There are many items that people in the community ask for but that she does not have. Supplying her business will improve her family's income.

Marina dreams of having a shop again as she did in the past, in order to provide her family with a better quality of life and to help her husband so that their children can complete their studies. This dream can be achieved using the loan as it will increase her income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, soda, etc.

loans.name: Julissa

texts.es:
Julissa es una joven estudiante de la carrera Tecnología del Diseño y Desarrollo de Prendas de Vestir (Diseño de Modas). Decidió estudiar esa carrera porque ama la ropa y le apasiona el arte. Le gusta mucho crear, innovar y siempre hacer algo diferente que los demás. 

Ella siente que esa carrera la beneficiará a ella como persona porque habrá logrado uno de sus más anhelados sueños que es  ser una gran diseñadora  y fotógrafa con su propia marca y tienda de ropa. Espera ser reconocida en diferentes países.

Ella sabe que su familia, se sentirá muy orgullosa de ella, porque le dieron la confianza y el apoyo para lograr cumplir su meta. Aún le faltan 2 años para culminar su carrera. Cuando finalice su carrera le gustaría trabajar en la empresa ZARA, en la sección de imagen y diseño de las prendas.

Le va muy bien en sus estudios, pero tiene miedo que la falta de dinero impida que termina sus estudios. Es por ese motivo que recurre a KIVA, para que la puedan apoyar con este préstamo y permitir que ella pueda lograr su desarrollo profesional. Ella vive junto a su padre y sus abuelos. Su madre la abandonó desde muy pequeña. La situación económica de su familia es muy crítica, ya que su padre no cuenta con un trabajo estable.

Este préstamo lo utilizaría para el pago de las mensualidades de su carrera y de esta manera ayudaría a su padre económicamente. Logrando este crédito, se sentirá orgullosa de si misma, porque podrá cumplir con terminar su carrera en el tiempo esperado y le permitirá lograr sus grandes sueños.

Julissa, desea expresarles unas palabras a KIVA: "Me siento feliz de que existan personas que ayudan a cumplir los sueños de los demás, que a veces por cosas de la vida, es difícil o muy difícil pero no imposible de realizar, porque basta con tener fe; pasión por lo que haces; mucho esfuerzo y ante cualquier obstáculo, nunca rendirse. Siempre pensar en ese sueño, tan anhelado sueño que uno desea cumplir. Estoy muy agradecida de corazón, aunque no los conozco, pero les agradezco por ayudarme. Les prometo que no se arrepentirán por ayudarme, porque estoy segura que volverán a escuchar de mi, ya con mi sueño realizado. Todo lo lograré gracias a ustedes y su ayuda que es muy importante y significativa para mi. Muchas gracias KIVA por todo lo que hacen por mi."
texts.en:
Julissa is a young student in the Clothing Design and Development Technology program (Fashion Design). She decided to study for this degree because she loves clothing and is passionate about art. She loves to create, innovate and always does something different than other people. She feels that this degree will help her as a person because she will have achieved one of her most desired dreams, which is to be a great designer and photographer with her own brand and clothing store. She hopes to be known in different countries. She knows her family will be very proud of her, because they give her the confidence and the support to be able to achieve her goal. She still has 2 years left to finish her degree. When she finishes her degree, she would like to work in the business ZARA, in the image and clothing design section. Her studies are going very well but she is afraid that the lack of money will prevent her from finishing her studies. For this reason, she comes to Kiva so that you can support her with this loan and allow her to be able to achieve her professional development. She lives with her father and grandparents. Her mother left her when she was very little. The family economic situation is very critical since her father doesn't have a steady job.

This loan would be used to pay the fees for her degree and in this way would help her father economically. Getting this loan, she will feel proud of herself because she will be able to finish her degree in the expected time and it will allow her to achieve her big dreams.

Julissa wants to say a few words to Kiva: "I am happy that there are people who help others achieve their dreams, that sometimes for things in life, it is difficult or very difficult but not impossible to achieve them, because it is enough to have faith, passion for what you do, with a lot of effort and in front of any obstacle, never give up. Always think of this dream, this dream so desired that one wants to achieve. I am very grateful from my heart, although I don't know you, but I am thankful to you for helping me. I promise that you will not regret helping me, because I am sure that you will hear from me again, once my dream is realized. I will manage to do everything thanks to you and your help that is very important in significant for me. Thanks a lot to Kiva for all that you do for me.

loans.use: to continue her studies in clothing design and become an excellent designer.

loans.name: Roqiya

texts.ru:
Рокия жена, мама и молодая бабушка троеих внуков. Ей 39 лет. Семейная жизнь дочки не сложилась и она вернулась обратно в родительский дом. Ее муж на заработках заграницей. Рокия с дочкой занимается земледелием, работает в колхозе. Вместе с соседями и близко живущими людьми, которые работают в колхозе, сажают урожай и собирают его, получая от работы прибыль. 
   Сейчас осень и Рокия готовится к осеннему посеву. Она на деньги от кредита купит семян, горючую смесь для трактора и минеральные удобрения. Земля почти обработана, остается только посадить урожай. Рокия ждет хорошего урожая и Вашей поддержки.
texts.en:
Roqiya is a wife, mother and young grandmother of three grandchildren. She is 39 years old. Her daughter's family life did not work out, and she returned to her parents' home. Her husband works abroad. Roqiya and her daughter are involved in farming and work at a collective farm. They plant crops together with their neighbors and others working at the collective farm, pick them and earn a profit from their work.

It is now autumn, and Roqiya is preparing for the autumn planting. She will use this loan to buy seeds, fuel for the tractor and mineral fertilizers. The land is practically cultivated, and she only has to plant the crops. Roqiya awaits a good harvest and Your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fuel for the tractor and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Don Bosco Group

texts.es: Julia tiene 53 años de edad es soltera con dos hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales naturales y ganoderma hace dos años. Años atrás de dedicaba a su hogar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más productos naturales y ganaderma para poder atender los pedidos que tiene por atender. El grupo “DON BOSCO” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Julia es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste buzo de animal print
texts.en: Julia is 53 years old she is single with two dependent children. She sells natural medicinal products and growing ganoderma since two years ago. Some years ago she was taking care of her home. She will invest the loan in buying more natural products and ganoderma to meet the orders that she has to attend. The group "DON BOSCO" thanks the Kiva investors for their support. Julia is the third on the left side.

loans.use: to buy more natural products and ganoderma.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mohammed has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Mohammed would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Mohammed can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Mohammed will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Mohammed is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Markus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Markus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Markus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Markus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Markus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sorelis Marina

texts.es:
Sorelis es una joven que se dedica a la actividad de cría de animales, negocio que inicio por necesidad económica dado que vive con su esposo y no quiere ser una carga, quiere producir y ayudar con los gastos de su caluroso hogar.
Su propósito central es usar todos los recursos para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y satisfacer sus deseos, mientras su esposo se encarga de las necesidades principales.
Sorelis quiere mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ventas, generar más recursos para cambiar el techo y piso de su vivienda, pero quiere que todas estas adecuaciones salgan de la rentabilidad de su negocio por ello quiere hacerlo crecer.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, vitaminas, alimento de engorde y vacunas.
texts.en:
Sorelis is a young woman who makes a living raising animals, a business she started out of economic necessity given that she lives with her husband and doesn't want to be a burden. She wants to produce and help with the expenses of her warm home.

Her central goal is to use all of the resources to improve the conditions of her residence and satisfy their desires, while her husband takes care of the principal necessities.

Sorelis wants to improve her income; increase her sales; and generate more resources to change the roof and floor of her residence, but she wants all these adjustments to come from the profits of her work, so she wants to make it grow.

She requests a loan in order to buy pigs, vitamins, food for fattening, and vaccines.

loans.use: to buy pigs, vitamins, food for fattening, and vaccines in order to respond to the end of the year demand.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El  señor Carmelo es soltero, se dedica a la olería, vive con su mamá, él es sostén de su familia a través del trabajo que hace, se inició en el rubro hace más de 16  años, con su papa que le enseño todo lo referente a la actividad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de leña en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir con su producción en olería. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
Carmelo is single, he works in the smell industry, and he lives with his mother, he sustains his family through his work. He started with this activity more than sixteen years ago; his father taught him everything about it.

He is requesting this loan to buy firewood in bulk to be able to continue producing bricks. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving to continue growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy firewood in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: María de 24 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 1 año de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas para luego venderlas a sus números clientes que la visitan, siendo así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha brindado los insumos básicos necesarios para su pequeño hijo, así como cumpliendo con los gastos del hogar en los que recibe el apoyo de su esposo. María desea invertir en la compra de variedad de semilla, abonos, lámina, madera, clavos, etc., para mejorar la variedad y la calidad de sus cultivos así como también realizar unas pequeñas reparaciones en el techo de su vivienda, es por eso que solicita un crédito  FUSAI  para invertir en: compra de semilla, abono, laminas, clavos, madera, para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Mary, 24 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and one-year-old child. She is a hardworking woman who makes a living growing vegetables to sell to the many clients who visit her. Through this, she generates an income which has provided basic supplies needed for her little son, and meeting home expenses, for which she receives the support of her husband.

Mary wants to invest in the purchase of a variety of seeds, fertilizers, sheets, wood, nails, etc., to improve the variety and quality of her crops as well as make some small repairs on the roof of her home. Thus, she requests a FUSAI loan to invest in: the purchase of seed, fertilizer, sheets, nails, and wood, to improve her crops.

loans.use: to invest in: the purchase of seed, fertilizer, sheets, nails, and wood to improve her crops.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 40-year-old married woman from the town of Calape, Bohol. Two years ago this woman started her own business to be able to help her husband with their financial stability. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells variety of goods. She works everyday running this business, while her husband is working in their farm. 

The profits she earns from her sales aren't enough for this woman who dreams about sustainability. She wants to improve their way of living, to have enough money to provide their daily needs such as food, personal care products and a variety of beverages. She even needs money for her children’s school payment. Thus, she has two teenage children; they are 17 and 15 years old.

That's why she needs to uplift her earnings. With the help of the loan she is requesting; she will be able to buy a variety of stock such as chips, candies, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink and rice. With this her profit will improve.

loans.use: to buy chips, candies, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee and rice.

loans.name: Ma. Salome

texts.en: Ma. Salome lives a simple life with her family in a town of Calape in Bohol, Philippines. She is married and the mother of seven children. Five of these children are school aged children; ages 18, 16, 14, 10 and 6 years old. Her husband does fishing business to raise them, while Ma. Salome is engaged in hog raising business. And this will give her the opportunity to enhance their livelihood. Aside from raising pigs, she also sells fish to the community that it enables her to help her husband in providing their daily needs. Her goal in life is to expand her hog raising business to have enough money to give a quality education to her children. By the help of a loan, she will buy additional piglets and feed as well. She will also buy fishing nets to enhance the catch of her husband and they will be able to sell more fish.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed as well; fishing nets

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, 51, lives in Panglao, Bohol. She is married and has three grown children.

For the past fourteen years Mary Jane has sold snack foods to neighbors and town dwellers. Her snacks include such items as puffed corn, chicharron (fried pork rind), banana cue (deep-fried banana with caramelized sugar) and camote cue (deep-fried sweet potato). The main challenge to her business is transportation.

Mary Jane decided to join Kiva's field partner CEVI to access its loans and boost her business. With a 10,000 PHP loan she wants to buy more supplies of flour, cooking oil, bananas and sweet potatoes to make her snacks. This would definitely help her see her business succeed.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of flour, cooking oil, bananas and sweet potatoes to make her snacks.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: Marichu has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like her. Marichu is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to mount a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Elizabeth is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Carlos Rosendo

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 38 años de edad es unido tiene 5 hijos que estudian en el colegio. Se dedica a prestar servicios profesional como procesos financieros, en dinero lo solicita para la compra de bienes como son: una refrigeradora y una lavadora para uso personal.

Con el credito desea comprar al contado para que le resulte mas barato. La compra la va a realizar en Ventanas, el sueño de carlos es tener casa propia para vivir con los hijos y su conviviente. En los tiempos libre les gusta hacer deporte con los hijos y los vecinos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 38, is married and has five children who study in the college, He makes a living offering professional services such as financial processes.

The money he is requesting is for buying goods, namely a refrigerator and a washing machine for personal use. With the loan, he wants to buy with cash because it will be cheaper. He will make the purchase in Ventanas.

The dream of Carlos is to have his own house in which to live with his wife and children. In his spare time, he likes to play sports with his children and the neighbors.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a washing machine.

loans.name: Filomena Seneyda

texts.es:
Filomena, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, está acompañada y vive con su pareja trabaja como empleado de una ferretería y tienen dos hijos que están estudiando. 

Filomena, se dedica a vender verduras en el mercado municipal de su ciudad, desde niña trabajó en el mercado junto a su madre y ahora ella tuvo la oportunidad de tener su propio puesto y vender verduras. 

Filomena, necesita el préstamo para comprar verduras para vender, porque se acerca la temporada navideña y la gente buscara verduras para la elaboración de las comidas típicas de la época. 

Los sueños de Filomena, son que sus hijos estudien y se conviertan en profesionales y logren tener una vida llena de oportunidades.
texts.en:
Filomena, 33 years old, is a very hard working and tenacious woman and lives with her partner who works at a hardware store. They have two children who are studying.

Filomena sells vegetables at the municipal market of her city. Since she was a child she worked in the market with her mother and now she has the opportunity to have her own stall and sell vegetables.

Filomena needs the loan to purchase vegetables to sell because the Christmas season is getting close and people will look for vegetables for the preparation of the traditional dishes of the season.

Filomena's dreams are that her children study and become professionals and are able to have a life full of opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Qapaq Niño De Huaynapata - Coya Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QAPAQ NIÑO DE HUAYNAPATA - COYA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Qoya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Victoria, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de frutas, la socia continua vendiendo sus frutas como platanos, naranjas entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera obtener más ganancias mediante su trabajo  para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar más fruta.
Los  socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the “QAPAQ NIÑO DE HUAYNAPATA - COYA” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Qoya, which is in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

One of the borrowers, Victoria, continues working in her fruit sales business. She is still selling fruits including bananas and oranges to her customers who seek her out. She is an enterprising woman who hopes to obtain more income through her work so that she can keep supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy more fruit.

The borrowers feel grateful for the loan and they pledge to complete the payments as scheduled.
The borrowers who appear in the attached photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy more fruit.

loans.name: Maria Araceli

texts.en:
Maria Araceli is single, 62 years old and a woman with determination. In spite of the obstacles that she has encountered in her life, she is still able to move forward and continue dreaming of a good life for her family.

For the past ten years Maria Araceli has sold groceries from her sari-sari, or small general store, to the community of Clarin, Bohol. She has applied for a 25,000 loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI
to buy such commodities as canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, chips, candies, biscuits, chocolate bars, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, sugar and drinks. She hopes that by increasing her stock her earnings will increase.

Maria Araceli is resolved to improve her livelihood so as to help sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy extra groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Grupo Familia Unida Group

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 27 años de edad está feliz mente  casada con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 7 y 15 años, está familia vive en una comunidad del Cantón Camache.
Juana (la tercera de derecha a izquierda) es una mujer perseverante y digna de admirarse, ella se fuerza todos los días para que a su familia no le falte nada, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y refacciones en las principales calles de su comunidad, con este negocio lleva ella 5 años de realizarlo.
Juana gracias  al buen empeño que le dedica a  su negocio ha logrado obtener mucha clientela, por esa razón se ve a la necesidad de agilizar su trabajo y ahorrar tiempo para poder abastecer a todos los clientes,  a raíz de esta necesidad ella solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra la compra de una estufa industrial.
Su mayor anhelo es contar con su propio local de negocio y fortalecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is a 27-year-old woman. She is happily married with a beautiful family of three children between 7 and 15 years old. This family lives in a community in Cantón Camache.

Juana (the third from right to left) is a woman who is perseverant and worthy of admiration. She makes an effort every day so that her family lacks nothing. She makes a living selling tortillas and spare parts in the main streets of her community. She has been working at this business for 5 years. 

Juana, thanks to the good effort she makes in her business, has managed to get many customers. For this reason she needs to streamline her work and save time in order to supply all of the customers. As a result of this need she requests a loan that she will use to purchase an industrial stove. Her greatest desire is to have her own business location and to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove to make tortillas

loans.name: Ana Olga

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 42 años de edad con una historia muy particular, inicio un negocio de venta de artículos para enamorados, como peluches, cartas memorativas, globos, vasos, anchetas entre otro, aprendió todo acerca de su negocio en Internet, en este sitió observo muchos videos y se motivó a iniciar dicho trabajo y es gracias a esta empresa que genera recursos para mantener a su familia, partiendo de la idea que es cabeza de familia ya que se separó de su esposo y es madre de una adolescente de 19 años de edad.
Toda su actividad la realiza en su hogar, pero sueña con poder tener un local comercial, bien hermoso, dotado con todo tipo de productos para enamorados.
Ana se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para hacer empaques de regalo, abastecer su negocio con peluches, globos y chocolates.
texts.en:
Ana is a 42 year old woman with a very unusual story, she started a business selling romantic items, such as stuffed animals, souvenir letters, balloons, glasses, and gift baskets among other things. She learned everything about her business on the internet, having watched lots of videos on a website and getting motivated to get started in that type of work. 

Thanks to this business she generates income to support her family, since she's the head of her familly after separating from her husband. She's the mother of a 19 year old teenager. She does all work in her home, but she dreams of having a beautiful retail location stocked with all types of products for people in love.

Ana is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials to make gift packaging and stock her business with stuffed animals, balloons, and chocolates.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make Christmas gift packaging, and stock stuffed animals, balloons, and chocolates.

loans.name: Isiya

texts.en:
Isiya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to its support, he is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

In the past Isiya would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support and a 41,753 NGN loan, he will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for it at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Isiya now has the chance to actualize his dream to grow his farm for himself and family members. He would like to use his extra income to provide employment on his farm to members of his community.

loans.use: to store his maize at harvest time, then sell it at a later date at a higher price.

loans.name: Matilde Reyna

texts.es:
Matilde, de 52 años de edad, está casada, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos que estudian y le ayudan a su padre en los trabajos agrícolas. 

Matilde, es ama de casa y se dedica a los oficios del hogar, ella también es muy trabajadora y le ayuda a su esposo con los trabajos del hogar, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa donde vende todo tipo de productos comestibles, así como también vende rinso, jabón, lejía, etc.

Matilde, necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, pan, café y detergentes, para aprovechar la temporada de navidad en donde se vende más.
 
Los sueños de Matilde, son poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Matilde, 52, is married and lives with her husband and her four children, who go to school and help their father with agricultural work.

Matilde is a homemaker and works doing the household chores. She is also very hardworking and helps her husband with work around the house. She has a small store in her house where she sells all sorts of food products as well as laundry detergent, soap, bleach, etc.

Matilde needs this loan to buy rice, beans, bread, coffee, and detergents, so that she can make the most of the Christmas season, when sales increase.

Matilde's dream is to improve her income in order to have a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, bread, coffee, and detergents, to make the most of the Christmas season, when sales increase.

loans.name: Tersa

texts.en:
For quite a period of time now, Tersa has been running a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities, ranging from beverages, seasonings, noodles, and canned goods, to toiletries. She owns a house, and in the front of it is situated her sari-sari store, which caters mostly to locals in her place. She is a married woman who has three children, and she resides in the town of Antequera. In addition to keeping her store, she weaves native baskets made of buri (palm).

She would like to improve her earnings by acquiring materials for weaving, and additional capital to purchase inventory for her store. Tersa has requested a loan to purchase groceries, drinks, and materials like wicker (pliable twigs), buli and nito ( varieties of palm).

loans.use: to purchase groceries, drinks, and materials like wicker (pliable twigs), buli and nito ( varieties of palm).

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a maize farmer from Barangwaje village. Dina is excited, because as a Babban Gona member, she has access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs. These will give her the chance to achieve high yields -- up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times higher than the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dina would have had to sell her maize at harvest (when the price of maize is at its lowest), to meet her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Dina can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until later in the season, when she can obtain the best price for her maize. She can expect to sell at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Dina no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Dina hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.pt:
Solteira de 31 anos de idade, mãe de 3 filhos dois quais os dois primeiros são orfãos de pai estudam e vivem com os familiares do falecido marido, estando ela apenas com a menor ainda bebe. Estudou ate oitava classe, vive a base de negocio e conta com ajuda do pai do filho menor. Está a repetir o credito pela quarta vez e os anteriores investiu no negocio e na construcao de sua casa, tendo sempre conseguido devolver com pontualidade.
Com este pretende comprar material de construcao para dar continuidade com a sua obra como, cimento, varões, areia etc.
Seu desejo e desenvolver mais o seu negocio, concluir a construcao da sua casa e mobilar, e melhorar as condiçoes do seu estabelecimento comercial.
Sente bastante feliz com a Hluvuku, porque lhe tem ajudado a organizar sua vida e realizar parte de seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Suzana is 31 years old and single. She has three children, two of whom have lost their father. They study and live with her late husband's family. Only her youngest child, who's a baby, is with her. She completed 8th grade and earns a livelihood through her business. She gets help from her young child's father. This is her 4th loan. The previous loans were for her business and to build her house, and she always repaid them in a timely fashion.
With this loan she intends to purchase construction supplies such as cement, rods, sand, etc., so that she can continue building her house.
Her wish is to further develop her business, finish building and furnishing her house, and improve the conditions of her place of business.
She feels happy with Hluvuku, because they have helped her organize her life and achieve part of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, sand, etc.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Saratu has the opportunity to attain a yield of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land. This is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest (when maize prices are at their lowest in the market), to meet her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Saratu can store her maize now. She can sell it at a future date at a price up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Saratu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Saratu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family. She looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Con la mentalidad de progresar salir adelante, ayudar incondicionalmente a su madre, el joven Juan Carlos quiere solicitar un préstamo  para invertir en su negocio de cría de pollos, el dinero será para la compra de 300 pollos y la construcción de un galpón para ubicar los animales. 
Su propósito es aumentar su producción y vender muchos animales.
texts.en: In order to get ahead and be able to help his mother unconditionally, young Juan Carlos is asking for a loan to invest in his business of raising chickens. He will use the loan to buy 300 chickens and build a coop for them. His goal is to increase his production and sell a lot of animals.

loans.use: to buy 300 chickens and build a coop.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dauda has the opportunity to attain a high yield -- up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times higher than the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dauda would have had to sell his maize at harvest (when the price of maize is at its lowest), to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Dauda can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season, when he can obtain the best price. He can expect to sell at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Dauda will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Dauda is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena and her family live in the small town of Calape, in Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has four children; they are 19, 17, 15 and 13 years old.

Her husband is a company worker, while Elena buys and sells fish. She has been doing this for five years to help her husband earn a living.
