Aside from selling fish, she also engages in a hog-raising business. Thus, she is asking a loan to buy fresh fish to sell and additional piglets to raise and feed as well.

In the future, she wishes to improve and expand her business to have enough money to send all her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to sell and additional piglets to raise and feed.

loans.name: Segundo Oswaldo

texts.es:
Segundo Oswaldo con 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, el cuál se encuentra de 04 y 06 años de edad, con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 10 años. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de pan llevar, así mismo se desempeña como peón agrícola. Solicita préstamo para invertir en los gastos de abono y mantenimiento de su finca de café. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Segundo Oswaldo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa,este es su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Segundo Oswaldo is 34 years old and lives with his partner and children in the Cañaris district, in the Ferreñafe province of the Lambayeque department of Peru. He has very good references, both personal and professional, from the area's inhabitants. The majority of the area's residents make a living in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Segundo Oswaldo works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. His coffee is between 4 and 6 years old, and he has more than 10 years of experience in this line of work. He also makes a living by growing basic food crops, as well as working as a farmhand.

He is requesting the loan to pay for the costs of fertilizer and maintenance of his coffee plantation. In this way, he will be able to make sufficient profit to improve his quality of life.

Segundo Oswaldo is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa: this is his second loan.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of fertilizer and maintenance of his coffee plantation

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Nura has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Nura would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Nura can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Nura will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Nura is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lid Isabel

texts.es:
Lid es una mujer de 50 años de edad que inicio una venta de alimentos fritos en las afueras de su casa por necesidad económica ya que se separó de su esposo, quedó como cabeza de familia y de inmediato se dio a la tarea de trabajar para generar recursos.
Su objetivo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y lograr una estabilidad económica, para ello necesita aumentar sus ventas pero no pueden producir mayor cantidad de alimentos puesto que no cuenta con los recursos para comprar la materia prima.
Pensando en mejorar en todos los aspectos de su negocio la señora Lid quiere solicitar un préstamo para realizar reformas locativas, tener un negocio mejor organizado, con sillas, mesas, manteles bonitos, e insumos para elaborar productos fritos.
texts.en:
Lid, 50, started her business selling fried foods outside of her home because she needed money when she separated from her spouse. She became the head of household and immediately started working to generate an income. Her goal is to improve her living conditions and achieve financial stability.

In order to do this she needs to increase her sales, but she can't make more food because she doesn't have the money for the ingredients. With the idea of improving all aspects of her business, Lid wants a loan to make repairs to her locale, organize the space, add chairs, tables and pretty tablecloths, and buy ingredients for her fried foods.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, nice tablecloths and ingredients for making meals.

loans.name: Rubiela

texts.es:
Rubiela es todo un ejemplo de madre, una persona que sin educación, solo con un sueño y mucha motivación saco a su familia adelante, una abundante familia conformada por 4 hijos adolescente y todo esto lo logro con un humilde negocio de venta de fritos, el cual le puso todo su empeño y amor.
Con el firme propósito se continuar con su negocio la señora Rubiela quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materia prima, principalmente aceite, maíz y carne con los cuales elabora empanadas, arepas de carne, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Rubiela is an exemplary mother. She doesn't have an education, but with a dream and a lot of motivation she has taken care of her abundant family, made up of 4 adolescents. All of this she has achieved with her humble business selling fried foods, into which she has put all of her dedication and love.

Rubiela will use the loan to continue her business, buying ingredients for her fried foods including oil, corn and meat which she uses to make empanadas, beef arepas and other products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make fried foods and meet end-of-year demand.

loans.name: Mahamud

texts.en:
Mahamud is a maize farmer from Dangambo Feleke village. As a Babban Gona member, Mahamud is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than that of the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mahamud would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Mahamud can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Mahamud no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Mahamud hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji has the opportunity to attain a yield of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest (when maize prices are at their lowest in the market), to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alhaji can store his maize and sell it at a future date at a better price. He can expect a price up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Alhaji is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ashiru

texts.en:
Ashiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ashiru has the opportunity to attain a yield of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land. This is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ashiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest (when maize prices are at their lowest in the market), to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ashiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for a better price. He can expect a price up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ashiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ashiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community, through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her early 40s, is married and has three children who are still in school. She has been a food vendor since 1992. She works from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm daily, and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rose's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loans. She used the profits to pay school fees, to repay loans, to build her own house and to cover household expenses. She will use this new loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her food business. She dreams of expanding her business into a hotel. Rose will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her food business.

loans.name: Ana Deisy

texts.es:
Ana, de 38 años de edad, no pudo asistir a la escuela, tiene 38 años de edad y está acompañada, su pareja es pescador artesanal, tiene 4 hijos que viven con ellos y todos están estudiando y solo ellos viven en casa. 

Ana, compra y vende mariscos desde hace 12 años, aprendió este negocio porque sus padres hacían lo mismo y así fue como ella opto por comercializar este producto; ella enviá los mariscos a vender al mercado de su comunidad y su hermana le ayuda a comercializarlos y su esposo es quien pesca y también arregla las redes de pesca y el horario de trabajo es de 4:00 a.m. 

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mariscos para poder abastecer a todos sus clientes. 

Ana, sueña con seguir trabajando para poder darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
38-year-old Ana was not able to attend school. She is in a relationship; her partner is an artisanal fisherman. She has 4 children who live with them, and they all go to school. They are the only ones who live at home.

Ana has bought and sold shellfish for the past 12 years. She learned the trade because her parents did the same, so she opted to sell this product too. She sends the shellfish to be sold at her community's market. Her sister helps her sell them, and her partner is the one who fishes. She also repairs the fishing nets. Her work schedule begins at 4am.

Ana needs the loan to buy more shellfish in order to provide for all of her customers.

Ana dreams of continuing to work so she can provide her children an education.

loans.use: to buy more shellfish in order to provide for all of her customers

loans.name: Brenda Xiomara

texts.es:
Brenda, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, su esposo tiene una moto-taxi y trasporta personas en la comunidad, tiene 3 hijos pero solo 2 de ellos están estudiando.

Brenda, vende hornea pan para vender desde hace 10 años, aprendió ese trabajo porque su mamá también hacía pan y ahora ella retomo el negocio; ella decidió seguir con la venta pues los clientes ya los tenia, ella elabora el pan 3 veces por semana y se involucra su hija y su esposo para hornearlo y su horario es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m. que termina de vender. 

Brenda, necesita el préstamo para construir un horno artesanal, porque el que tiene no es de ella y tiene que ir donde una vecina a hornear el pan. 

Brenda, sueña con ver a sus hijos graduarse de una carrera universitaria y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Brenda is 35 years old. She studied up to ninth grade. She is married and her husband has a motorcycle-taxi with which he transports people from the community. She has three children, but only two of them are attending school. Brenda has worked for 10 years baking bread to sell. She learned this job because her mother also used to make bread, and Brenda now took over the business. She decided to continue selling it, because she had the customers already. She makes bread three times a week, and her daughter and husband get also involved in baking it. Her schedule is from 8:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. when she finishes selling it. Brenda needs the loan to build a homemade oven, because the one she has is not hers and she has to go to her neighbor to bake the bread. Brenda dreams of seeing her children graduate with a college career and of improving her house.

loans.use: to build a homemade oven.

loans.name: Jhon Fredy

texts.es:
Jhon es un joven soltero de 23 años de edad, residente el municipio de Puerto Berrio, decidió emprender su camino buscando libertad financiera, formación personal y laboral, quiere lograr comprar una vivienda, adquirir bienes y activos con su propio esfuerzo.
Actualmente este joven se dedica a l venta de mercancía, repuesto de motocicletas para ser más exacto, no cuenta con mucho capital, pero quiere progresar en este mercado. Solicita un préstamo para comprar repuesto de motocicleta en cantidades para que salga más barata la compra y más rentable la venta, quiere aprovechar la temporada de fin de año donde las personas comúnmente realizan olas revisiones a sus motos para irse de vacaciones etc.
texts.en:
Jhon, 23, lives in the town of Puerto Berrio. He decided to go into business in order to achieve financial independence as well as personal and professional growth. He wants to buy a house and furniture through his own hard work.

Right now this young man sells motorcycle repair parts. He doesn't have much capital, but he wants to progress in this market. He asks for a loan to buy motorcycle repair parts in bulk so that they will be cheaper and more profitable. He wants to take advantage of the end of the year when people often make repairs to their vehicles in order to go on vacation, etc.

loans.use: to stock up on motorcycle repair parts to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Daniel is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Daniel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as for food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Daniel can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Daniel has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Daniel is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to improve his farming skills and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ashiru

texts.en:
Ashiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ashiru has the opportunity to attain a yield of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land. This is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ashiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest (when maize prices are at their lowest in the market), to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ashiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for a better price. He can expect a price up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ashiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ashiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dúo Monte Verde Group

texts.es:
Dúo Monte Verde
La señora Rosa María de 56 años de edad,quien es propietaria de un negocio de venta de ropa, en el cual vende variedad de productos de segunda mano vive solamente con su esposo y la madre de ella quien es por la persona por la que ella vela día con día ella aprovecha bien el tiempo siempre trata la manera de aprender cosas innovadoras por las que en una de ellas este año aprendió a hacer pasteles y eso le ha dado otra fuente de ingresos para su familia y espera que con responsabilidad y honestidad ella pueda solventar el crédito que ahora esta solicitando, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa de segunda mano para vender.
texts.en:
Monte Verde Duo

Rosa Maria, 56, is the owner of a business selling clothing. She has a variety of secondhand products.

She lives with her husband and her mother, who she looks out for every day. She takes good advantage of her time and is always trying to learn new things - this year, she learned to make cakes which is now another source of income for her family.

She hopes that with responsibility and honesty, she will be able to pay back the loan that she is requesting. She asks for a loan to buy secondhand clothing to resell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Patron De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Jerónimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Neri Bruna, la socia sigue con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera poder obtener más ganancias con su negocio para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo  arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, golosinas, gaseosas, aceite entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank “PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO”; This bank is located in the district of San Jeronimo, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. The member is Neri Bruna. She continues with her grocery store business. She is an enterprising woman who hopes to obtain more income with her business so she can continue supporting her family. She continues selling rice, sugar, milk, among other things, to the customers who request them, and this is the way she moves her family forward. Neri Bruna is requesting the loan to buy rice, sweets, sodas, oil, among other things. In general, the members are grateful to those who form part of this dream, and they promise to make their payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sweets, sodas, oil, among other things.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene hails from the town of Panglao. She raises hogs. She has used her earnings to manage the economy of her house. She has her own property, where she lives with her two young children and husband. Her family is her greatest joy.

She has been raising hogs for 10 years now. Her husband works in one the private resorts in her town, as a chef. She would like to boost her main source of living, but the problem is she has insufficient funds to finance her hog-raising business.

Arlene has requested a loan to purchase feed, piglets and vitamins. These will enable her to produce more livestock, resulting in more income. In that way, she will be handling her livelihood efficiently to become progressive and to improve the family's livelihood status. She is very grateful to Kiva for the continued support.

loans.use: to purchase feed, piglets and vitamins.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a 38-year-old woman who lives in Mahaplag, Leyte. She is married and has four children, ages 18, 15, 11 and 3 years. Her husband works hard as a driver, while Jennifer is engaged in raising pigs. In addition to this, she sells dried fish to the community. Thus, she is asking to buy feed for her pigs and dried fish to sell. In this way, she will improve her earnings and augment her profit.  In the future, Jennifer wishes to have a stable business that helps them improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs, and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Modesta Rosa

texts.es: Doña Modesta es una mujer muy esforzada que se dedica a la venta de ropa. Con el propósito de poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes solicita un préstamo de ochocientos mil colones (₡ 800 000), para la compra de mercadería, entre estos, pantalones, blusas y demás prendas las cuales ofrece a sus clientes y le genera el ingreso económico para su familia.
texts.en: Modesta is a very hardworking woman who works selling clothing. With the purpose of being able to offer more variety to her clients, she is applying for eight hundred thousand colones (800,000), for the purchase of merchandise, among others, pants, blouses and more clothes which she offers to her customers and this generates economic income for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Grupo De Garcia 1 Group

texts.es: Dolores es una mujer de 53 años es una persona emprendedora  con mucho entusiasmo por la vida, lleva varios años dedicándose a la venta de tortillas, afortunadamente con el crédito que se le dio pudo realizar la ampliación de su negocio que en su momento le era muy necesario pues la demanda había incrementado, a Dios gracias la inversión fue todo un éxito pues logro satisfacer mejor a sus clientes y sus ganancias mejoraron. Ella con el afán de seguir mejorando su negocio solicita un nuevo préstamo que en esta ocasión lo utilizara para la compra de una estufa industrial para la preparación de más tortillas, con esta inversión ella espera mejorar la atención hacia sus clientes. Su gran sueño es tener su propio local de negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dolores is a 53-year-old woman. She is an enterprising person with a lot of zest for life.

For many years, she has made a living by selling tortillas. Fortunately, with the loan she was given, she was able to expand her business, which was very much needed for her at that time because demand had gone up. Thanks to God, the investment was a complete success, as she was able to better satisfy her customers, and her earnings improved.

With the desire to continue improving her business, she is requesting a new loan. This time, she will use it to buy an industrial stove to prepare more tortillas. With this investment, she hopes to improve her customer service.

Her biggest dream is to have her own storefront and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove to make tortillas

loans.name: Teobaldo Antonio

texts.es:
Teobaldo es una persona humilde, sería correcta que ha dedicado 20 años de su vida a trabajar en actividades agropecuarias, para ser más preciso el señor Teobaldo se dedica a la cría de cerdos, ha estado en los buenos momentos y en las época de crisis.
Gracias a su negocio, ha podido alimentar y darle una vida digna a su familia, no tiene riquezas pero tiene felicidad y lo fundamental para vivir tranquilamente.
El cliente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para aprovechar la temporada de fin de año la cual es donde más cerdos se venden, quiere comprar cerdos para abastecer sus cocheras, vacunas, vitaminas y alimento de engorde.
Espere tener excelentes ventas y empezar año nuevo con un negocio más grande, conformado por un mayor número de animales.
texts.en:
Teobaldo is a humble man who has dedicated 20 years of his life to agriculture, specifically raising pigs. He has stuck with it through good times and moments of crisis. Thanks to his business, he has been able to feed his family and give them a dignified life. They are not rich but they are happy and have what they need to live peacefully.

He asks for a loan to take advantage of the end of the year, which is when he sells the most pigs. He wants to buy pigs to fill up his herds, along with vaccines, vitamins and feed for fattening them up. He hopes to have excellent sales and start the new year with a bigger business and more animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs, vaccines, vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 45 year old married woman. She has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Razia has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for the winter season to boost her earnings with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for the winter season

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village. As a Babban Gona member, Gabriel is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Gabriel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Gabriel can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Gabriel no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Gabriel hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a maize farmer from Doka village. As a member of Babban Gona, Ali is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ali would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ali can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Ali is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Malam Abdu

texts.en:
Malam Abdu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Malam Abdu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Malam Abdu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Malam Abdu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Malam Abdu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Roxana Guadalupe

texts.es: Roxana es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 25 años de edad se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos, en una residencial. Ella vive junto a sus padres y dos hermanos menores de edad a los que apoya, junto a sus padres, ya que ella desea que tengan una calidad de vida diferente. Roxana anteriormente solicito un crédito con el que mejoro algunas partes de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para repellar su vivienda, ya que esta es anidación de plagas por el barro del que está hecha.
texts.en:
Roxana, 25, is a hardworking woman who earns a living doing domestic work in a home. She lives with her parents and two younger brothers, who she and her parents help support. She wants to have a different quality of life.

Roxana previously asked for a loan that she used to repair some parts of her home. Now she asks FUSAI for another loan to buy cement, sand, gravel and to pay laborers to make repairs to her home, since the mud it's made of has become a nesting ground for pests.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and pay for labor to repair her home, as the mud it's made of has become a nest for pests.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es: Doña María Luisa se dedica a la actividad de ganadería en la cual posee amplia experiencia. Actualmente tiene un terreno desocupado en el cual podría incluir ganado y aumentar el rendimiento de su finca, para lograr el propósito de utilizar de una mejor forma ese terreno solicita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (₡1 050 000) para la compra de terneros y de esta forma llevar a cabo su proyecto.
texts.en: Maria Luisa has a lot of experience has a cattle farmer. Currently she has unoccupied land on which she'd like to put cattle and increase the profitability of her farm. In order to achieve this, she asks for a loan of 1,050,000 colones to buy calves and move forward with her project.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Rosas Tika Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ROSAS TIKA”  este banco está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del cusco.
El socio Bernabe tiene 54 años de edad y él se dedica desde hace muchos más de una década ala agricultura. El siembra tubérculos y hortalizas.
El socio solicito el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.
Los demás socios también desarrollan la agricultura de tubérculos, de hortalizas y frutales.
Los socios están contentos con el préstamo que le dio los inversionistas de KIVA  y se comprometen a seguir trabajando duro.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Rosas Tika" village bank. This bank is located in the province of Paucartambo, Cusco department. The member Bernabe is 54 years old and he has worked in agriculture for many years longer than a decade. He plants tubers and vegetables.

The member is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. The other members also develop agriculture of tubers, vegetables and fruits. The members are content with the loan that the Kiva investors gave them and they commit themselves to continue working hard.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Brandy

texts.en:
Brandy is the owner of First Impressions Lawn Care. Her business is dedicated to creating beautiful commercial and residential lawns at an affordable price. Before starting her business, Brandy worked for a construction and manufacturing business. Currently she runs her business with one other employee who is a family member.

Her business is currently in its very early stages. So far, Brandy has struggled to come up with the funds necessary to get her business going. Brandy is seeking a loan to be able to purchase the equipment needed to successfully run a decent lawn care business.

Her vision for the future is to build a good reputation for her business and to build a strong base of happy and loyal clients over the years.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment.

loans.name: Johanhy

texts.es: Jhohanny, un hombre trabajador, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y vive solo actualmente, él tiene pensando desarrollar una hortaliza con el fin de vender los cultivos a comerciantes y vecinos, de esta manera obtener ganancias económicas, por lo que él hace una solicitud de crédito, y es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jhohanny a 38 year old hard-working man. He is single and currently lives alone. He is thinking about developing a vegetables garden with the aim of selling the crops to businesses and neighbors and obtain economic income in this manner. So he is requesting a loan. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan with a State bank. FUDECOSUR is providing the loan with better terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Rosario

texts.es:
Xiomara, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja es soldado y tienen un bebé de 5 meses de nacido.

Xiomara, se dedica al comercio de mariscos desde hace 5 años, decidio dedicarse a este negocio porque no tiene otra forma de generar ingresos.

Xiomara, necesita el préstamo para comprar mariscos para vender.

Xiomara, sueña con tener un puesto en el mercado para vender más.
texts.en: Xiomara, 28 years old, studied until ninth grade. She is partnered, her partner is a soldier and they have a baby, 5 months old. Xiomara has worked at the shellfish trade for the past 5 years. She decided to dedicate herself to this business because she didn't have another way to generate income. Xiomara needs the loan to buy shellfish to sell. Xiomara dreams of having a storefront in the market to sell more.

loans.use: to buy shellfish to sell.

loans.name: Asabe

texts.en:
Asabe is a maize farmer from Gwani village. As a Babban Gona member, Asabe is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Asabe would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Asabe can store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Asabe no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Asabe hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer de 37 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones de 15 y 17 años y una hija de 12 años, y su negocio es la producción de charque de res.
Ella es optimista, feliz y de muy buena actitud. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa ingenio’ lugar donde se encuentra en relleno sanitario de la ciudad, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura máxima de 10 grados.
Beatriz es de tez morena, cabello negro trenzado y forma de vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la disfruta en compañía de sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de adobe que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la producción de charque, que es la Carne (puede ser de res o llama) con sal que se deja secar al sol para que pierda humedad y se conserve más tiempo, su negocio lo inicio como comerciante para después de un tiempo reinvertir sus ganancias y volverse productora, “la preparación es fácil porque únicamente se necesita un  espacio seco, donde dé el sol…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es la única productora de la región, la desventaja son las largas distancias que debe recorrer para llegar a su negocio. Su sueño es lograr vender por mayor, ella desea comprar ganado. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Beatriz solicita un préstamo para comprar ganado para producir charque.
texts.en: Beatriz is a 37 year old woman. She is single and has 2 sons, 15 and 17 years old, and a daughter, 12 years old. Her business is the production of beef charqui (salted meat). She is optimistic, happy and with a good attitude. She has her business in the area of ‘Villa ingenio’, a place where the city landfill is located. The weather here is cold and dry, with a maximum temperature of 10 degrees Celsius. Beatriz is dark skinned, with black braided hair and dressed in traditional attire (hat, shawl and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and her business. She enjoys her life together with her children who attend school. They live in a rented room built with adobe, with running water, electricity and sewerage. Her business is to make charqui, which is salted meat (either beef or llama), left to be dried by the sun so it loses its humidity and can be conserved for more time. She started her business as a merchant and later reinvested her earnings and became a producer. “Preparation is easy because one needs only a dry space where the sun can shine...", she comments. The advantage of her business is that she is the only producer of the region, the disadvantage are the long distances she needs to travel to reach her business. Her dream is to be able to sell wholesale. She wants to buy cattle. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years she has been working in this activity.  These are the reasons why Beatriz is requesting a loan to buy cattle to produce charqui (salted meat).

loans.use: to buy cattle to produce charqui (salted meat).

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia Haydee continua  dedicándose al trabajo como profesora de un colegio, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera mediante a su trabajo poder obtener más ganancias para  así poder continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales didácticos y víveres para su hogar.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Haydee, continues to earn her living as a teacher in a school. She has been dedicated to this work for quite a while, and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work every day. Haydee is an enterprising woman who hopes to be able to obtain more earnings through her work in order to continue supporting her family.

Haydee is requesting the loan to buy instructional materials and groceries for her household. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy instructional materials and groceries for her household.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is the owner of Pierced Eyewear. She is originally from Louisville, KY where she lived most of her life and moved to FL back in July 2014. She started working on a project to develop a product back in 2002. Her project led to the invention of pins for prescription glasses and sunglasses.

Melody has spent some time improving her invention and has decided that now is the right time to launch her business. Currently, she is seeking a loan to invest in her website and advertising. Melody works part time at Lowes. Her vision for the future is to have her product line available online and in stores.

loans.use: to invest in a website and advertising.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is the owner of a child care center located in her home in the Bronx. She currently has 14 children in her care. She is an industry expert with 10 years of experience in her daycare business, which has continued to successfully operate since 2005. Sharon currently operates her business with the help of one other full-time employee.

Her greatest success has been witnessing the development of the kids she cares for as they enter their school-age years. Her biggest difficulty is the inability to take more kids into her care due to space limitations. Sharon is currently seeking a loan to expand the space of her daycare within her own home. She would also like to offer job opportunities to kids who are of working age and interested in childcare.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her childcare center.

loans.name: Usuri Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 1, 3 y 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es amigable, encantadora y muy precavida. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’  caracterizado por acoger a los sobrevivientes del desborde del río Piraí años atrás, hoy convertida en una zona pujante de producción manufacturera, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo.
Maria es de tez trigueña, cabello negro largo y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada a la izquierda, viste blusa a cuadros rosa y blanco, carga su bebe en brazos), su vida la comparte con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad de mejorar su negocio por el bien de sus niños la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida como; hamburguesa, salchipapa (salchicha con papas fritas), choripán (chorizo a la parrilla con pan), pollo frito y otros, “vendo comida todo el día, muchas personas están de paso, comen un bocado y continúan con su labor…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas todo el día y toda la semana, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar un carrito hamburguesero con ruedas para poder ambular. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea comprar un carro hamburguesero. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para comprar un carrito hamburguesero con ruedas para poder ambular.
texts.en:
Maria, 25, is single and has three children ages 1, 3 and 5. She shares her life with her children who are not yet of school age. They live in a rented room made of brick with a tin roof and a dirt floor. They have running water, electricity and sewage. She is friendly, charming and very cautious. She runs her business in the neighborhood "Plan 3000", which is where the survivors from the flood of the river Pirai, years past, now live. It has been converted into a zone with a lot of manufacturing. It is very warm and humid. Her business is selling fast food.

Maria has a dark complexion, long black hair and an average physique. Her native tongue is Guarani, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish in general society and during her work. In the photo, she is seated on the left in a pink and white shirt with her baby in her arms.

She needs to improve her business for the well-being of her children, which is why she went to the lending bank. Her business is selling fast food like hamburgers, sausages with french fries, grilled chorizo sandwiches, fried chicken and other things.

"I sell food all day. A lot of people pass by, eat a bite and continue on with their work," she says.

The advantage of her business is that she can make sales all day long and every day of the week. The disadvantage is her lack of capital to buy a cart with wheels so that she can move around. Her dream is to open a restaurant.

She asks for a loan to buy a cart for her hamburger stand. This is her 2nd loan with the institution in 2 years.

loans.use: to buy a wheeled cart for selling hamburgers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La madre del señor es una maestra jubilada una gran persona con la gente haciéndose conocer con todos por su zona por ser una persona humilde colaboradora y muy amable, pero teniendo una tragedia, la atropellaron a unos pasos de su casa  después de hacer una visita a su cuñada, pero no sabiendo nada sus familiares de su accidente, preocupados de que no llegaba a su domicilio salieron en su búsqueda pero sin pensar de tal hecho se toparon que fue atropellada y sin tener ninguna ayuda del que ocasiono tan terrible hecho, pero los vecinos de la zona viendo tal accidente llamaron a la policía llevándola al hospital en el cual sus familiares preocupados y recién enterados aterrorizados de lo ocurrido, el señor (su hijo) el cual solicita el préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos médicos operaciones, tomografías, rayos x haciéndose responsable de todo para que salga todo bien  con su madre y no perderla. Así que su madre pueda mejorar y siga siendo como la conocen una mujer amable y colaboradora.
texts.en:
The mother of the man is a retired teacher, she is a great person with the people making her by all in her area for being a humble, collaborative and very friendly person, but had a tragedy. Someone ran over her a few steps from her house after making a visit to her sister in law. Her family, not knowing anything of her accident, was worried that she didn't arrive to her home so they went out in search of her without thinking of such a thing. They encountered her run over and without having any help. From such a terrible occasion, the neighbors of the area, seeing such an accident called the police, taking her to the hospital to hisher worried family who had recently learned and were terrorized by what had occurred.

The man (her son) is who is applying for the loan to be able to cover the medical operations, CT scans and X-ray expenses, making himself responsible for everything so that it will all go well with his mother and he won't lose her. Therefore his mother can get better and continue being a very friendly and collaborative woman as they know her.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses for a traffic accident he had and to be able to re-establish himself and fulfill his activities in a normal manner.

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Nubia es una habitante de Puerto Salgar, ella es casera, se dedica principalmente a atender a su hijo y esposo. Una vez terminada su actividades caseras se coloca el overol y empieza a laborar en su negoció de cría de cerdos 8 horas diarias.
Ella ha sido siempre una mujer independiente que le gusta conseguir su propio capital para satisfacer sus necesidades y deseos y apoyar a su hijo de 15 años de edad en su crecimiento, personal, mental y espiritual, por ello trabaja con tanto empeño pues cuando su hijo necesita algo que sea aportante a su vida trabaja incansablemente para dárselo.
El principal deseo de esta humilde mujer es heredar su negocio a su hijo, por ello quiere constituir una empresa firme, rentable y sostenible en el tiempo.
La señora Nubia se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para compra de cerdos y materiales para la construcción de una nueva porqueriza donde albergara los nuevos integrantes.
Esta inversión le permitirá aumentar sus ventas, ser competitiva y mejorar los ingresos.
texts.en: Nubia lives in Puerto Salgar. She is a housewife; she works mainly taking care of her son and husband. Once she finishes her household chores, she puts on her overalls and starts to work in her business of raising pigs 8 hours a day. She has always been an independent woman who likes to get her own capital to satisfy her needs and wishes, and to support her 15 year old son in his personal, mental and spiritual growth. For this, she works with much effort because, whenever her son needs something important for his life, she works tirelessly to give it to him. This humble woman's main wish is to leave her business to her son. This is why she wants to build over time a firm, profitable and sustainable business. Nubia is requesting a loan to buy pigs and materials to build a new pigsty where she will keep the new pigs. This investment will allow her to increase her sales, be more competitive and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy pigs and materials to build a new pigsty where she will keep the new pigs.

loans.name: >Jaime

texts.es: Jaime, un hombre trabajador, tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa e hijos actualmente él quiere desarrollar un proyecto de cerdas de cría de esta manera obtener ganancias económicas, con las ventas de los cerdos  y si fuera el caso él también se dejaría algunos cerdos para el engorde y vendérselos a carniceros de la región,  por lo que él hace una solicitud de crédito, y es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jaime, 40, is a hardworking man. He is married and lives with his wife and children. He wants to develop a project raising pigs in order to make money. He will sell some, and save some to fatten up and sell to butchers in the region. This is the purpose of his loan.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had loans with other state banks, but FUDECOSUR gave him a loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Luz Daris

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Daris una persona muy sonriente y optimista la cual se dedica a la venta de mercancía, principalmente productos de uso personal tales como talcos, desodorantes, cremas, algunos cosméticos y accesorios.
Inicio su actividad por necesidad ya que en el municipio de montería una zona de inclusión social es algo complicado emplearse y las personas salen adelante más por emprendimiento que por laborar en alguna empresa.
Tiene dos hijos de 17 y 13 años de edad, su principal sueño es lograr pagar la educación media y universitaria de sus hijos y que estos se conviertan en los primeros profesionales de la familia.
Como estamos en vísperas navideñas la señora Luz Daris quiere solicitar un préstamo, el cual invertirá en compra de productos de uso personal en cantidades, como desodorantes, lociones, productos capilares, cremas de manos, entre otras.
Su objetivo principal es tener suficiente surtido para atender la demanda que se presenta a fin de año.
texts.en:
This is Luz Daris. She is a very smiley and optimistic person who makes a living selling merchandise, mainly personal products such as talcum powders, deodorant, creams, some cosmetics and accessories.

She began in the business out of necessity since in the town of Montería, a social inclusion area, it is somewhat difficult to get a job. People get ahead more through business venture than by working for a company.

Luz Daris has two sons, 17 years old and 13 years old. Her big dream is to manage to pay for their high school and university education and for them to become the first professionals in the family.

Since we are in the lead-up to Christmas, the señora Luz Daris would like to apply for a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of personal products in large quantities, like deodorants, lotions, hair products and hand cream, among others.

Her main goal is to have enough selection to tend to the demand that occurs at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products; she wants to have a complete selection to attend to the demands of the year's end.

loans.name: Association Des Femmes Actives Pour Le Developpeme

texts.en:
Yvrose is a Haitian entrepreneur and she is a key member of a rural association that manufactures detergents. After having received training in 2013, Yvrose and 9 other women officially launched their production in the community. They have included three men as sales managers.

Yvrose's association has a positive impact there as they trained more than 100 rural women on women's rights and women's financial autonomy. Moreover, each member has assets in the community.

Recently, Yvrose encountered production difficulties due to the lack of raw materials. Consequently, the committee board was looking for financial aid. Eventually, Yvrose's association was only qualified for Zafen. That's why Yvrose and the other board members agreed to apply for a loan in order to buy the needed materials: more bottles and more cans.

The accomplishment of Yvrose's project will create at least five jobs and will help the community in sanitation and household cleaning.

In the picture, Yvrose is in the middle. She is the production manager. On her left, Lunese, another key member, is the deputy coordinator of the association. On the right, Jeanna, is the one recording sales for the rural association.

loans.use: to buy detergent raw materials: dozens of bottles and cans for production.

borrowers.first_name: Association Des Femmes Actives Pour Le Developpeme

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL TRIUNFO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Norberto tiene 41 años de edad, es un socio trabajador que se dedica a la construcción de viviendas.
El socio sabe que este trabajo es arduo y cansado pero él no desfallece por que quiere lo mejor para su familia.
Norberto solicito el préstamo para comprar botas de jebe y  mameluco de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de comida.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "El Triunfo" community bank. This bank is located in the Lamay district, belonging to Calca province and Cusco department. The member Norberto is 41 years old, he is a working member who works at the construction of homes. The member knows that this work is arduous and tiring, but he doesn't falter because he wants the best for his family.

Norberto is applying for the loan to buy rubber boots and work overalls. The other members work at the businesses of agriculture, animal sales, grocery store and food store. The members feel thankful for the loan supplied and they commit themselves to fulfilling the payment of their installments.

loans.use: to buy rubber boots and work overalls.

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan has owned his commercial cooking repair business for the past 24 years. He loves what he does and has been doing it for over half of his life. He was born and raised in Florida and lives with his wife. For the past 10 years, his business has steadily declined without much indication of why. He is currently working on recovering from the economic hardship his business has experienced.

Alan is currently seeking a loan for marketing purposes. He would like to do outreach that would possibly lead to contracts with new businesses. His vision for the future is to have fully recovered his business so that he can continue to support his family, especially his daughter who lives in Tennessee with a neurological disorder.

loans.use: to pay for marketing

loans.name: María Irma

texts.es:
María, de 37 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 6 hijos.

María, trabaja destazando cerdos desde que tenía 10 años de edad y le ayudaba a sus padres y ella le ha transmitido estos conocimientos a sus hijos para que en el futuro también lo puedan realizar.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos para destazar y para  comprar cerdos pequeños para criarlos y engordarlos, de esa manera generará ingresos y mejorara la calidad de vida para su familia.

María, sueña con tener su propia crianza de cerdos y venderlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Maria, 37, is married and has 6 children.

Maria has been working butchering pigs since she started helping her parents when she was 10 years old. She, in turn, is teaching her children this occupation so that they can do this work in the future.

Maria needs a loan to buy pigs to slaughter, and also to buy small pigs to raise and fatten.  This way, she will generate more income and will improve her family's quality of life.

Maria dreams of having her own business raising pigs and selling them at a better price.

loans.use: to buy pigs to slaughter and piglets to raise and fatten

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is 20 years old. She is the mother of a beautiful girl age 6, and future mother of a new baby that will be born this December.

Rebeca met her husband when both were traveling to the city in search of a job. They live with her parents-in-law and the brothers of her husband. A lot of people live in the house, experiencing overcrowded conditions. Her husband finished high school but she didn´t finish primary school. Their greatest wish is to give their children better opportunities than the ones they got for themsleves.

He works as a mason, she sells flowers and candies in her daughter's school with the hope of buying themselves their own house. Now that she is pregnant, she has more than ever the hope to live in their own house, so in December of this year when her child is born, he will have his own home.

With your support, they will make their biggest wish come true and offer their new born and her little girl a suitable home in which they can live comofortably and in a healthy environment.

loans.use: to build her own house and give her children a proper place to live

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin first came to the United States from Mexico nine years ago with a business partner in hopes of establishing a better life. His partner started a business that imported Mexican goods to the United States and distributed them to supermarkets, and during this time, Agustin made connections with suppliers in Mexico.

Unfortunately, Agustin had trouble getting the necessary work permits to own his own business in America. It took many years, and he had to return to his native Mexico before coming back with the proper permits.

Eighteen months ago, Agustin finally made it back to America and immediately started his own business in Passaic. Using the connections he made with suppliers in Mexico years ago, he started importing indigenous Mexican spices to northern New Jersey. He then sold the spices to supermarkets and bodegas in Passaic and Paterson where there is a large Mexican population. Agustin is very proud that he is able to help bring many of these immigrants a taste of home in the form of his spices.

As Agustin started to build his business, he found there was a big market for his spices. He needed to expand, so he obtained warehouse space and started hiring members of the community to work for him. While things were going well, Agustin repeatedly went to banks looking for loans to help him bring his business to the next level. He kept getting declined because he had no prior credit history in the United States. This reality has prevented Agustin from obtaining capital that will allow him to hire and serve more people.

Agustin is looking for a Kiva loan to both build credit and to buy more spices in bulk so that in the future, he can continue to grow his business.

loans.use: to build credit and purchase inventory in bulk

loans.name: Elvia

texts.en:
Elvia and her husband are a very young couple. They have been together for 2 years, the age of their small boy. Since they've been together they have lived in borrowed houses. With a lot of work, they finally bought their own piece of land for building their home, but with the birth of their child and multiple sicknesses caused by the cold, they haven't gotten enough money for constructing a suitable house. Neither of them went to school; they don´t know how to read or write. In consequence they haven't had the opportunity to have well paid jobs. He works as a mason and she sells flowers, coffee and a Mexican vegetable called chayote, very similar to the pumpkin. 

They started to have hope when they heard about the possibility of getting support for building their own house. Their greatest dream is to live in a home in which they won't suffer getting wet because of the rain and freezing from the terrible cold, that quite often makes their child get sick. 

They look forward to offering their little son a home were he can play in a safe environment, free of the danger of having the fire from the wood stove close to the bed, for staying warm when it's freezing.  Please help them build a safe home where their small boy can play and grow.

loans.use: to build a  home for her family.

loans.name: Angela Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Ángela es una mujer emprendedora de 54 años de edad, tiene dos hijos que depende de ella. Hace más de medio año que la señora Ángela realizo capacitaciones en el rubro de panadería y refrigerios. Ahora que conoce mejor el rubro desea comprar un vehículo que le facilitara el traslado de sus productos, dándole a su negocio un enfoque más empresarial, dado que la señora Ángela preparaba sus productos de manera más artesanal.  
La señora cuenta con buenas expectativas ya que a ella lo que más le motiva es salir adelante y con varias metas por realizar, quiere llegar a formar un capital de trabajo que le pueda brindar una mayor estabilidad económica.
La señora viene de una familia humilde y sobre todo trabajadora la cual esta inculcada con los valores de humildad, buena administración de recursos, respeto, con una visión de emprendimiento y alcanzar los objetivos que ella misma se traza a lo largo de su carrera técnica.
texts.en:
Angela is an enterprising 54 year-old woman who has 2 dependent children.  More than 6 months ago, Angela underwent training in baking and snack production.  Now that she has more skills in this area, she wants to buy a vehicle that will help her to transport her products.  This will give her a more business-like approach to her activities, given that Angela used to prepare her products in a more hand-made way.  

Angela has high expectations, because what motivates her the most is to get ahead and achieve the various goals that she has.  She wants to build up working capital so that she can have greater financial stability.  

Angela comes from a poor but hardworking family that instilled in her the values of humility, good resource management, respect, and entrepreneurial  vision.  Her family taught her to reach for the goals that she sets for herself in her career.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for her business

loans.name: Carlos Elenilson

texts.es: Carlos de 44 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 11 y 16 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida como motorista independiente trabajo con el cual ha logrado hacerse de varios clientes que lo conocen y recomiendan siendo de esa manera como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a su familia. Carlos desea construir un muro en la parte de enfrente de su casa para poder brindar mayor seguridad a su familia ya que por el momento son laminas las que cubre la entrada, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, ladrillo, arena, grava, para realizar la construcción del muro en la parte de enfrente de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos, 44 years old, lives in his own home with his life partner and two children, 11 and 16 years old. He is a hard-working man who makes his living as an independent driver. With this work he has managed to gain many customers who know him and recommend him to others. In this way he has generated income with which he has kept his family going.

Carlos wants to build a wall in the front part of his house in order to provide better security for his family. At the moment, metal sheeting covers the entrance. This is why he is asking for a loan from FUSAI, to invest in: cement, bricks, sand and gravel, to carry out the construction of the front wall of the house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, bricks, sand and gravel, to carry out the construction of front wall of the house.

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es: Rosa de 26 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 6 y 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo productos por catálogos de forma ambulante por lo que cuenta con varios clientes que la conocen y la recomiendan en su comunidad, de esa manera es como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, además de recibir un aporte de parte de su compañero de vida quien se dedica a la panadería. Rosa desea realizar una reparación del corredor de su vivienda el cual es de tierra y lo desea en cementar ya que cuando llueve se hace lodo lo que incomoda a su familia, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, grava y mano de obra, para encementar el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 26, lives in her own home with her life partner and their 2 children aged 6 and 9.  She is an enterprising woman who earns a living selling products from catalogs door-to-door.  She has a number of customers who know her and recommend her business in her community.  This is how she generates the income to provide for her children.  She also receives support from her life partner, who has a bakery.  

Rosa wants to make repairs to the veranda of her house.  This area has an earthen floor, and she wants to put in cement, because when it rains the floor turns to mud, which causes her family discomfort.  This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: sand, cement, gravel, and labor to put in a cement floor on the veranda of her house.

loans.use: to put a cement floor in the veranda of her house

loans.name: Lolie

texts.en:
Lolie’s has been operating a tax preparation service for four years now. Tax preparation has been a very successful part of her business, however, she would like to expand her business to immigration consulting -- something she takes great joy in.

An immigrant herself, she loves helping others settle and establish themselves in this country.

Lolie wants to purchase the surety bond required to make her an official immigration consultant. Lolie plans to use the remainder of her funding to go towards insurance and other necessary purchases.

loans.use: to purchase the surety bond required to make her an official immigration consultant

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting, to earning income as well. Josephine has supported her husband doing this type of work.  As a farmer, Josephine has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  Someday, Josephine hopes to purchase another piece of rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Rutilla

texts.en: Rutilla is a hardworking farmer from Oroquieta City. She has been engaged in a corn production business for 30 years together with her husband. She's doing well in this business and she managed to expand her corn production. She always turns to Paglaum MPC as her financial partner in her business ventures. Recently, she approached the cooperative to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is happily married with 5 children. Her husband does not appear in the picture because he was working in an avocado plantation when it was taken. All of the family is very proud of him. Even though he only studied until primary (like Lourdes), he has been promoted to supervisor. She spends all her time taking care of her children and working at the coffee harvest. 

Some years ago, with a lot of effort, they finally achieved buying a piece of land to construct their home. Because of the great expense of sending their 5 children to school (all of them study primary), they don't have enough money for building a suitable house.

They all sleep in two beds in the only bedroom of the house. The walls are covered with plastic because if not the rain enters and gets everyone wet. Lourdes wishes with all her heart to be supported so she won´t be afraid anymore of the danger of leaving the wood stove on for long periods of time when the room is very cold. Because of the cold, one of her children is sick with flu most of the time and spreads it to his brothers and sisters.

The greatest desire of Lourdes and her husband is that their children live comfortably and with a more hygienic toilet near the house. Please help them to achieve this wish so their children can live in a suitable and hygienic environment. They count on you!

loans.use: to build a house where their 5 children can grow in a safe place.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia Alejandrina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercad .gracias a esta actividad saca delante a su familia.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita del Carmen de Huycho”, tiene 49  años de edad y es viuda. Su sueño de la socia es  progresar y ampliar su negocio, por esa razón solicito el préstamo.
Alejandrina solicito el préstamo para comprar zanahoria, tomate y cebolla.
La socia esta agradecida con los inversionista de KIVA , ya que le ayudaran a conseguir sus metas, ella se compromete a pagar su cuotas en el plazo debido.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman. She makes a living selling vegetables at a local market. Thanks to her income from this work, she is able to support her family. She is a member of the communal bank "Virgencita del Carmen de Huycho."

Alejandrina is 49 years old, and she is a widow. Her dream is to progress and grow her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy carrots, tomatoes, and onions.

Alejandrina is thankful for the support of KIVA investors who will help her to achieve her goals. She promises to fulfill the loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy carrots, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Aurelia is managing a sari-sari store (convenience store) in Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta City. She is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC in her business ventures. This time, she needs an amount to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, confectioneries and condiments so she is asking for a loan from the cooperative.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, confectioneries and condiments.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es: Gustavo de 38 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a sus dos hijas de 11 y 12 años de edad. El es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida brindando sus servicios de albañilería independientemente negocio con el cual genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado a sus hijas adelante apoyándolas en sus estudios como padre soltero responsable que es. El desea realizar la instalación del agua potable en su vivienda ya que por el momento no cuenta con agua potable, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: compra de tuberías, pegamento, teflón, etc., para realizar la instalación del agua potable en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 38 years old, and he has his own home where he lives with his two daughters, ages 11 and 12. He is a hardworking man who makes a living as an independent bricklayer. The income he earns through this work is used to provide for his daughters and help pay for their education, since Gustavo is a responsible single father.

Gustavo would like to install a potable water system in his home since it doesn't currently have potable water. For this reason, he is requesting a loan with FUSAI to buy piping, adhesive, teflon, etc. to install a potable water system in his home.

loans.use: to buy piping, adhesive, teflon, etc. to install a potable water system in his home.

loans.name: Jean Alien

texts.en: Jean Alien is known in Migpangi, Bonifacio for her retailing business. She is 28 years old, married and an active member of Paglaum MPC, where she accesses her additional capital for her business. Recently, she availed herself of a loan of PHP 30,000 to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned items, noodles, biscuits, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and other items.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned items, noodles, biscuits, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and other goods.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is a sari-sari (variety) store owner in the town of Calape, Bohol. She is a married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 19 years old while her youngest child is 4 years old. Melinda has been running this sari-sari store business for 11 years while her husband does carpentry. In addition to this, they are also engaged in fishing. Melinda and her husband work hard together to earn a living and to provide for the needs of their children. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy assorted goods such as food seasoning, noodles, canned goods, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, sugar, coffee and other cereals. In the future, Melinda wants to improve their livelihood so they will have enough money to send all her children to college and finish their degrees.

loans.use: to buy food seasoning, noodles, canned goods, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, sugar, coffee and cereal.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es una cliente responsable y trabajador, EL sigue dedicándose al negocio de transporte, con esta actividad logra salir adelante pero él desea más para su familia, por eso quiere brindar una mejor servicio para sus clientes, para tener un viaje cómodo y seguro. 
El socio solicito el préstamo para comprar llantas y muelles para su vehículo.
El socio esta contento por el crédito otorgado y agrádese alas personas que hacen posible esta ayuda.
texts.en:
Javier is a responsible and hard-working client. He still has his transportation business, and he is able to get ahead with this, but he wants more for his family. This is why he wants to offer better service to his customers so that they will have a comfortable and safe trip.

The member requested the loan to buy tires and springs for his vehicle.

He is pleased with the loan that he has received, and he thanks the people who make this help possible.

loans.use: to buy tires and springs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 51 years old and resides in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with adult children. She joined PMPC on April 17, 2006 in order to access the programs and services of the cooperative. Recently, she's accessed her tenth loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 for additional working capital for her existing business, to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Jingle Mary

texts.en:
Jingle Mary is 39 years old, married and lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Mis. Occ. She has always dreamed of opening her own household shop to support her two children.

She used her loan to purchase additional stocks such as laundry powder, toilet cleaner, air fresheners, fragrances, cosmetics and others.

She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as laundry powder, toilet cleaner, air fresheners, fragrances, cosmetics and others.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking mother who's pushing her abilities when it comes to the retail business.

She runs and operates a convenience store that primarily provides the needs of her family.

She is also an MIGS member of Paglaum MPC that provides her the necessary capital. Recently, she approached the coop for a loan to purchase consumable items to restock her convenience store.

loans.use: to purchase consumable items to restock her convenience store.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 24 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de manera ambulante en los alrededores de su comunidad es así como ha logrado el cariño de las personas que la conocen y la recomiendan, de esa manera es como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que le brinda todos los insumos necesarios a su hijo, además de cumplir con los gastos del hogar recibiendo el apoyo de su compañero de vida con algunas cosas. Teresa desea poder en cementar el corredor de su vivienda ya que este es de tierra y cuando llueve se pone lodoso, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, grava, cemento, para poder en cementar el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Teresa is 24 years old, and she has her own home where she lives with her life partner and 2-year-old son. She is a hardworking woman and makes a living travelling throughout the surrounding area of her community selling products by catalog. Through this work, she has earned the affection of the people who have come to know her and recommend her.
