The income she earns through this work is used to provide for her son as well as take care of the household expenses. She also receives the support of her life partner for certain expenses.

Teresa would like to be able to build a cement corridor in her home, since it is currently a dirt corridor which gets muddy when it rains. For this reason, she is requesting a loan with FUSAI to buy sand, gravel, and cement to be able to build a cement corridor in her home.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, and cement to build a cement corridor in her home.

loans.name: Vergelia

texts.en:
Vergelia is a 57-year-old woman who lives in the town of Tubigon, Bohol with her family. She is married and has seven adult children. She earns a living by running a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells a variety of goods and gasoline, while her husband manages their farm.

Vergelia wants to improve their livelihood in the future because she wants to have a comfortable and a better life when she gets old and unable to work. To that end, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock for her store such as drinks, eggs, spices, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, chips, candies, biscuits, laundry soap, sugar, coffee and cereals. She will also buy gasoline to sell. In this way, she and her husband will be able to improve their earnings and increase their profit.

loans.use: to buy drinks, eggs, spices, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, chips, candies, biscuits, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, cereals, and gasoline.

loans.name: Crisaldo

texts.en:
Crisaldo has been a fisherman for many years now. He sells fish and crabs to the locals in his place. He wakes up early in the morning to make a catch, which serves as the main source of income for the entire family.

He is a 52-year-old married man and has four children, of whom one, 14, is his youngest. He resides in Talibon, Bohol.

Crisaldo wants to continue improving his quality of life, which is why he is requesting a loan to buy fishing materials like crab net, nylon, and weights.

With that equipment, his on-going yield will improve and enable him to provide his family with healthy diets. The rest of the profit will enable him to expand and continue to manage his livelihood efficiently.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like crab net, nylon, and weights.

loans.name: Jay Neil

texts.en: Jay Neil is 30 years old and lives in Jimenez-Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one child which is now school-aged. Jay Neil is engaged in duck raising and the duck egg-laying business. He earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He is also earning support from his wife who works as an OFW. He has requested a loan to be used to purchase an additional 150 ducklings for his duck-raising business. Jay Neil has been a member of PMPC for more than 2 years. In the future, Jay Neil hopes to become a major duck eggs supplier in the area.

loans.use: to purchase an additional 150 ducklings.

loans.name: Nelson Alfredo

texts.es: En un pequeño local es donde tiene su taller de reparación de vehículos Nelson, un hombre trabajador de 21 años de edad que siempre está buscando la manera de apoyar a su familia, por lo que se dedica a la reparación de vehículos desde hace 5 años. Él vive con sus padres y hermanos en vivienda propia desde hace 15 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz acompañado de su familia. Nelson desea invertir en herramientas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en herramientas para reparación de vehículos como: tenazas, llaves, nica, etc.
texts.en: Nelson´s vehicle repair shop is in a small locale. He is a hardworking 21 year old man who is always seeking a way to support his family. That is why he has repaired cars for 5 years. He has lived with his parents and siblings in their own home for 15 years, and he is very happy, accompanied by his family. Nelson wants to invest in tools to offer his customers a better service, and that is why he is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in tools to repair vehicles such as pliers, wrenches, etc.

loans.use: to invest in tools to repair vehicles, such as pliers, wrenches, etc.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José de 42 años de edad que habita en vivienda familiar junto a su compañera de vida, su hija de 15 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida gracias a que posee un pequeño negocio de venta de comida al que lo visitan numerosos clientes, de esa manera es como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que está sacando adelante a su hija brindando le el estudio así como cumpliendo con los gastos del hogar. José desea adquirir más variedad de productos alimenticios que le permitan preparar nuevos platos de comida para ofrecerles a sus clientes y lograr así incrementar sus ingresos económicos y poderles brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: vegetales, tomate, güisquil, lechuga, hongos, apio, cilantro, etc., para ofrecerles nuevos platos de comida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old, and he has his own home where he lives with his life partner and his 15-year-old daughter. He is a hardworking man and makes a living thanks to a small business he has selling food to the various customers who visit his establishment. The income he earns through this work is used to get his daughter ahead by paying for her education. His income also takes care of household expenses.

José would like to obtain a wider variety of food products, which will enable him to prepare new dishes to offer to his customers. Through this, he will earn more income and be able to provide his family with a better quality of life. For this reason, he is requesting a loan with FUSAI to buy vegetables, tomatoes, güisquiles (squash), lettuce, mushrooms, celery, cilantro, etc. to offer new dishes to his customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes, güisquiles (squash), lettuce, mushrooms, celery, cilantro, etc. to offer new dishes to his customers.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol lives in the rural area of Talibon, Bohol, with her husband and three young children. She helps her husband by peddling fresh fish to the locals in her place. Her husband is a fisherman. Aside from selling fish, she also grows and sells seaweeds as supplemental income for the entire family.

She would like to improve her day to day livelihood activity and would like to make some improvements on her house. Therefore she decided to increase her current business but the main issue is insufficient amount of capital to do so.

Therefore Mirasol is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner CEVI because she has to buy seaweed seedlings, fishing net, and housing materials like nails, galvanized iron, and plywood. In this way she would be able to cope with demands. She could also start to repair her home for the comfort of her family.

Thus, she is doing her best to continue improve her sources of living to become productive. Mirasol is very thankful to Kiva and CEVI.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, fishing net, and housing materials like nails, galvanized iron, and plywood.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a married woman and has four children. She is a dealer of a direct selling products and beauty essentials. She sells items ranging from cologne, lotion, and hair gel to body spray and beauty soap.

She resides in the town of Talibon, Bohol. For many years now, she has owned a shop, serving neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a shortage of funds to maintain the inventory of supplies to able to cater to the demands.

Rizalina decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost her business. With the 30,000 PHP, she wants to purchase supplies like beauty products, cologne, body spray, and whitening soap.

Thus, she would be able to manage the finances of her household and settle her obligation. She is very grateful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like beauty products, cologne, body spray, and whitening soap.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias is a 35-year-old married man and has one young dependent. Two years ago he started started selling ice candy to the neighbors in his community. He is a married man and a resident in the rural town of Talibon, Bohol.

His wife is the one handling a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities, which helps cover the needs and expenses of the entire family.

He has requested a loan to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, and a variety of fruit flavoring. These are very vital to improve his profitability and he is able to seek ways to become more efficient in handling his source of income.

He hopes to expand his business more in the future by investing in other business ventures to increase his income and improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy  additional ingredients like sugar, milk, and a variety of fruit flavorings.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is a government employee in Tangub City. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovate her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.name: Leonardo Fabio

texts.es:
Leonardo es un sonriente vendedor de pescados, residente del municipio de Montería, tiene 5 hijos por los cuales luchar de 14, 12, 11, 6, 3 años de edad,  se dejó con la madre de los pequeños y ahora vive solo, manda semanalmente el dinero para la alimentación y formación estudiantil de sus muchachos.
Como tiene que mantener dos hogares, sus ventas deben ser muy buenas, por ello emplea casi toda la tarde para vender su pescado por las calles de Montería.
El cliente actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de cavas para albergar mayor cantidad de pescado y surtido de peces en cantidades para comprar barato  y obtener mejor utilidad en la venta.
Este préstamo significara un aumento en ventas y una regulación de su negocio, lo que más lo tiene motivado es que si sus propósitos se cumplen le podrá brindar a su familia una excelente navidad y empezar un año 2016 de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a smiling fish vendor, resident of the municipality of Montería, and has 5 children of the ages of 14, 12, 11, 6, and 3. He is no longer with the mother of the children and now lives alone, sending money weekly for the food and education of the children.

Given that he has to maintain two households, his sales have to be very good. Therefore, he spends almost all afternoon selling his fish on the streets of Montería.

The client is currently seeking a loan which he will invest in the purchase of storage containers to accommodate a higher quantity and assortment of fish in quantities to purchase inexpensively and obtain a higher profit after sale.

This loan will mean an increase in sales and a stabilization of his business. What motivates him the most is that if his intentions are achieved he will be able to give his family an excellent Christmas and start the year 2016 in the best way.

loans.use: to buy storage containers to store a greater quantity of fish and completely stock up.

loans.name: Wendla Naaba Group

texts.fr: Téné, est une femme âgée de 22 ans mariée mère de 2 enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis 5 ans dans le tissage et la teinture. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son dynamisme, son courage, sa bonne relation envers ses clients, son travail bien fait, et la qualité de sa teinture et de ses pagnes. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter  2 balles de fil à  180 000 f à raison de 90 000 f l'unité, 10 000 f pour  achat  de la teinture et les  100 000 f restant pour achat du brillant. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s’approvisionner en matériel afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle à déjà reçu le prêt et plusieurs fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Tene is a 22-year old married woman with two children. She has been working for five years weaving and dyeing cloth. Her business is successful thanks to her energy, perseverance and friendly welcome she gives her customers as well as the quality of her cloth and dyes. 

Tene  would like to obtain this loan to buy two bales of thread for 180,000 West African francs (at 90,000 francs each), spend 10,000 francs to buy dyes and the remaining 100,000 francs to buy whitener. The purpose of this loan is for Tene to restock supplies in order to meet customer demand. She already took out loans several times and always repaid them in accordance with ACFIME terms.

loans.use: to buy two bales of thread as well as stock up on dyes and whitener.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina pertenece al banco “Hatun Sayhua”, y se dedica al venta de comida, ella prepara todo tipo de potajes que es a gusto de sus clientes, ella es muy trabajadora y empeñosa.
La socia tiene 69 años y es viuda, ella tiene las ganas de seguir trabajando y aportar en su hogar, por eso desea seguir ampliando su negocio.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar arroz, lentejas y papa.

La socia está contenta y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the communal bank "Hatun Sayhua," and she sells food. She prepares every type of vegetable stew that her customers like. She is very hard-working and persevering.

She is 69 years old and is a widow. She has the will to continue working and contribute to her household. For this reason, she wants to continue expanding her business.

She applied for the loan to buy rice, lentils, and potatoes.

She is happy and grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy rice, lentils, and potatoes.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna lives with her family in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She has four children who are still studying.

She joined GDMPC recently and to improve her income, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to improve her banana farm.

Her husband has a part time job as a carpenter and she wants to help earning money by operating their own farm. She wants to have a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to improve her banana farm.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, a 35-year-old mother of three children, helps in operating their own farm to make a living. Her husband too has a part time job as a construction worker in town.

Emily has been working on their farm for six years and she is now planning to engage in another line of business for she has to earn daily money, unlike her farm where she earns monthly and quarterly.

She took a new loan from GDMPC to be used to start a sari sari store business. She will buy grocery goods to sell.

She would be happy to see that her business will prosper and to have a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell to start a sari sari store business.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es:
Bonifacio, de 48 años de edad, es agricultor, tiene firmes principios morales y espirituales, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos, pero solo dos viven con él. 

Bonifacio, se dedica a la agricultura,  a la crianza de cerdos y al destazo, de estas actividades genera ingresos que le ayudan a solventar sus compromisos; su padre le enseño muy bien el trabajo de la agricultura y la crianza de cerdos.

Bonifacio, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos y para comprar cerdos para engordar y destazar.

Bonifacio, sueña con tener una granja de cerdos más grande.
texts.en:
Bonifacio is 48 years old, and he is a farmer. He has strong moral and spiritual principles. He is in a relationship and he has 4 children, but only 2 live with him.

Bonifacio makes a living in agriculture and by raising and butchering pigs. The income earned through this work helps him to take care of his financial obligations. His father taught him very well about farming and raising pigs.

Bonifacio needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies for his crops and to buy pigs to fatten and butcher. His dream is to have a larger pig farm.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his crops and buy pigs to fatten and butcher.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth and her family live a simple home in the town of Catigbian in Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of six children; they are three adult and three dependents.

Her husband is a carpenter while Elizabeth is engaged in the hog-raising business. She has been doing this to help her husband support the needs of their children.

Elizabeth is 53 years old and plans to improve her business in the future to be able to send her children to college. She dreams for them to finish their studies and have a good future someday.

With this, she is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and feed for them. In this way, she will be able to uplift her earnings and have enough money.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita owns a fish pond and sells fish as her main source of income. She has been managing a fish pond for four years now. She is a widow with three children, all of whom are still attending school. Her expenses go towards food and school expenses.

She faces a financial shortage but wants to improve her business.

Anecita wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with CEVI to purchase fingerlings and maintenance supplies for her fish pond. These will help her to continue improving her business.

In this way, she can improve her livelihood and manage her finances wisely.

She is thankful to Kiva for the continued support.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of fingerlings and maintenance supplies for a fish pond.

loans.name: Anecia

texts.en:
Anecia is a widow and lives in Tubod, Aloran, Mis. Occ. She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the coop.

She's requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of rice for retail in the local community.

Anecia hopes to continue her business and to be able to save enough money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of rice for retail in the local community

loans.name: Gounwenddaabo Group

texts.fr: Azèta, est une femme âgée de 44 ans, mariée mère de 06 enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis 10 ans dans la vente de sa boutique. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son dynamisme, son courage, sa bonne relation envers ses clients, le bon emplacement de sa boutique. Azèta veut acheter du sucre à 20 500 f, de l'huile à 13 000 f, du savons à 50 000 f, le reste des 166 500 f pour acheter des plats plastique. L’utilité du prêt c'est de réapprovisionner sa boutique afin de satisfaire sa boutique. Elle à reçu le prêt 3 fois et à rembourser aux bonnes dates à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Azeta is a 44-year old married woman with six children. She has been running a grocery shop for 10 years. Her business is successful thanks to her energy, perseverance, friendly welcome she offers her customers as well as the convenient location of her shop. 

Azeta would like to buy sugar for 20,500 West African francs, oil for 13,000 francs, and soap for 50,000 francs,  using the remaining 166,500 francs to buy plastic dishes. The purposes of this loan is to restock merchandise in her shop and meet customer demand. She already obtained three loans in the past and repaid them in accordance with ACFIME deadlines.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, soap and plastic dishes.

loans.name: Ismat

texts.ru: Этого веселого мужчину зовут Исмат. Ему 56 лет. Он верный муж и отец. Исмат гордится своим сыном, который учится в Университете. В его семье мало образованных людей и он чувствует большую гордость, рассказывая о своем сыне, и о том, как он получить диплом и станет образованным человеком. Чтобы его сын окончил университет, не только сын старается, но и сам Исмат. Исмат занимается животноводством и предоставляет услуги такси, чтобы заработать и оплатить обучения сына. В этом году его денег не хватило на оплату годового обучения, и Исмат обратился за кредитом.
texts.en:
Ismat is 56 years old.  He is a happy man, a devoted husband, and a father.  He is very proud of his son who is a university student.  In his family, there are very few educated people, so Ismat is always happy to talk about his son, about the fact that he will soon get his degree and become an educated man.  While his son studies hard, Ismat is also working very hard to make sure that his son completes his education. 

Ismat makes a living raising livestock and he also works as a taxi driver in order to pay for his son's studies.  However, this year he doesn't have enough money to pay for his son's yearly tuition fees.  For this reason, he is taking a loan.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn is a 33-year-old woman from the town of Tubigon, Bohol.  She is married and has two children ages 12 and 2 years old.  She earns a living by selling food (snacks) like popcorn, lemon jelly and fried cassava flour known as “salbaro” in local markets.  She has been in this business for five years and helps her husband raise their children.  Ginalyn wants to improve her business to have enough money to send her children to college.  She wishes for them to finish their studies.  To do this, she is asking for a loan to buy food ingredients such as cassava, cooking oil, sugar, lemon and popcorn.  The other part of her loan amount is to buy piglets so she can earn extra income raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as cassava, cooking oil, sugar, lemon and popcorn as well as piglets.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 46 years old and lives in San Vicente, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children which are now adults or school age. Rosemarie earns a living from the sales of her sari-sari store business and earns approximately 1,000 PHP each month. She has been doing this type of business activity for more than 2 years. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of assorted groceries and other consumable products for retail. Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of assorted groceries and other consumable products.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is an active member of Paglaum MPC and enjoys all the perks of a member. She is 41 years old, married with adult aged children. Arlene is busy in her teaching profession. She said she's secured financially knowing she can always turn to the cooperative, but she also wants to be prepared for unprecedented life events so she also avails life insurance of the coop. Now that her one year life insurance expired, she requested a loan to pay for a life insurance renewal for the family. Arlene believes that it is better to be prepared than to be held on neck for unexpected circumstances.

loans.use: to pay for life insurance renewal for the family.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 53-year-old married woman with four children, whom one is still attending school. Ten years ago she started working in the field helping her husband cover the needs and expenses of their children. She grows and sells rice. Aside from farming, she also engages in a scrap-buying business. She buys and sells empty plastic bottles, scrap iron and metals.

She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI to purchase fertilizer and scrap materials. With these, she can improve the yield of her farm, producing a bountiful harvest and improving her purchasing power to augment her scrap-buying business.

Rosalina hopes to expand her business more in the future by investing in other business ventures which will increase her income and improve the family's living conditions. She will also continue to finance the schooling of her youngest child.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and scrap materials.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita hails from the rural town of Talibon. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods ranging from eggs, rice, seasonings, edible oil, assorted canned goods, biscuits and soft drinks. She is married and has one grown child. She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for 11 years now, serving neighbors and locals.

Because of high demand for basic commodities, she would like to acquire capital to be ready to serve her respective customers.

Rosita decided to avail a loan to purchase supplies like rice, noodles, canned goods and assorted groceries. With these items, she can maximize her resources, enabling her to maintain the flow of merchandise. Thus, she can start to save and invest any possible profits to become successful.

In the future, she is determined to improve her main source of living to become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like rice, noodles, canned goods and assorted groceries.

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
For many years now, Severino has engaged in fishing. His work is done by waking up early at dawn, and he returns to his house later bringing his catch with him. His wife helps him sell it to neighbors at his place.

He dreams of improving his livelihood by growing seaweed. Unfortunately, at this present time, he has experienced a financial shortage.

Severino has requested a loan to buy fishing net, wooden planks and seaweed (for seaweed farming). These can help him enhance his sources of income and slowly settle his obligations. Thus, he can continue to provide his family with basic necessities, and start to expand his livelihood.

He is thankful for the funds and in return he is determined to manage them successfully to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, wooden planks and seaweed (for seaweed farming).

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is managing her snack vending business in Labo, Aloran. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage.

This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts bulk orders for added income.

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase bags of flour, sugar, butter, cheese, leavening, milk, and others for her business. She wants to expand her business and would be very happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, butter, cheese, leavening, milk, and others.

loans.name: Auguste

texts.fr:
Auguste est un homme de la campagne. Il a 39 ans, marié et élève 2 enfants dans un quartier de la campagne. Il pratique toute sorte d’élevage depuis 20 ans. 
Cela fait 3 ans qu’Auguste est emprunteur chez Vahatra. Il a pu acheter une vache laitière avec le prêt d’avant. Ce prêt va lui servir à acheter 4 porcins et de la provende pour les engraisser. Les bénéfices vont être économisé afin d’acheter une autre vache laitière.
Auguste travaille bien afin d’améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Auguste is a farmer. He is 39 years old, married and raising his two children in the countryside. He has been raising different kinds of livestock for 20 years. He has been a borrower with Vahatra for three years. With his prior loan, he was able to buy a dairy cow. 

This new loan will allow Auguste to buy four pigs and feed to fatten them up. He will save his revenues to buy another dairy cow. Auguste works hard in order to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy four pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 49 years old and is known in Labo, Aloran, Misamis Occidental for her delicious and palatable food. She delivers her food products for snacks to different school canteens and operates her snack inn just outside her house.

She has expanded and has increased her production due to high orders from her local customers. In order to meet the demands, she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 7,000 to purchase ingredients for snack vending like flour, milk, sugar, butter, cheese. and others. Lorna believes having enough inventories of the raw materials will not hamper her daily operation.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snack vending like flour, milk, sugar, butter, cheese, and others.

loans.name: Gertrudiz

texts.en:
Gertudiz's main source of income is through growing seaweed. She resides in the town of Talibon.
She is a 53-year-old married woman and has five grown children.

She aims to develop ways to become more progressive in her chosen business. She has requested a loan to purchase supplies like seaweed seedlings, soft-tie, and straw. These definitely will be a big help that will boost her income. With these items, she will be able to increase her seaweed production and to gain financial income more than her usual earnings.

She is hoping that she will be able to have other sources of income for her family. This will help her become more stable.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like seaweed seedlings, soft-tie, and straw

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is a married woman with five children who engages in fishing to earn a living. For many years Caridad sold fish, crabs, and clams to the local settlers in her community. She would like to improve her yield and increase her income by acquiring new tools.

Caridad has requested a loan in order to invest in fishing materials, such as nylon fishing net and weights. These will help boost her on-going catch and enable her to access financial gain. She will continue to improve her livelihood and start to save for emergency use.

In the future, Caridad is aiming to have a sustainable livelihood and a peaceful life.

loans.use: to invest in fishing materials, such as nylon fishing nets and weights.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en: Jinky is managing her eatery business in Labuyo, Tangub City. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. Her business has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts catering orders for added income. Recently, she borrowed a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Sixty-year-old Dionesio makes native pots, made of clay and a mixture of cement. He has been in this business for many years now, serving locals and town dwellers in his place. He resides in the town of Talibon. He is married and has three children, two of whom are still attending school.

Dionesio would like to boost and improve his financial status. He has requested a loan to purchase materials like wood, clay and cement. With these, he can produce more pots to sell to his respective clients. This will enable him to experience financial gain, start to save, and handle his earnings wisely.

Dionesio is grateful for the funds and is determined to become more efficient in handling his projects to become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, clay and cement

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a resident in the rural town of Antequera. She weaves native baskets made of buri (native palm).

She is a 53-year old married woman and has two grown children. Her husband is a carpenter.
She has been weaving baskets for almost six years now. Aside from basket weaving, she also raises hogs.

She would like to produce more finished products but she has very limited resources to improve her output. She decided to join CEVI to access loans which will help her cater to her financial needs.

Cirila has requested a loan to buy nito and buri (a kind of palm), wicker (pliable twig) and to purchase piglets and feed. With these resources, she will become productive and continue to expand both her projects.

She is thankful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to buy nito and buri (a kind of palm), wicker (pliable twig) and to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is a 46-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are still attending school. Her husband is a farmer who grows and sells rice.

9 years ago Ma. Liza started raising hogs. She sells her pigs to the locals in her community. Ma. Liza also makes native baskets to supplement her income. The money she earns goes mainly for food and school expenses.

She would like to increase the number of baskets she makes in a week, but the materials are very limited. So, Ma. Liza has joined CEVI to enable her to borrow in order to purchase pig feed and materials for basket weaving, such as rattan and buri (palm). These are essential tools that will boost her business.

Ma. Liza was grateful for the support she received with her previous loan, which she successfully repaid. Now she is requesting a new loan to further build her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and materials for basket weaving, such as rattan and buri (palm).

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.fr:
El grupo San Valentín  está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, ellas a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ellas se encuentran  mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Myrian, una de las que integra este grupo comenta que vende bebidas de todo tipo y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es conocida en el barrio por ser una muy buena señora que ayuda siempre a sus seres queridos.
Myrian pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas variadas para la venta, como ser vinos, cervezas, gaseosas y otras.
texts.en:
The "San Valentín" group is in its second loan cycle in the women's committee program, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. Through their effort and continual work and application of the vital behaviors of a successful woman, they are improving their situation of poverty.

Myrian, one of those who form this group, comments that she sells beverages of all types, and through her sales she has the means to be able to help her family. She is known in the neighborhood for being a a very good woman who always helps her loved ones.

Myrian is requesting this loan to be able to buy various beverages to sell, such as wines, beers, soft drinks, and others.

loans.use: to buy various beverages, such as wines, beers, soft drinks, and others.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.en:
Venancio has been a tuba (coconut) wine dealer for a quite long time now. He also raises hogs, to provide for the expenses and needs of the entire household.

He is a hardworking 51-year-old married man with five children. Together with his wife and children, he lives in the rural town of Antequera.

He faces a financial shortage that could cause him to delay the success of his livelihood. Therefore, he has requested a loan from CEVI to purchase piglets, feed and additional capital for coconut vending. These are vital to making his business prosper and will enable him to manage it properly in order to become productive.

Venancio is hoping that in the future, he will be able to experience financial stability, along with determination and courage to keep moving forward toward progress.

loans.use: to  purchase piglets, feed and additional  capital for coconut vending

loans.name: Maria Esneda

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 61 años de edad separada, madre de dos hijos, ella es una verraca, pujante, luchadora empresaria que saco su familia adelante con un negocio de venta de jugos de naranja que adecuo con una mesa y un exprimidor que tenía en su casa.
Es el claro ejemplo que solo con el deseo de salir adelante, la mejor disposición y buenas intenciones se puede salir adelante y hoy sigue trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para mantener a su familia.
María quiere solicitar un préstamo para realizar un mantenimiento y adecuaciones a su chaza donde vende y guarda el surtido de naranjas, comprar naranjas grandes cantidades de naranja y pago a proveedores.
texts.en:
María is a 61-year-old woman; she is separated and has two kids. She is a tireless, strong, determined businesswoman who kept her family going with a orange juice sales business that she adapted out of a table and a squeezer she had at home.

She is a clear example that with only the desire to move forward, a good disposition and good intentions, it is possible to get ahead. Today she continues to work with lots of effort to provide for her family.

María wants to apply for a loan to carry out maintenance and repairs to her cart where she sells and keeps her assortment of oranges, to buy large quantities of oranges, and pay her providers.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance and improvements to her cart where she sells and keeps her assortment of oranges.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana has been a fish vendor for almost 10 years now. Her work is done peddling fish along the streets of her town. She is a 52-year-old woman and has six children, of whom two are still attending school. Her husband's income as a laborer could help defray the family's expenses.

Her main challenges in managing her daily source of living is the shortage in funds to acquire higher volumes of fish. This is why Adriana is asking for a loan from CEVI to invest in the purchase of assorted fish, ice styrofoam and cellophane. Thus, she could cope with the demand and her purchasing power will improve.

She is looking forward to making her fish vending business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase assorted fish, ice styrofoam and cellophane.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Dauda is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Dauda would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Dauda will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Dauda now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members. He would like to use this additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with it.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Patrocinio

texts.en:
Patrocinio is a 59-year-old married man from Baybay.

He has raised his family by selling herbal products. Specifically, Patrocinio is engaged in a direct selling business, while his wife works as a sales agent. They work together to earn a living.

Patrocinio’s goal in life is to succeed in his business. He works in this business so that his family will have better lives in the future. He is requesting this loan so that he will have additional capital to buy more herbal products to sell. This will help him become more profitable in his business.

loans.use: to buy more herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita has been a fruit vendor for the past twelve years now, serving town dwellers in her place. She sells various fruit, ranging from bananas and mangoes to apples and oranges. She is a 48-year-old married woman and has a 15-year-old son. Together with her husband and a child, she lives in the rural town of Loon.

Selling fruits is at peak at this time, and she would like to grab the opportunities to have enough capital to pursue her daily living. But, she has very limited resources to do it.

Margarita decided to join Kiva's field partner CEVI to avail funds to finance her business. She has requested a loan to purchase various supplies of fruits, such as mangoes, apples and oranges. In that way, she can have plenty of stock to be displayed to attract buyers and thus improve her financial gain.

The presence of these will boost her income and she will continue to manage it properly for the welfare of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase various supplies of fruits such as mangoes, apples and oranges.

loans.name: Marta Margarita

texts.es:
Marta, de 52 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, pero por motivos de escasos recursos económicos decidió dedicarse a las ventas para poder generar ingresos para la familia, ella se separó de su esposo por problemas personales, tiene una hija la cual vive con ella y le colabora en las funciones del negocio y de la casa.

Marta, se dedica a la venta de frutas desde hace 32 años, durante ese tiempo había vendido frutas y verduras, pero ahora solo vende frutas; en este negocio le ayuda su hija y su horario de venta es de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.

Marta, necesita el préstamo para comprar una cocina y algunas cacerolas para la elaboración de frituras, porque quiere dedicarse a la venta de estos bocadillos también, con este negocio tendrá la oportunidad de incrementar los ingresos económicos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Su sueño, es que su hija se gradúe de la universidad y poder tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Marta, 52 years old, went to school until the fifth grade, but because of a scarcity of economic resources she decided to work as a vendor in order to earn some money for her family. She is separated from her husband due to personal problems, and has a daughter who lives with her and works together with her, both in business operations and at home.

Marta has been selling fruit for 32 years. During that time, she sold fruit and vegetables, but now she only sells fruit. Her schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m., and her daughter helps her in this business.

Marta needs a loan in order to purchase a stove and some pans so she can make fried foods because she wants to sell them as well. With this business she will have the opportunity to increase her economic gains and improve the quality of her family's life. Her dreams are that she will be able to have a store in her house, and that her daughter will graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase a stove and some pans to make french fries, enchiladas, and meat-filled pastries.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be industrious.

Sally operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are regulars. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes.

Her business goal is to have business premises within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank and she will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a maize farmer from Badamasi village. As a Babban Gona member, Dahiru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dahiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Dahiru can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Dahiru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Dahiru hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yunana

texts.en:
Yunana is a maize farmer from Gayya village. As a Babban Gona member, Yunana is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yunana would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Yunana can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yunana no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Yunana hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lugano Group

texts.en:
AGNESI, who is in her early 30's, is married with one child in school. She has been running an electronic money transfer business for one year now. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be AGNESI's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her business and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loans, reinvest in business and cover her household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on electronic money transfer, m pesa and tigo pesa, to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of expanding her business.

AGNESI will share this loan with her loan group, LUGANO, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on electronic money transfer, m pesa and tigo pesa, to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es una mujer de 33 años de edad, soltera, tiene un bebé de 3 meses y su negocio es la venta de abarrotes.
Ella es dedicada, independiente y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘los andes’ caracterizada por encontrarse el moderno matadero municipal, de donde se distribuye la carne a los mercados y comercios, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura máxima de 12 grados centígrados.
Aurelia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado y forma de vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su bebé que acaba de nacer, viven en una casa propiedad de su familia construida de adobe que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes como, aceite, mantequilla, mayonesa, sal y otro, “traigo productos de otras ciudades y de la frontera, mis clientes compran a diario antes de que se termine la mercadería…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque los productos que vende son difíciles de encontrar porque los trae de otras ciudades. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son continuas y vende toda la mercadería, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar variedad de abarrotes. Su sueño es convertirse en distribuidora, ella desea comprar variedades de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Aurelia solicita un préstamo para comprar variedad de abarrotes para distribuir a otros comerciantes.
texts.en:
Aureiia is a woman of 33 years of age. She is single and has a three-month-old baby. Her business is selling groceries.

She is dedicated, independent, and very persevering. Her business is located in the "Los Andes" zone, which is characterized by the presence of the modern municipal slaughterhouse, where meat is distributed to markets and businesses. The area has a cold, dry climate with a maximum temperature of 12 degrees centigrade.

Aurelia has a dark complexion, long black hair that she braids, and a traditional form of dress (hat, shawl, and skirt). Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and for her business. She lives her life in the company of her baby, who was just born. They live in a house that is the property of her family and is built of adobe. It has potable water, electrical energy, and sewer service. Her business is selling groceries such as oil, butter, mayonnaise, salt, and other items. "I bring products from other cities and from the border. My customers purchase daily before the merchandise runs out, " she comments.

Her business is successful because the products that she sells are difficult to find because she brings them from other cities. The advantage of her business is that sales are continuous and she sells all the merchandise. The problem is the lack of capital to buy a variety of groceries. Her dream is to become a distributor. She wants to buy a variety of groceries to stock her business. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the three years that she has been running this business.

It is for these reasons that Aurelia is applying for a loan to purchase a variety of groceries to distribute to other businesses.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries to distribute to other businesses.

loans.name: Teogenes

texts.en:
Teogenes is a 41-year-old married man and has two young children. He raises hogs to earn a living. Together with his family, he resides in the town of Maribojoc.

For the past four years, Teogenes has sold hogs to the local settlers in his community. Raising hogs is a lucrative business and he is in need of additional funds to expand his source of income.

He has requested a loan to invest in piglets and feed. These will help boost and improve his earnings. Thus, he will be able to provide his family with nutritious meals and continue to support their studies.

In the future, Teogenes is aiming to have a healthy family and a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in piglets and feed

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es:
Arreglar el local, pintar y adecuar un carrito para repartir mercado en la zona, comprar insumos principalmente granos y verduras, son los motivos que llevan al señor Octavio a solicitar un préstamo.
Él es un hombre de 40 años de edad, se dedica a vender productos de la canasta familiar, tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad, el cual siempre lo apoya, ya sea en la tienda o en cualquiera otra labor, esa es suficiente razón para querer progresar y darle a su amada criatura la mejor vida que este a su alcance, pagarle una educación y que se forme como profesional, el gran deseo que espera cumplir a toda costa, por medios honesto ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre muy correcto.
texts.en:
To fix the shop, paint and fix up a cart to distribute products in the area; to buy supplies, mainly grains and vegetables - these are the reasons that bring Octavio to request a loan.

He is a 40-year-old man. He makes a living selling basic goods. He has a 15-year-old son, who always supports him, whether it is in the shop or with whatever other job. This is reason enough to want to improve and to give to his beloved child the best life that is in his reach, to pay for his education so that he can train to be a professional. This is his greatest wish that he hopes to achieve at all costs, by honest means, since he has always been a man who does the right thing.

loans.use: fix the shop, paint and fix up a cart to distribute products in the area.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a maize farmer from Tashar Ice village. As a Babban Gona member, Suleiman is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Suleiman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Suleiman can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later in the season when he can obtain the best price for it, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Suleiman no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Suleiman hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Recorriendo las principales tiendas de su municipio es como Rigoberto distribuye sus productos de venta de curtidos, los cuales el mismo prepara todos los días, para luego comercializarlos. Él tiene 35 años de edad y vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace 2 años, junto a su compañera de vida y su grupo familiar. Rigoberto desea cumplir con la demanda de productos que le son solicitados, además de ofrecer el otros lugares sus productos, por lo que al no contar con la liquidez para invertir  solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar materia prima para elaborar los curtidos y materiales para empacarlos.
texts.en:
Going through the main shops in his town is how Rigoberto distributes his products as a "curtidos" (cabbage slaw) sales person. He prepares them every day to later sell.

He is 35 years old and has been living in his property for two years, alongside his life partner and family. Rigoberto would like to meet the demand for his products, in addition to offering his products in other places. Because he does not have the money to invest, he is requesting a loan from Kiva Field Partner FUSAI to buy raw materials to make his curtidos, and materials to package them.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make "curtidos" (cabbage slaw) and materials to package them.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is a 29-year-old mother of two young boys from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. They are three and four years old. Thelma provides for them by working hard on the farm. She has a rice field that she has cultivated since 2011. It has been a challenge to wait for four months before the harvest when she is also supporting her children's needs. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. Successful farming has been attributed to fertilizer and she knows how important it is for her crop. Thelma hopes and dreams that someday she can build a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia and her husband are engaged in the fishing business, like most people in Iloilo, Philippines. She and her family live in the town of Carles, in Iloilo. They raised their three children for 10 years by this livelihood.

Among these three children, she only has one school-aged child, aged 18 years, who still needs their support. Cynthia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets to help improve their catch and have enough money for her school-aged child to finish school.

Cynthia’s goal in life is to see her children become professionals and have better lives.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Lailyn

texts.en:
Lailyn is a 51-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in the town of Carles, Iloilo. She is married and the mother of four children; two adults and two school-aged. Her husband is a fisherman while Lailyn runs a sari-sari store (general store) business. She has been doing this for two years.

Lailyn has become proficient in this business and she eagerly wants to continue this business. The problem is there are times that her capital is used for other emergency needs such as school fees and bills. With this, she needs a loan amount to buy commodities needed for her store. She will purchase grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, chips, bread, sugar, salt, coffee, drinks and powdered juice. In the future, Lailyn wants to enhance her store business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, chips, bread, sugar, salt, coffee, drinks and powdered juice

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 56-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has three grown children. Sonia has been in the food vending business for more than 10 years. She sells chicken barbecue and siopao, which is the Filipino version of a steamed bun (dough filled with a savory meat and cooked by steam).

Sonia plans to use the loan to buy additional ingredients, such as flour, meat, soy sauce, chicken, and ketchup. In that way, she can attract potential customers and gain more earnings, and she can start to save some of the profit for emergency use.

In the future, Sonia would like to expand her business to be successful in order to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, such as flour, meat, soy sauce, chicken, and ketchup.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina is a 63-year-old woman who lives in Clarin, Bohol. She is married and the mother of three adult children. To earn a living, Martina is engaged in a direct-selling business where she sells RTW (ready-to-wear) and Personal Collection (PC) products. Aside from this, she also raises pigs while her husband sells firewood. They work together to earn a living. Martina wants to improve her livelihood. She wants to save money while she and her husband are still able to work. To do this, she is requesting a loan to buy goods such as shirts, skirts, pants, curtains and other apparel. She will also buy home care products such as toiletries and bathroom cleaner. Aside from this, she needs to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy goods such as shirts, skirts, pants, curtains, home care products such as toiletries and bathroom cleaner, and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita is 64 years old and lives in Minsubong, Tangub City. She is married with three children. Conchita has a fish vending business, owns a fishing boat business, and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business. Conchita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and that she is allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 48-year-old woman who lives in the town of Estancia, Iloilo. She is married, with five adult children. She and her husband have run a welding shop for almost 25 years. This business has been their main source of income for the past years. Thus, they want to operate this business continuously to sustain themselves.

This is the reason she is requesting a loan. They need to buy materials such as a cutter and electric welder. In this way, they will be able to offer good service to their customers and probably their income will increase.

loans.use: to buy a cutter and electric welder.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma lives in Duero, Bohol. She is 55 years old, with two children who are now adults. Since 2010, Norma has been engaged in making and selling homemade bread. In addition to this, she also owns a sari-sari (general) store in her place. She sells grocery items like vinegar, soy sauce, corn starch, sugar, milk, Milo sachets, powdered detergent, coffee, matches, canned corned beef, beef loaf, sardines, creamer and shampoo.

Norma loves what she does since it gives her an income that she needs. She has great plans and hope to increase her production. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, margarine and vanilla for her baking and more stocks for her store, such as canned sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee and sugar. Norma hope that her business will continue to flourish with God's blessings and with the help of CEVI.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread and more stock for her store.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 62-year-old married woman and has four grown children. She has been a fish vendor for 15 years now, serving locals and town dwellers in her community. She resides in the rural town of Loon, Bohol.

She would like to improve her income by acquiring a larger supply of fish to cope with demand. Milagros has requested a loan to buy a variety of fish, ice and a weighing scale. With these, she will be able to cater to the needs of her customers and her earnings will probably increase.

She hopes to expand her business more in the future through investing in other possible business opportunities to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions and to set aside half of the profit for future use.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish, ice and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is 47 years old and is known in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental for her delicious and palatable food. She delivers her food products as snacks to different school canteens and operates her snack inn just outside her house. She had expanded and had increased her production due to a high volume of orders from her local customers. In order to meet the demands, she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for snack vending including flour, milk, sugar, butter and cheese. Tessie believes having enough inventory of the raw materials will help her daily operation. For added income, Tessie manages her small coco farm.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snack vending including flour, milk, sugar, butter and cheese.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is from the town of Maribojoc. She is married, and has three grown children. She runs a stall near the school in her town, selling goods such as biscuits, chocolates, coffee, chips, and candies.

Teofila would like to have filled her stall with variety of goods to attract more students to shop and purchase.

Teofila decided to take a loan to purchase items, such as beverages, biscuits, and chips. With these purchases she can maximize her resources, enabling her to maintain the flow of merchandise so that she can start to save and invest in any possible business to become successful.

For the future, Teofila is determined to strive to have a stable source of income in preparation for old age.

loans.use: to purchase items, such as beverages, biscuits, and chips.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells merchandise like cooking oil, seasonings, coffee, powdered milk, pouch vinegar, soap, shampoo, eggs and toiletries. She is married, with four young children. Three of them are attend school. Most of her expenses come from food and school fees.

She would like to improve her earnings by purchasing assorted supplies for the store, like soft drinks, beverages and assorted dry goods. These will allow the inventory of her store to attract more buyers.

Elisa hopes that she can make her business sustainable for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy assorted supplies of groceries for her store, like soft drinks, beverages and assorted dry goods.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Motherhood usually makes women hard-working, just like Marita, a 53-year-old woman from Jagna, Bohol. She has four children aged seven to fifteen. Marita's husband is a carpenter. His earnings are not enough to provide everything they need.

Marita helps by cooking suman, as she is doing in the photo. Suman is a snack made from glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and often steamed wrapped in banana leaves. It is usually sprinkled with sugar or dipped in caramelized sugar. She sells her snacks to the people in her community.

Marita needs additional capital to buy sticky rice, sugar and coconut so she can make more suman. She dreams of making her business big someday, for her family.

loans.use: to buy sticky rice, sugar and coconut

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 53 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a weaving business in the Philippines. Leonida has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

Leonida has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.

Merlinda has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 23 years now. Merlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Barau

texts.en:
Barau is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Barau is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.
Traditionally, Barau would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Barau will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Barau now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to purchase a motorbike to help him do business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
La dame qui tient le bélier est Aminata, elle est une femme mariée et mère de 4 enfants non scolarisé.
Elle vit avec sa famille en milieu rural au Mali en Afrique de l’Ouest.
Une femme qui gagne sa vie par ses propres efforts elle a toujours bien remboursés ses emprunts du RMCR Âgée de 38 ans, Aminata n’a pas eu la chance d'aller à l'école ; Pour gagner sa vie elle s’investisse dans l’élevage des petits ruminants (moutons chèvres etc..) ; son mari est paysan.
Elle s’approvisionnent dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone et y revends ses produits.
Son activité consiste à acheter des petits béliers, les élever et les revendre, elle y gagne jusqu’à 15.000fcfa par mois comme bénéfice.Grâce au prêt  elle pourrait dans l'avenir augmenter son bénéfice de 15.000 fcfa à 25.000 fcfa par mois pour enfin amélioré l’hygiène et la santé de ces enfants et prendre soin de sa famille .
texts.en:
The woman holding the ram is Aminata. She is married and the mother of four children who do not go to school. She lives with her family in a rural community in Mali in West Africa.

She earns her own living and has always repaid her loans from RMCR. She is 38 years old and did not have the opportunity to go to school. In order to earn a living, she raises ruminants (sheep, goats, etc.). Her husband is a farmer.

She buys her livestock at the local weekly fairs. She also sells her animals there. She buys young rams, raises them, and resells them. By doing this, she earns 15,000 fcfa profit per month. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to increase her profits from 15.000 fcfa to 25.000 fcfa per month in the future. She will improve the hygiene and health of her children and take care of her family.

loans.use: buy rams that she will raise for eight months and then sell.

loans.name: Melvin Enrique

texts.es: Melvin es un joven trabajador padre de 3 niños de 6 y 4 años de edad y uno más pequeño de 2 meses de edad a los que busca la manera de brindar lo mejor, apoyado en su negocio de una granja de pollos, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante desde hace 12 años. Él tiene 26 años de edad y vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos en la misma vivienda donde tiene instalada su granja. Melvin desea comprar más pollos, ya que en la época navideña las ventas son mejores, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado y vitaminas para mejorar sus ganancias en la granja de pollos.
texts.en:
Melvin is a young hardworking father of 3 children ages 6, 4 and a little one who's 2 months old. He's looking for the way to provide them with the best, relying on his chicken farm which has enabled him to get by for the last 12 years. He's 26 years old and lives with his partner and three children on the same residence where he set up his chicken farm. 

Melvin wants to buy more chickens, since sales are better in the Christmas season. To that end he's requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in: chickens, concentrate, and vitamins to improve his chicken farm's profits.

loans.use: To invest in: chickens, concentrate, and vitamins to improve his chicken farm's profits.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 39 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Juanita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Juanita has been raising livestock for 2 years and also earns additional income from her general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sandra, de 19 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera y vive con su mamá. 

Sandra, trabaja desde hace tres años en una panadería, a través de ese trabajo logró terminar de estudiar bachillerato, ella se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para prepararse para ir a su trabajo y viajar en bus y de trabajar sale a las 4:00 p.m. 

Sandra, necesita el préstamo para comprar harina de pan, porque en la panadería le han dado la oportunidad de aprender el oficio y que coloque una pequeña panadería en su casa, porque ella le enseñara a su mamá a elaborar el pan y tener esa fuente de ingreso familiar.

Los sueños de Sandra, so seguir estudiando y que funcione su panadería.
texts.en:
Sandra is 19 years old and has a high school education. She's single and lives with her mother.

Sandra has worked in a bakery for three years, and through that job was able to finish high school. She gets up at 5:00 am to get ready to go to take the bus to work, and she gets off work at 4:00 pm.

Sandra needs the loan to buy bread flour, because she was given the opportunity at the bakery to learn this trade and set up a small bakery in her home. She's going to teach her mom how to bake bread and have that source of income for the family.

Sandra's dreams are to continue studying and for her bakery to work out.

loans.use: To purchase bread flour and set up her own bakery.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Francisco Jr. is 20 years old and is the 4th of six children in the family. His mother Mary Jane is a member of NWTF, and she supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Francisco Jr. is studying to obtain a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently on the 3rd of his 4-year course. Mary Jane is borrowing 1,500 PHP to pay the tuition fees of her son for the second semester of the school year 2015-16.

When he graduates, Francisco Jr. plans to be gainfully employed so he can help to improve the quality of life for his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nena requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo and candies to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Nena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo, and candies to sell.

loans.name: Ado

texts.en:
Ado is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ado has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.
Before joining Babban Gona, Ado would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Ado can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
As a Babban Gona member, Ado will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ado is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jose Diego

texts.es:
Diego, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tiene tres hijos. 

Diego, es agricultor, se ha dedicado a esta actividad toda su vida, su padre le enseño todo acerca de la agricultura, específicamente siembra maíz y frijol.- Diego, desea dedicarse a la crianza de pollos para tener otro ingreso adicional para minimizar las  necesidades de sus hijos.

Diego, necesita el préstamo para comprar pollos de engorde, para criar y luego comercializarlos. 

Diego, sueña con tener un negocio de venta de pollos y que sus hijas estudien y se superen académicamente.
texts.en:
Diego is 34 years old. He has a third grade education, he's in a relationship and his partner is a homemaker and he has three kids.

Diego is a farmer. He has done this work his whole life, and his father taught him everything about agriculture, specifically planting corn and beans. Diego wants to work raising chickens so that he can have another source of income to meet more of his children's needs.

Diego needs a loan to buy chickens to fatten, raise, and then sell. His dream is to have a chicken selling business and for his daughters to go to school so that they can better themselves academically.

loans.use: To buy chickens to fatten, raise, and then sell.

loans.name: Deisi

texts.es:
Deisi, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a trabajar como albañil y juntos tienen 2 hijos los cuales se encuentran culminando sus estudios.

Deisi, se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa, ella decidió dedicarse a este negocio para contribuir con los gastos de casa.

Deisi, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz, leña, gas y agua para realizar su negocio siempre.

Deisi, sueña con ver a sus dos hijos convertidos en profesionales y que tengan mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Deisi has a ninth grade education. She's in a relationship and her partner is a mason. They have 2 kids together who are currently finishing school. Deisi works selling tortillas at home. She decided to get into this business to help with household expenses.

Deisi needs a loan to buy corn, firewood, gas, and water to keep her business going. Deisi dreams of seeing her kids become professionals and have better opportunities.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, gas, and water to keep her business going.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban es un hombre de 58 años de edad, vive con su pareja, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es la fabricación de zapatos para cholita.
Él es independiente, constante y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Batallas’ caracterizado por encontrarse ubicado a orillas del lago sagrado ‘Titicaca’, los pobladores del lugar se dedican a la agricultura, pesca y ganadería, el clima del lugar es frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-10 grados centígrados.
Esteban es de tez morena, cabello negro corto y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no cuenta con agua ni alcantarillado porque todavía no existe el servicio en el sector. Su negocio es la confección de zapatos de cholita, la cholita es la mujer de vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera) y los zapatos son caracterizados por ser bajos y sin taco, los modelos varían según la temporada y la moda, “La forma de vestir de la cholita paceña fue cambiando con los años, ahora me exigen nuevos materiales y modelos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su taller se encuentra en su casa, la desventaja es la falta de maquinaría para trabajar. Su sueño es vender por mayor en la ciudad, el desea comprar una máquina de coser industrial. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Esteban solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser industrial para confeccionar zapatos de mujer tradicional.
texts.en:
Esteban is a 58 year old man who lives with his partner, and has independent children. His business is the manufacture of shoes for "cholitas" (women in traditional Bolivian dress).
