Jean Fidélice est un homme marié, âgé de 41ans. Sa femme l'appui dans l'exercice de son activité. Le couple travaille merveilleusement ensemble pour le bien-être de leurs enfants. Le couple a 4 enfants et ils sont tous scolarisés. 
Il est dans la vente de panier et de chapeau depuis 2004. Elle en est à son 8emme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. Elle tient une marge bénéficiaire assez large dans la vente de ses produit car ses clients prennent des articles en gros pour la vente en province. La prospérité de son marché est due à l’entraide du couple. Son patrimoine est dû aux efforts qu'il a déployé depuis et aux fruits des prêts qu’il a obtenu jusqu'ici. 
Il a pour objectif de s’acquérir un terrain et d’étendre sa maison actuelle.
texts.en: Jean Fidélice is a 41-year-old married man. His wife supports him in his business and the couple work wonderfully well together for the well-being of their children. They have four children, all of whom are at school. Jean Fidélice has been selling baskets and hats since 2004 and is on his eighth loan from CEFOR. He has a sufficiently large profit margin from the sales of his products because his customers buy products in bulk to sell in the countryside. The prosperity of his business due to the mutual support between the couple and the money he has made can be attributed to his efforts and the fruits of the loans he has had up to now. His goal is to acquire a plot of land and expand his current house.

loans.use: to buy baskets, hats, mats and other Malagash artisanal products.

loans.name: Pierette

texts.fr:
Pierette anisi que son mari vous remercient beaucoup de tout leurs cœurs pour le crédit que vous leur avez accordé. Ceci lui a permis de mieux ravitailler ses stocks de marchandises, améliorer son fond de roulement.
Elle a pu satisfaire ses clients en province. L'activité devient de plus en plus rentable. Le mari s'occupe de la livraison en province en ce moment et les clients sont satisfaits.
L’augmentation des marchandises leur aidera à améliorer leur revenu et atteindre leurs  objectifs, qui sont la construction d'une maison en dur et de devenir grossiste en quincaillerie.
texts.en: Pierette and her husband thank you with all their hearts for the loan you have granted to them. This has enabled them to stock up with goods more easily and improve their working capital. Pierette has been able to satisfy her customers in the countryside and the business is becoming more and more profitable. Her husband takes care of the deliveries in the countryside at the moment and the customers are satisfied. The increase in their stock will help them to improve their income and achieve their goals, which are the construction of a concrete house and for her to become a hardware wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy all sorts of electrical cables.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
O senhor António, segurança e pedreiro de 41 anos de idade, solteiro e pai de 04 filhos dos quais 02 a frequentar o ensino primário, 02 ainda sem idade escolar, vive na casa própria, e não sustenta a mais ninguém.
Com o valor do empréstimo, ira comprar, chapas, cimento, barrotes, blocos, varões de ferro, janelas portas para concluir a sua casa, e pagar o contrato de ligação de agua potável.
 
O seu sonho e terminar a sua obra, mobilar, comprar carro para lhe ajudar no seu dia a dia e ter uma empresa de construção.
O seu maior desafio é lutar contra a pobreza e doenças, tem insuficiência de fundos, mas esta trabalhando para superar, com o crédito anterior legalizou o seu espaço e construiu uma casa em que vive hoje.
texts.en:
António is 41-year-old security guard and mason. He is a single father of 4 children, 2 of them go to primary school, and two of them are too young to attend. He lives in a house that he owns and he doesn't support anybody else.
He will use this loan to buy metal sheets, cement, beams, bricks, iron rods, windows and doors to finish building his home and pay the drinking water connection contract.
His dream is to finish his home, furnish it, buy a car to help him get around on a daily basis and have his own construction company.
His biggest challenges are to fight poverty and disease. He lacks funds, but he works hard to get ahead. He used his previous loan to sign the contract to secure the lot where he is building the home where he is living at the moment.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, cement, beams, bricks, iron rods, windows and doors to finish building his home and pay the drinking water connection contract.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a 38-year-old man from Carles, Iloilo. He is a married man with two children; they are nine years old and a one-month-old baby. He supports them by buying and selling gasoline. Aside from this, he also sells spare parts of motorcycles. He has been doing this for four years.

Rolando’s goal in life is to have a better life. He wants to give his family a comfortable means of living. To do this, he needs to increase his earnings. That is why he is asking for a loan.

He will use the money to buy assorted spare parts and gasoline to sell. Aside from this, he will also buy grocery items. Perhaps he plans to start a sari-sari (variety) store business. In this way, he could possibly enhance his livelihood and reach his goal in the future.

loans.use: to buy assorted spare parts, gasoline and grocery items.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 49-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married with three children: one adult and two-school-aged children. She and her husband raised them for 25 years through the fishing business like the other community members in this town.

Imelda is asking for a loan to buy fishing net to increase their catch. Aside from this, she will also buy bamboo to sell. This bamboo is used by fishermen in their boats. In the future, Imelda wishes to send all her school aged children to college and finish a degree. She wants them to have a stable means of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and bamboo

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe is 30 years old and he lives with his mother and grandmother in Kapan city of Syunik region. He graduated from Vanadzor State Polytechnic Institute with the faculty of engineering, and for six years he worked in his specialty at the Kapan city’s combine.

Vahe, being the only man in his family for a long time, was looking for a way of earning more money and having his own business. Several months ago, Vahe finally established his business; in his own space, he started the production of lavash (this is a kind of national Armenian bread). Vahe, with his bakers, is engaged the lavash baking process, and as he mentions, he does it with great love and care. Now lavash baking brings income to his cute family, and he manages to cover all the financial needs of his most beloved two persons in the world.

Vahe distributes prepared lavash to the city’s fast foods places, to food markets, and to cafes.

Now Vahe asks for this loan, as he lacks flour. This Kiva loan will be great for him to buy a lot of flour to keep up his lavash production, which is especially active close to the winter months.

loans.use: to buy a lot of flour to keep up his lavash production, which is especially active close to the winter months.

loans.name: Manjuben And Group

texts.en:
33-year-old Manjuben hails from Dahod in Gujarat. She runs her own small scale scrap business. She buys scrap items like paper, iron, plastic, etc. by going door to door and resells them for recycling. Her business makes a major contribution to her family's monthly income of Rs.15,000.

Even after covering the living expenses for her family of seven members, she manages to save Rs. 4,000 every month. She wants all four of her children to get the best education. Considering the fact that with time, educational and other expenses will only increase, she has decided to expand her business and increase her monthly earnings.

She formed the Senaben and Sarlaben, a joint liability group, to access the micro-finances necessary to expand her business. Together, they seek a loan which they will repay in monthly installments.

Your timely loan will help Manjuben earn an extra amount of Rs. 4,000 per month. Manjuben and her group members are grateful for this opportunity and for your support in achieving their hopes and goals for their families.

loans.use: to buy more scrap items and to expand her scrap-selling microenterprise.

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar

texts.en:
Shamim is 32 years old and a mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Her husband is a driver by profession, providing transportation services using his loading rickshaw. He began driving a rickshaw 4 years ago to meet the family’s expenses.

Now, Shamim’s husband wants to buy a new loading rickshaw for proper transportation services, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to buy the loading rickshaw.

Therefore, Shamim has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Shamim’s husband can purchase the loading rickshaw and provide the proper transportation services to earn an income.

Shamim and her family will be thankful to the KIVA lenders and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy loading rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 65-year-old woman from Estancia, Iloilo. Six years ago, she starts selling dried fish to earn a living. She has been doing this since the day her husband passed away.

Lilia needs to work to sustain everyday, with the support of her children. She has six children that are already grown up.

In spite of her loss, Lilia is still determined to continue her journey. She wants to improve and expand her business. And with the help of her loan, she will be able to buy more dried fish to sell that will help her improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish

loans.name: Crisanto Jr.

texts.en:
Crisanto is a 47-year-old man from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is married and has three children.

Crisanto and his wife run a sari-sari store business to earn a living. Aside from this, they also engage in a fishing business.

Crisanto works hard to provide for the needs of his children. Thus, he is asking to borrow money to buy stock for his grocery such as drinking liquor, canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and napkins. Another part of his loan is to buy fishing materials. I

n the future, Crisanto wishes to improve his business for a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy drinking liquor, canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and napkins. Another part of his loan is to buy fishing materials.

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
Gelyn’s husband is a fisherman. With her great effort to help her husband to gain financial stability, she helps her husband in doing this business. They have been doing this for 30 years to provide for the needs of their big family. They have 10 children; 5 adults and 5 school-aged.

Gelyn’s dream is to uplift their livelihood to have a better means of living in the future. She also wants to have enough money to send her children to school and finished their degrees.

With this, she is asking for a bigger loan to buy a fishing boat that will help them in their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a 55-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two children: one adult and one school-aged child.

Gilda and her husband earn a living by doing the fishing business. They have been doing this for 15 years. Through her loan that may help them enhance their livelihood, she wishes to have a better means of living in the future.

Gilda is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing net and a fishing boat engine. She will also buy plywood to repair her fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, a fishing boat engine, and plywood for boat repair.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has four children: three adults and one school-aged child. Helen and her husband are engaged in the fishing business to earn a living. They have been doing this for three years.

They work together to provide the needs of their children and give them a comfortable living. Thus, Helen is asking for a loan to buy a fishing boat engine. In this way, she and her husband will be able to operate this business continually.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat engine.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has three school-aged children, ages 14, 10 and 7 years old. She is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business to earn a living. She sells a variety of goods.

Jovelyn goal in life are to improve her business in the future. Thus, she also wants to have a better means of living and give a better education to her children.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, toiletries, chips, candies and biscuits.

In this way, she will be able to uplift their livelihood and reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, toiletries, chips, candies and biscuits

loans.name: Generose

texts.en:
To earn a living, Generose and her husband are engaged in a fishing business. They have been doing this for 17 years. This business is their main source of income. They work together to provide for the needs of their family and give them a good education.

Generose and her husband have seven children. The oldest child is 16 years old while the youngest child is 3 years old.

Generose is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets. In this way, she and her husband will be able to enhance their catch and improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Batool Bibi

texts.en:
Batoul is 53 years old and a mother of seven children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She has a small child in her care. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Batoul is a power loom worker by profession because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses. Now, she wants to increase her business.

She has been working for seven years to help meet the family’s expenses. A LOOM is a device used to weave cloth and tapestry. The basic purpose of any loom is to hold the warp threads under tension to facilitate the interweaving of the weft threads.

Batoul wants to buy a power loom in order to earn a proper income, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to buy a power loom. Therefore Batoul has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Batoul can buy a power loom to earn a better income.

Batoul and her family will be thankful to the KIVA lenders and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy a power loom for herself.

loans.name: Walter Adriano

texts.es:
El Sr. Adriano tiene 40 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos  y conviviente en la Provincia de los Rios en el Canton Ventanaas.

Se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra y Cosecha de Maiz 

El Credito que solicita es para realizar la compra de insumos para la Siembra de Maiz. el tiempo libre se dedica al Deporte
texts.en:
Adriano is 40 years old, and he lives with his two children and his partner in the Rios province, in the Ventanas region.

He makes a living in agriculture, sowing and harvesting corn.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy supplies for sowing corn. In his free time he plays sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies for sowing corn.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en: Hayk lives with his big family in Kapan city of Syunik region. Hayk lives with his wife, sons, daughter-in-law and his grandchildren. He also has a daughter who is married and who lives in the Russian Federation with her family. Hayk used to do different construction jobs but now he is farmer and has a farm with cows, calves and bulls. He sells his farm’s milk, macun, and also meat to their regular customers who are their neighbors. Hayk is happy with his farming which also provides fresh dairy products for his family. Hayk is requesting this loan as he plans to increase the number of his farm cattle. He wants to buy one more cow and also a calf for his farm. This will also enable him to earn more for his big family.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also a calf for his farm, which will give him a chance to earn more for his big family

loans.name: Liboria

texts.es:
La socia continúa perteneciendo al banco comunal “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”
La socia Liboria  sigue dedicándose a la venta de granos, como maíz y cebada, este negocio es rentable pero trabajoso, por eso la socia desea seguir ampliando su negocio para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz y cebada, ya que aprovechara la temporada de fin de año.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She continues to be a member of the Yanahuara Señor De Torrechayoc communal bank. Liboria continues selling grains like corn and barley. This business is profitable, but very labor-intensive. She wishes to continue expanding her business in order to have a better quality of life.

Liboria requested the loan to buy corn and barley because she will take advantage of the end of the year season. She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy corn and barley.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda hails from the town of Sagbayan. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo, and assorted canned goods. She is a married woman with three school-aged children.

Her sari-sari (variety} store is situated near her home and serves customers, mostly neighbors and nearby residents. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs.

Belinda would like to improve her main source of income to become progressive and improve the family’s living condition. She would like to buy groceries for the store and pig feed. In that way, she will be able to raise quality hogs and maintain the inventory of merchandise, to cope with demands.

She dreams of becoming more productive and sustainable to support the education of all her children.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the store and pig feed

loans.name: Shomaila Bibi

texts.en:
Shomaila is 32 years old and a mother of three children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan.

Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Shomaila owns a bangles shop. She has been running her bangles shop for 7 years to meet the family’s expenses. Her shop is very famous in the colony, and that is the reason her business runs well. Due to good relations, her sales have increased a lot.

Now, Shomaila wants to invest in her bangles shop for a proper income, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase more bangles.

Therefore, she has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Shomaila can purchase more bangles to earn a proper income.

Shomaila and her family will be thankful to the KIVA lenders and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy bangles for her shop.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a 58-year-old man who lives in Concepcion, Iloilo with his family. He has eight children to support; five adults and three-school-aged. His wife stays at home and takes good care of them.

Leonardo works hard as a fisherman to provide for the needs of his family. He is requesting a loan because he needs to buy fishing materials to help him increase his catch. He will buy fishing net and fishing rope (which serve as the baseline of the fishing net).

In the future, Leonardo wants to improve his livelihood because he dreams of his children finishing their studies so they will have better lives someday.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and fishing rope

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 46-year-old married man who wakes up every day with a smile on his face, ready to work hard to provide for his ‎children, as he can in his grocery store.

He is a man who enjoys working independently, and he is responsible and attentive to his family. His business is the only ‎means by which he earns an income. This is why he works so hard every day.
His biggest dream is to be healthy so that he can go out and work every day.

He is currently requesting a loan to pay off a loan he had, and stock his business with different essential products. He ‎wants to be ready for the end-of-year season.‎

loans.use: To stock his grocery with different essential products.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is a 50-year-old woman who does domestic work for a living. She engages in a food vending livelihood. She makes and sells puto (steamed rice cakes), which aid her in covering the needs of the entire household.

She is married and has four grown children.

To improve her income, she also weaves native baskets made buri (palms).

For the last five years she has been weaving baskets, serving a particular client in her community.
She would like to produce more finished products, but she has very limited resources to do so.

Nila has requested a loan to invest in materials like nito and buri (a kind of palm) and wicker (pliable twigs). These will boost her basket-weaving business to improve the family's living conditions. Thus, she will be able to pay her obligations and handle her finances wisely.

loans.use: to  invest in materials like nito and buri (a kind of palm) and wicker (pliable twigs).

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en: Ashot is 50 years old and he lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Ashot has a daughter and a son and both of them are students living and studying in Yerevan city. Five years ago Ashot’s wife died and now he lives alone. Ashot has a higher musical education and he plays the violin and guitar. He works at the Kapan Art College as a teacher of violin. Ashot also gives paid private courses in playing the guitar to several pupils at his flat. These are mainly students who like it and they want to learn how to play that instrument which has become their hobby. With this loan Ashot wants to buy a new violin since his instrument is very old. He plans to start giving violin courses with the new instrument.

loans.use: to buy a new violin and with the new instrument  to start giving violin courses

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a hard working woman. She earns a living engaging in weaving native baskets made of buli (palm).

She is married with two children, who both attend school. Her husband earns a living by being a laborer. Together with her family, she resides in Antequera.

She has requested a loan to acquire capital to purchase materials like wicker (pliable twig), nito (a kind of fern), and buli ( a kind of palm) to enable her income to augment.

In the future, Maxima is hoping that she will become successful in her project to improve the family’s living condition and also finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase basket-weaving materials like wicker (pliable twig), nito (a kind of fern), and buli (a kind of palm).

loans.name: Jomayra Cecibel

texts.es:
La Sra. Jomayra tiene 21 años de edad tiene un hijo vive con su pareja en la provincia de los Rios en el Cnaton Ventanas .

Se dedica a la Agricultura siembra y cosecha de Maiz manifiesta que el credito va a realizar la compra de insumos .

En su futuro piensa en compra un terreno propio.

En su tiempo libre realiza deporte.
texts.en:
Jomayra, age 21, has one child. She lives with her life partner in the Los Rios province in the Ventanas canton. She grows and harvests corn.

She says that she will use the loan to buy supplies. In the future she plans to buy her own land.

She likes to play sports in her free time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Lebibe

texts.en:
Lebibe is the mother of one daughter who is 14 years old. Her husband is a car salesman for a private company, working all day for a small salary in order to earn a living,

Lebibe keeps two jobs. She is a cleaner and a babysitter for a private family, and she also works in agriculture, working on her own land. She typically plants wheat, corn and white beans to sell and for her own family's consumption to save on food expenses.

For the first time, she is requesting a loan in order to pay a worker to harvest the land, and she also wants to do some renovations to her home. She is not able to purchase a machine yet to do the harvesting herself and needs to pay someone else to work on the land.

Even with the expense of paying a worker, she is still able to see a profit and contribute to improving her family's living conditions. She really appreciates the help from the lenders, as renovating her home will directly impact their standard of living, and the income from her harvest will help improve their conditions as well. She promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to pay a worker to harvest the land, and also to do some renovations to her home.

loans.name: Selatin

texts.en:
Selatin is very grateful to all Kiva lenders for his previous loan, which has helped him to replace the doors of his house, making his home more secure and better insulated.

Recently he has started to operate a taxi on the side, driving clients around all of the various regions of Kosovo.

Selatin is requesting a loan to be able to service his vehicle and to purchase new tires for the upcoming winter season. The loan will ensure that he has safe and reliable transportation for his clients, securing his income through the winter.

He hopes that in the future he will be able to have his own taxi company to provide a much better income for his family.

loans.use: to service his vehicle and to purchase new tires for the upcoming winter season in order to attract more clients.

loans.name: Mariuxi Jaqueline

texts.es:
La Sra Jaqueline tiene 25 años de edad tiene 2 hijos vive con su pareja y sus hijos en la provincia de los Rios en el CantoN Ventanas .

Se dedica a la agricultura simbra y cosecha de Maiz manifiesta que el credito adquirida es para realizar el pago del arriendo del terreno piensa en su futura comprar un terreno propio.

El tiempo libre se dedica a la conversar en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Jaqueline, age 25, has two children. She lives with her life partner and her children in the Los Rios province in the Ventanas canton. She grows and harvests corn.

She says that the loan she got is to make the payment to rent the land. In the future she plans to buy her own land.

In her free time she likes to chat in her community.

loans.use: to make the payment to rent land.

loans.name: Rexhep

texts.en:
Rexhep is the father of two and is the main source of income. While he is employed in a construction company as a worker, he also works together with his wife in agriculture. They plant corn and wheat to sell for a profit, and have been doing so for years. They are very satisfied with the income that is generated this way, and he enjoys his work.

At this time, he is in need of a loan to purchase seeds for planting wheat and corn. The loan will directly lead to an increase in his income and ensure that he can continue to provide for his family.

He is very happy to have the opportunity to improve life for his family, and thanks all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting wheat and corn to increase his income and ensure that he can continue to provide for his family.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en: Lusine is 39 years old and she lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Kapan city of Syunik region. Lusine graduated from the Yerevan State Linguistic University faculty of English Language and Literature. For the past eleven years, Lusine has been working at her specialty, teaching English Language and Literature. At her house she also gives paid private courses in her subject and prepares a group of pupils to get ready for their entrance exams. Lusine finds her profession very interesting, useful and responsible and she manages her work with great seriousness and a sense of duty. Lusine is requesting this loan to buy big and nice bookshelves for her working room and to replace her house’s old windows with new ones which will provide more warmth during the winter months.

loans.use: to buy bookshelves for her working room and to replace her house’s old windows with new which will provide more warmth during winter months

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel and her husband are engaged in a fishing business to earn a living. They have been doing this for seven years to support their children. They have two children, who are seven and one year old.

Maribel is asking for a loan to help them buy a bamboo stem for their fishing boat. Aside from this, she will also buy gasoline to sell. Definitely, she is also engaged in this other business.

In the future, Maribel wants to improve their livelihood to have enough money to send their children to school.

loans.use: to buy bamboo and gasoline

loans.name: Emrush

texts.en:
Emrush is very thankful to all of the lenders for their previous support in building a greenhouse to ensure an income in the winter season, being able to produce more vegetables.

As the main source of income for his family, he works very hard and is always looking for a way to improve conditions for his family. He is still involved in an agricultural business, working and planting different vegetables in his greenhouse to sell in the markets.

He is very well known in his area by various customers for his fresh vegetables, including restaurants that purchase their fresh vegetables from him. He currently has two greenhouses but has so much demand that he is in need of an additional one.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase a third greenhouse. The third greenhouse will allow him to be able to increase his produce and his profit, and allow him to be able to provide even more for his family as well as continue to expand.

Emrush's goal is to one day expand his business to sell fruits as well.

loans.use: to purchase a third greenhouse to be able to increase his produce and his profit.

loans.name: Faredin

texts.en:
Faredin is the father of six children. He lives in the western part of Kosovo, in a municipality known for their wine production and vineyards. Faredin is involved in agriculture. He works on his land and plants corn, wheat and also has a vineyard with grapes for the wine.

His income has been sufficient, and he enjoys his work, but hopes that one day he will be able to expand his vineyard and primarily focus on selling the grapes.

For the first time, he is requesting a loan to plant corn and wheat so that he can continue to sell it for a profit and save to transition into more grapes. He really appreciates the help from the lenders and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to plant corn and wheat so that he can continue to sell it for a profit and save to transition into more grapes.

loans.name: Arbnor

texts.en:
Arbnor is 22 years old and single. Together with his family, he is involved in agriculture, planting different vegetables such as peppers and tomatoes, as well as wheat and corn, and he keeps cows and calves. He has been involved in this type of work based on his family tradition for much of his life. He works together with his brothers and sister to work the land, planting and harvesting the crops to sell in the market.

At this time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase some agricultural equipment for working on the land. The new tools will help Arbnor to be able to work more effectively and efficiently and increase the produce from the crops, increasing his income.

Arbnor and his family are very happy and satisfied with their livelihood and hope to be able to always continue in their family tradition.

He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase some agricultural equipment for working on the land to generate more income.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es: Diego es un padre de familia muy perseverante, él tiene 36 años de edad, cuenta que con el apoyo del crédito su terreno pudo comprar y a Dios gracias en ella se encuentra cultivando, por este avance él está muy contento más no conforme porque nuevamente se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo  que en esta ocasión lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la construcción de su casa, el comprara cemento,  block, costaneras y arena. Su gran sueño es llegar hacer un gran arquitecto para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Diego is a very diligent father. He is 36 years old. He could buy a plot using the help of a loan; thanks God, he is cultivating it.

He is very happy with this improvement, but he is not satisfied because he needs to request a loan again. This time he will use it to buy materials to build his house. He will buy cement, concrete blocks, metallic profiles and sand. His big dream is to become an architect to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, concrete blocks, metallic profiles and sand.

loans.name: Bujar

texts.en:
Bujar has three children between the ages of 2 and 14 years old. He is the main source of income for his family, since his wife stays home to take care of the family and the house.

For the last two years he has operated a taxi business, using his own van to transport children in his community to school. Sometimes he also drives the children for various field trips and other celebrations that are school-related.

At this time, he is in need of a loan in order to service his van and change the tires for the upcoming winter season. The loan will ensure that he is providing safe and comfortable conditions to transport the children in. It will also ensure that he will not lose any income due to a broken vehicle or inability to drive in bad conditions.

He promises to pay on time and thanks all of the lenders.

loans.use: to service his van and change the tires for the upcoming winter season to attract more clients.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace lives a simple life with her family in the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. She is a 33-year-old woman and a mother of three children, who are 10, 6 and 3 years of age.

She and her husband earn a living through fishing. They have been doing this for 15 years since they started their married life. They also work together to provide the needs of their family.

She is asking for a bigger loan to buy a new engine for her fishing boat and a fishing net to enhance their catch.

Additionally, Mary Grace is a woman who dreams that her family will have a comfortable means of living.

loans.use: to buy a new engine and a fishing net for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea and her husband are engaged in the fishing business like most people in Iloilo, Philippines. She and her family live in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. For five years, they raised and supported their children by doing this livelihood. The ages of their children are; 15, 12 and 5 years old and they still need support.

Rea is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP for funds to repair their fishing boat.

Her goal in life is to uplift their livelihood to have enough money to send their children to school and have them finish their studies.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is 50 years old without children. She lives in Diaralla. Hanaa is a second wife, and that made problems for her.

To ‎help generate an income, Hanaa sells home products and accessories, such as soap bars, kitchen supplies and ladies' ‎accessories, to her neighbors. The products come from the manufacturer, and she buys at a much lower price. ‎She sells them also at a low price, and through that, she gained a lot of customers.

Hanaa is requesting a loan to buy many kilos of soap bars, games for kids, and ladies' accessories as additional stock to sell ‎and deliver to her customers.

Hanaa wants to expand her business more to increase her income so she can continuously support herself and improve ‎the standards of her life.‎

loans.use: to buy many kilos of soap bars, games for kids, and ladies' accessories.

loans.name: Wesal

texts.en:
Wesal is a 53-year-old woman. She is married and has three children who are adults. She works, making her own ‎income; she sells blankets and tablecloths. Her business has ups and downs because the market is very saturated with ‎blankets.

Wesal knows that the future of her children depends on her and her husband, therefore she is working hard to ‎improve her business. Because of the winter season is coming soon, she applied for a loan to help buy blankets, bed ‎covers, and tablecloths to increase her income and develop her business.‎

‎ Her humble wish is that her children always have the opportunity to study, that lack of money is never an excuse to be ‎limited, and she will continue working to complete her goal.‎

loans.use: to help buy blankets, bed ‎covers, and tablecloths for resale to increase her income.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is a 59-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has ten children; nine adults and one-school-aged child.

Her husband is a fisherman and Melodina helps her husband in doing this business to earn a living. They have been doing this for 30 years and work together to provide and support the needs of their children.

Melodina is requesting a loan for boat maintenance. In addition to this, she wants to borrow money for additional capital to buy gasoline. Perhaps she is thinking of other business opportunities like selling gasoline to the community. In this way, she will be able to improve their earnings.

In the future, Melodina wants to improve their livelihood to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to pay for boat maintenance and to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
For the past 10 years, Marie has engaged in basket weaving as a livelihood. She makes and sells native baskets, which serves as the family's main source of income.

She is a 31-year-old, married woman and has two school-age children. Her income mainly goes for food and school expenses.

Marie has requested a loan to purchase materials like nito, buli (a kind of palm) and wicker (pliable twig). These could help enhance her source of income and slowly enable her to settle her obligation.

She is thankful for the funding and is determined to manage it successfully to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials like nito, buli (a kind of palm) and wicker (pliable twig).

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 48-year-old woman from the town of San Dionisio in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has four children: three adults and one school-age child. Respectfully, her husband is a fisherman, and she helps her husband in doing this business.

But aside from this, Helen is focusing on her dried fish selling, and she has been doing this for six years. This is the reason why is asking for a loan. She needs an amount of PHP 18,000 for additional capital for her dried fish selling business.

In the future, she wishes to improve her business for her children. She wants them to finish a degree.

loans.use: to buy dried fish

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling commodities like noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo and assorted canned goods.

She is married woman and has five children, of whom three are still attending school.

Her sari-sari (variety) store is situated near her home, and she is serving customers who are mostly neighbors and nearby residents.

Jocelyn would like to improve her main source of income to become productive and improve the family’s living conditions. She would like to buy groceries like drinks, flour, sugar and rice. These are vital tools for improvement and to continue to manage her livelihood and support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy groceries like drinks, flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, tooth paste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods. She is a 64-year-old widow and has six grown children. She resides in the rural town of Cortes, Bohol.

Due to the high demands for commodities, Jacinta would like to grab the opportunity to cater to its demands. Unfortunately, she has insufficient funds to finance her livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to purchase assorted groceries and soft drinks. With these, she will be able to maintain the inventory of supplies and help attract potential customers to her shop. Slowly, she could start to save for future use.

Jacinta is determined that she could make her business more productive and in turn, improve the living condition of her family in preparation for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase assorted groceries and soft drinks

loans.name: Ronamie

texts.en:
Ronamie is a resident of Carles, Iloilo. She earns a living by selling dried fish to the community. She has been engaged in this business for 20 years, since she started her married life; she is now 48 years old.

Ronamie has three children who are already grown up. She is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish to be able to increase her profit. In addition to this, Ronamie is planning on other business opportunities like raising pigs. In this way, she will be able to improve her livelihood and augment her earnings.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and for additional capital to buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Irma Esperanza

texts.es:
Irma está solicitando un nuevo crédito para reactivar su negocio, comprara camisas, pantalones, blusas, ropa interior, etc., ofrecerá a sus clientes mercadería con nuevas modas y a precios accesibles para vender más, su ilusión es continuar teniendo resultados positivos.
Con la ayuda del préstamo anterior su negocio sigue funcionando y generándole utilidades para ir subsistiendo junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Irma is requesting a new loan in order to replenish her business by purchasing shirts, pants, blouses, under garments, etc. She will offer her customers merchandise with new styles and affordable prices in order to sell more, and she hopes to continue having positive results.

With the help of the previous loan, her business continues functioning and generating profits for her, so that she and her family can continue to survive.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, blouses, under garments, etc., and offer her customers merchandise with new styles.

loans.name: François De Paul

texts.fr:
François est un brave père de famille de 43 ans. Il est marié et a deux enfants dont un seul est encore scolarisé. Il est un homme évolutif, car ses parents étant vendeur de légume et d’encas, il a donc amélioré son activité en un plus important marché. François est marchand de chaussure. Il a 15 années d’expérience dans ce domaine et en est à son 5eme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. 
Il a pour objectif de scolarisé son enfant et de tout faire pour qu’il réussisse dans la vie. Mais aussi d’étendre son activité en un plus vaste secteur et ajoutant d’autres articles pour la vente.
texts.en:
François, age 43, is the brave father of a family. He's married and has two children, only one still goes to school.

He is very flexible and he expanded the business of his parents, who were selling vegetables and snacks.

François is now selling shoes and has 15 years of experience in this field. He's seeking his fifth loan from Kiva's partner, CEFOR.

His goal is to ensure that his child gets and education and to make everything he can for him to be successful in his life. He also wants to expand the area covered by his business, and start selling additional products.

loans.use:
to buy men's shoes, mocassins, and 
acheter des chaussures hommes, mocassins and tennis shoes

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 55-year-old farmer. She is a mother who is hardworking, humble, and responsible. She has learned to do all of the ‎tasks involved in farming. She has a farm in Baqaa which is a refugee’s camp. Aisha and her husband are blessed with a ‎lovely family which consists of 8 members.

She has been a farmer for many years. She grows figs and olives to sell. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, ‎Aisha is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming, and now she has another farm to expand her business.

Aisha is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy farm implements. This move is quite a big deal for her.

In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. You can help Aisha to ‎accomplish all of her dreams and to become a great farmer. A loan will do a lot for her.‎

loans.use: to expand her farm and buy farm implements.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a Palestinian guy from Gaza Strip. He is 24 years old and single with no kids.

He chose to take a loan from ACAD to improve his standard of living by using the money to improve his business. He started the business five years ago by using a room in his parents' house. In the future, Khaled is looking to expand and develop his business and to increase the number of birds and pigeons to sell.

Khaled says that his business faces one challenge which is the increasing number of competitors in the area. Finally, Khaled wants to thank ACAD and Kiva for letting him share his story.

loans.use: to buy more birds and pigeons to sell.

loans.name: Heartchelle

texts.en:
Heartchelle is a sari-sari (variety) store owner and has been proficiently running this business for almost 10 years to earn a living. She and her family live in Carles, Iloilo. Her husband works hard as a driver to support the needs of their three children; they are 10, 8 and 5 years old.

Heartchelle is a 29-year-old woman who dreams of a business improvement for her family. She wishes for her children to finish their studies and have a better life in the future. For this, Heartchelle is asking for a bigger amount of loan for additional capital to buy commodities such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, flour, powdered chocolate drink and milk, chips, candies, bread, laundry soap and toiletries. Another part of her requested loan amount is to buy mobile electronic load.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, flour, powdered chocolate drink and milk, chips, candies, bread, laundry soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Marius

texts.fr:
Marius vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit. Ceci lui a permis d'acheter des téléphones portables et accessoires téléphoniques supplémentaires pour augmenter les marchandises et renforcer le fonds de roulement afin d'améliorer le revenu.
La construction de sa maison vient d'être entamée depuis peu, donc il a encore besoin d''augmenter le revenu pour y faire face et espère encore votre aide. Le développement de son activité est le meilleur moyen d'y parvenir selon ses dires. C'est pourquoi le couple s'efforce de travailler encore plus dur qu'auparavant.
texts.en:
Marius thanks the lenders for his previous loan, which enabled him to buy mobile phones and accessories, increase his stock, and bolster his working capital, so as to increase his income.

He has just started building a home, and to manage it, he needs to increase his income once more. He again hopes on lender's help.

Developing his business is the best way to be successful, he says. This is why he and his wife are working even harder than before.

loans.use: to buy cellular phones, batteries, chargers, memory cards, headphones...

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
For thirty years, Melodina and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business to earn living. They lived in Concepcion, Iloilo where most people in the community are involved in this livelihood. They work hard doing this business to provide and support the needs of their children. They have nine children: seven adults and two school-aged children.

They want to enhance their catch to have enough money to send their children to school. To reach this goal, they need the help of a loan. They want to borrow an amount to help them buy a fishing net, fishing weights, and a fishing rope that will probably help them enhance their catch.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, fishing weights, and a fishing rope.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a married woman with six children. She operates a retail shop, in addition to farming to support her family. She ‎applied for a loan to help her buy a new sewing machine, fabric, and yarn. She works very hard to provide for her children.

Laila has been in this business for 15 year sewing clothes and selling them. In the future, Laila would like to save enough to ‎provide a secure future for her family. ‎

loans.use: to help her buy new sewing machine, fabric, and yarn.

loans.name: Lado

texts.en:
Lado is a maize farmer from Badamasi village. As a Babban Gona member, Lado is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Lado would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Lado can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Lado no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Lado hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alhaji Ayuba

texts.en:
Alhaji Ayuba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Ayuba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alhaji Ayuba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Ayuba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Ayuba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Yohanna now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and his family members and would like to use this additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Zailani

texts.en:
Zailani is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Zailani is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Zailani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Zailani can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Zailani has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Zailani is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María  es una gran madre de familia de 54 años de edad, es casada con una familia de siete hijos de las edades entre 12 y 30 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
María para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica  a la compra y venta de ropa con este negocio lleva ella 10 años de realizarlo su negocio se ubica en el mercado central de su comunidad. Gracias a la amabilidad y simpatía que posee  María, mucha clientela la busca con frecuencia, a raíz de esta necesidad ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más mercadería y poder satisfacer mejor a sus clientes los productos que ella comprara son: fajas, cortes, güipiles y delantales. 
Su esperanza de vida es fortalecer aún más su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a wonderful mother, age 54. She is married, with 7 children between the ages of 12 and 30. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

María buys and sells clothing in order to earn an income and provide for her family. She has been working in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in the central market of her community. Thanks to her friendliness and kindness, María has many customers who often seek her out.

Because of this demand, she has decided to request a loan for the purchase of more merchandise, and to be able to better satisfy her customers. She will purchase fajas, cortes, güipiles, and delantales [Mayan traditional woven sashes, skirts, blouses, and aprons].

Her life's hope is to strengthen her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, such as fajas, cortes, güipiles and delantales [Mayan traditional woven sashes, skirts, blouses, and aprons].

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Rahila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rahila would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rahila can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Rahila will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Rahila is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a maize farmer from the village of Chiroma. As a Babban Gona member, Yusuf is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Yusuf can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yusuf no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Yusuf hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven estudiante que vive junto a sus padres y hermanos. Él decidió estudiar la carrera de Técnico de Ingeniería Mecánica de Mantenimiento, porque le fascina los mecanismos dentro de una máquina, y a la vez dar mantenimiento a las maquinarias. Es una carrera que lo beneficiará mucho tanto en lo personal como a su familia y comunidad, porque al culminarla podrá prestar servicios en su comunidad y también elaborar nuevas maquinarias. 

Le va muy bien en sus estudios, cada día está aprendiendo más cosas nuevas que despiertan mucho interés de su parte. Lleva estudiando 1 año, aún le faltan 2 años para culminar su carrera. Cuando egrese de SENATI, le gustaría trabajar como supervisor en una gran empresa. Su mayor sueño es lograrse como profesional, para poder retribuir a sus padres lo que hicieron por él. El mayor obstáculo que se le presenta en la vida es el económico, debido a la difícil situación económica que atraviesan al tener a un miembro de su familia muy delicado de salud.

Por este motivo, Carlos recurre a KIVA para que le puedan brindar el apoyo que tanto necesita y así pueda culminar exitosamente la carrera que tanto le gusta. Porque con este préstamo, sus padres y él se sentirían más tranquilos al saber que podrá acabar su carrera en el tiempo estimado y no tendría que dejar de estudiar.

Él quisiera expresarles unas palabras: "Me siento muy agradecido con KIVA ya que mis sueños seguirán para adelante y no se verán afectados por problemas económicos. Les doy las gracias porque sin conocerme, están apostando por mi persona, y decirles que Dios los bendiga por lograr que nuestras metas y sueños se cumplan gracias a su gentil apoyo."
texts.en:
Carlos is a young student who lives with his parents and siblings. He decided to study the career of Technical Maintenance Engineering Mechanics, because he is fascinated by the mechanisms inside a machine, while also maintaining the machinery. It is a career that will greatly benefit both him personally as well as his family and community, because once he receives his degree he can provide services in his community and also develop new machines.

Carlos is doing very well in school, and every day is learning more new things that increase his interest in the subject. He has completed one year of school, and has two more years until he completes his career. When he graduates from SENATI, he would like to work as a supervisor in a large company. His biggest dream is to become a working professional, so he can give back to his parents for all they have done for him.

The biggest obstacle in his life is a financial one, due to the difficult economic situation of having a member of his family in very delicate health. For this reason, Carlos is asking KIVA to provide him much-needed support so he can finish the career he loves so much. With this loan, him and his parents would feel much better knowing that Carlos could finish his schooling within the proper timeline, and that he would not have to leave school.

Carlos would like to express a few words: "I am very grateful for KIVA as my dreams will continue forward and will not be affected by financial problems. I thank you because without knowing me, you are betting on me, and God bless you for ensuring that our goals and dreams are met thanks to your kind support."

loans.use: to continue his studies of Mechanics and Maintenance and become a businessman.

loans.name: Thiệu

texts.en:
Mrs. Thiệu is 36 years old and married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Thiệu lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. The market need is low in this region, and the income from this business is not high enough to allow them to live a comfortable life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a new toilet. This is Thiệu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Thiệu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Thúy is a 49-year-old married woman who has raised poultry for 10 years.
Thúy lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household and the market need is low in this region. Her income is not enough to meet her needs.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She requests a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

In 2012, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid some loans from Thanh Hoa micro-finance institution.

In the future, Thúy hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: Daniela Eloisa

texts.es:
La Sra Daniela tiene 29 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos vive con su pareja en la provincia de los Rios Canton Ventanas .

trabaja en la agricultura siembra y cosecha de maiz la Sra manifienta que el creito va invertir en la compra de semillas de maiz para la siembra.

Su futuro piensa en comprar su propio terreno. sus tiempos libres se dedica a jugar bingo en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Daniela is twenty-nine years old, and she has two children. She lives with her partner in the province of Los Rios, in Ventanas Canton.

She works in agriculture, planting and harvesting corn, and she says that she will invest the loan in the purchase of corn seed for planting.

In the future, she intends to purchase her own land. In her free time she likes to play bingo in the community.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a maize farmer from Barangwaje village. As a Babban Gona member, Peter is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land -- 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Peter would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Peter can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Peter no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Peter hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haruna

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Haruna is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

In 2013, Duyến joined the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Since then, her living standard has improved. In the future, Duyến hopes her family will be healthy and happy and that she will be able to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Tâm

Her family is a low-income household in her village, and market demand is low in this region. The income from her business is not sufficient to do what she really needs to find comfort in her life. This is Tâm's first loan from the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true. In the future, Tâm hopes that her business will do well, that her family will be healthy and happy, and that she will make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.name: Mahmadsho

texts.ru: Махмадшо живет в районе Фархор. Ему 37 лет. И он доволен своей жизнью. Махмадшо отец двоих детей. У него нет жены, и расти детей ему помогает его сестра. Сейчас Махмадшо запрашивает кредит на сумму 1000,$ чтобы запустить свой новый бизнес-животноводство. У него есть сейчас одна корова, которая обеспечивает их молоком, но нет коровника. Скоро зима и нужно построить коровник. Часть кредита пойдет на постройку коровника другая часть на приобретения еще одного бычка. Этот бизнес позволит ему улучшить качество жизни своей семьи.
texts.en: Mahmadsho is 37 years old and lives in Farkhor. He is happy with his life. Mahmadsho is a father to two children. He doesn't have a wife and his sister helps him raise the children. Mahmadsho has applied for a loan of $1000 in order to start a new business raising cattle. He currently has one cow, which provides the family with milk, but no barn. Winter is coming and he needs to build a barn. A portion of the loan will go towards building the barn and the rest is for purchasing a young bull. This business will allow Mahmadsho to better his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to build a barn and purchase a young bull.

loans.name: Thơm

texts.en:

Her family is a low-income household in the village, and market demand is low in the region. The income from her business is not sufficient to permit her to do what she really needs to do in order to find comfort in her life. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is applying for a loan to buy sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Thơm's first loan from the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that the loan can make her little dream come true. In the future, Thơm hopes that her business will do well, that her family will be healthy and happy, and that she will make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en: Nicanora is a wife and a mother from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is an auto-mechanic. Nicanora, tried her best to be of help to her spouse by having a rice farm for five years now. Most of the time, she earns about PHP 3,500 every month. She is struggling with her finances as she is also supporting her two children aged one and eight. Nicanora is asking a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. Her income will be mainly used for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosie is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy buy ingredients like pork, stick, charcoal and other materials for her business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like pork, stick, charcoal and other materials for her business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her local market for her fish vending business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman, 59 years old with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Josefina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, pork and other materials for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, pork and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Janet works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Janet is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell at her local market for her fish vending business.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Kenzhey

texts.ru: Кенжей успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению, купив скот и корма. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Кенжей на сегодня есть 5 коров, 13 овец и 2 лошади. На 4,45 Га земли выращивает картофель и люцерну для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль Кенжей составляет до 12,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Кенжей планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса и постройку дома.
texts.en: Kenzhey successfully repaid her loan, which she used for its intended purpose, purchasing cattle and feed. She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who supported her financially. On her farm Kenzhey currently has five cows, thirteen sheep and two horses. On her 4.45 hectare plot she grows potatoes and alfalfa for profit. Her monthly income is approximately 12,000 KGS. Kenzhey has applied for another loan from Bai Tushum Bank, this time for 100,000 KGS, in order to purchase cows and increase her herd. She plans to invest the income from the loan in the further growth of her business and the construction of her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows

As a member of Babban Gona, Alhaji Abashe can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Alhaji Abashe has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Alhaji Abashe is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide farm employment to members of his community.

loans.use: to  eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a maize farmer from Kiyawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Naomi is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Naomi would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Naomi can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Naomi no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land, Naomi hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Solomi

texts.en:
Solomi is maize farmer from the village of Garibi. As a member of Babban Gona, Solomi is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, she has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Solomi would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Solomi can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Solomi is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and hopes to use her increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Magret has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Magret would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Magret can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Magret will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Magret is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to  eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and four of her children are presently in school.

She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional vegetables like cabbage, potato, citrus, onions, garlic, spices, etc to sell to her store.

Gemma has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables like cabbage, potato, citrus, onions, garlic, spices, etc to sell to her store

loans.name: Ruzivo Group

texts.en:
Despite losing her job Judith knew that she had to be strong since her husband had fallen ill and also lost his job the previous year. Judith is 48 years old, she is married with four school going dependants.

Judith started her career in entrepreneurship in 2002 when she started selling eggs. She did this for about 8 years and just barely made ends meet. Her husband got better, however, and they started to work together to fend for the family. Around 2010, she finished constructing a fowl run and started broiler rearing. The following year she bought a peanut butter machine. She would grind peanuts into peanut butter for a fee.

Judith has now joined hands with her neighbours who are in different business ventures and formed a group called Ruzivo translated as “Knowledge,” as they say 'knowledge is power'. This group has been passed through the financial literacy training at Thrive and they believe they are now well equipped to run their businesses more profitably by reducing costs which arose as a result of ignorance.

Judith is borrowing money so that she can buy her own peanuts and sell the peanut butter herself, she also intends to increase her chicken batch size from a hundred to two hundred since her fowl run is big enough to carry that much. These women have approached Thrive for a combined loan of $1150.

loans.use: to increase her chicken batch size from a hundred to two hundred since her fowl run is big enough to carry that much.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with 7 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are regulars. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Lucy will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Helen works hard to support her family.
