She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Helen is borrowing PHP 7,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell to her customers through her fish-vending business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Eden is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Eden has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell from her stall.

Eden has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta is from Vanadzor town where she and her son has been involved in retailing fruit and vegetables for 17 years already. They rent a truck, transport the supplies to nearby open markets and sell their products there. Greta lives together with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and infant grandchildren.

Currently Greta and her son sell only onions, but to be prepared for the upcoming high demand, Greta asks for this loan to purchase different types of fruit and vegetables to sell in the upcoming holiday season. With a good credit history behind her, Greta promises responsible monthly payments and dreams of seeing her business grow in future.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of fruit and vegetables for the upcoming holiday season sales.

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn runs a repair shop, specializing in motorcycle and multi-cab repair services. She is a 41-year-old, married woman, living together with her family. She lives in the rural area of Antequera with her husband and children.

Emilyn needs equipment that is essential in her business, but she has insufficient funds to acquire those resources. Therefore, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan from its field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), to purchase tools and a compressor.

In this way, she would be able to offer quality services and attract customers to avail themselves of her services.

With the loan, she can use the profit amount as savings to fulfill her future needs. She is also hoping that she could open up another business to become progressive in the future.

Emilyn is very thankful to Kiva for the continued support.

loans.use: to purchase tools and a compressor.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be ambitious.

Justius operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more bags of maize.

He hopes that in the future, he will be a maize supplier and will take care of his family. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is a married woman, 55 years old, with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Dionesia has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy vegetables to sell from her food stall, such as squash, beans, and eggplants.

Dionesia has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell from her food stall, such as squash, beans, and eggplants.

loans.name: Lourd Jane

texts.en:
Lourd Jane is a hardworking female entrepreneur with two children.

She has a restaurant in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils for her restaurant.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling charcoal.

Lourd Jane dreams that, one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor is 23 years old and lives in Dilijan city of the Tavush region with his father and grandmother. Grigor is a student in his last year of studies at the Yerevan State Agricultural Institute in the Faculty of Accountancy. He studies at the distance learning department which gives him a chance to also work. Simultaneously with his education he works at one of the city’s hotels. Grigor is the only bread-winner in his family and he works without holidays in order to earn more and to manage to cover his family’s needs.

Grigor has a nice bride and is going to get married in the very near future. He is asking for this loan of 400.000 AMD in order to complete all his wedding organization work and also to buy nice presents for his beloved bride.

loans.use: to complete all his wedding organization work and also to buy nice presents for his beloved bride.

loans.name: Nagela Galud

texts.es:
La Sra. Angela tiene 31 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos  vive con su pareja  en la provincia de los Rios Canton Ventanas.

Se dedica a la agricultura siembra y cosecha de Maiz coenta la Sra. Angela comenta que con el credito que realiza va hacer invertido en la compra de semilla para la siembra.

En el futuro piensa seguir apoyando en sus hijos en el estudio.

los tiempos libres se dedica ir a la cacha a realizar de deporte.
texts.en:
Angela is 31 years old, she has 3 children, and lives with her partner in the province of Rios Canton Ventanas.
She works in agriculture. She farms and harvests maize. She says that with the loan she os getting she will invest in seeds for farming.
In the future she plans to continue supporting her children with their studies.
In her free time she goes to the courts to do some sport.

loans.use: to buy seeds for farming.

loans.name: Henry Javier

texts.es:
Sr. Henry teiene 29 años de edad  es solteroo trabaja y vive en la Provincia de los Rios en el Cantos Ventanas.
El joven manisfiesta que el credito va hacer invertido en la compra de insumos y semillas de maiz.

En el futuro el socio piensa realizar riegos para los sembrios.

El tiempo que tiene libre se dedica a resalizar deporte.
texts.en:
Henry is 29 years old and single.  He lives and works in the Ventanas Canton of the Los Ríos province.  This young man states that he is going to invest this loan in the purchase of corn seeds and supplies.  

He is thinking of irrigating his fields in the future.

In his free time he plays sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies for planting.

loans.name: Grupo Las Hermanas De Samayac Group

texts.es:
Iris es una mujer de 29 años de edad es casada con una familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 6 y 14, dos ellas estudian la primaria, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Samayac.
Iris (la primera del lado derecho) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de granizadas y helados, con este negocio lleva ella 3 años de realizarlo, su casa se ubica en frente de su casa.
Iris con el afán de vender mejor y obtener mejores ingresos a decidido vender de forma ambulante, pero lo que le hace falta es un triciclo para tener donde poner mejor su producto y venderlo, a raíz de esta necesidad solicita un préstamo  pode comprar este triciclo y salir a vender.
Su gran sueño es fortalecer su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Iris is twenty-nine years old, and she is married with three children between the ages of six and fourteen. Two of the girls are studying in primary school. This family lives in a community in Samayac.

Iris (the first lady on the right) sells snowballs and ice cream, in an effort to earn income and provide for her family. She has been working in this business for three years. Her stand is located in front of her house.

In an effort to improve sales and earn better income, Iris decided to make her sales by street vending, but she lacks a tricycle cart in which she can better carry and sell her products. That is why she is requesting a loan: so that she can purchase this tricycle and go out to make her sales.

Her biggest dreams are to strengthen her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a vending tricycle cart for her snowball business.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 38 años de edad es casada con una linda familia de un hijo de 9 años de edad, está familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Chuachinup.
Catarina con el afán obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica con este negocio lleva ella 10 años de realizarlo, su negocio se ubica en el mercando central de su comunidad.
A Catarina le preocupa mucho no contar con suficiente  producto para este fin de año por esa razón acude a un préstamo para comprar productos de ropa como: güipiles, fajas y cortes y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y aprovechar mejor la demanda.
Su gran sueño es contar con su propio local de negocio, fortalecer su negocio  y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Catarina, a 38 year old woman, is married and has a beautiful family that includes her 9 year old son. The family lives in a community in the village of Chuachinup.

Catarina desires to earn income to get her family ahead, so she buys and sells traditional clothing, and has been engaged in this business for ten years. Her business is located in the central market of her community.

Catarina is worried about not having enough merchandise for the end of the year and, for this reason, she is applying for a loan to purchase “güipiles” [traditional loose-fitting, intricately woven tunics], “fajas” [sashes] and “cortes” [skirts], which will enable her to meet her customers’ needs, and take better advantage of the demand.

Her great dreams are to have her own business local, strengthen her business, and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing such as "güipiles", "fajas" and "cortes".

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy is 24 years old. He is a single student from the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. He is an Information Technology major at a university in the city.

In order to support his study, he has worked in data entry in an NGO since 2014. Being on staff, Channy can earn approximately USD 5 per day.

Channy is in the first year at the university and, since he is lacking finances to pay his second semester tuition fees of the first year, he requested a loan, which will help him successfully finish the second semester of the first year.

This is his second loan cycle with Kiva. In the future, he plans on finding a better job with a reasonable salary, so he will be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his second semester tuition fees of the first year.

loans.name: Putsa

texts.en:
Putsa is 21 years old and he is a nursing student in his third year at the university in the city. He is from the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. His parents are rice farmers.

Due to the fact that he is short of finances, Putsa would like to request a loan to pay his tuition fees from the third to fourth year. With this loan, he will be able to graduate successfully with the skills to build his future.

For his dreams, Putsa is going to find a good job with a decent salary, so he will be able to build a proper new house for his parents. Whenever he has children, he wants his children to study to pursue a bachelor's or master's if he can support it.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees from the third to fourth year.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 64 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Vergie has a purified drinking water retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. Vergie requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of drinking water to resell.

In the future, Vergie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinking water to resell.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
José, está satisfecho por los buenos resultados que tiene al utilizar créditos en su negocio, lo cual hace que se decida a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar zippers, botones, hilos, broches, dedales, etc., así fabricará las prendas de vestir que le han encargado sus clientes y tendrá siempre los ingresos que tanto necesita para salir adelante.
Considera que la sastrería ha crecido mucho con la ayuda de créditos, hoy en día cuenta con una cartera de clientes más grande y la nueva situación financiera de José le permite apoyar a su padre con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
José is satisfied with the good results he has had using loans for his business. So he has decided to request a new loan to buy zippers, buttons, thread, fasteners, thimbles, etc. to make the clothing ordered by his clients and always have the income so necessary to get ahead.

He considers that his sewing workshop has grown a lot due to the help of the loans. Today he has a larger portfolio of clients and Jose's new financial situation allows him to support his parents with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy zippers, buttons, thread, fasteners, thimbles, etc. to make the clothing ordered by his clients.

loans.name: Eric Ernesto

texts.es:
El Joven Eric tiene 19 años de edad  es soltero vive con lo abuelos en la provincia de los Rios Canton Ventanas.

El Joven Eric manifiesta que se dedica a la agricultura simebra y cosecha de maiz el credito va ser invertido en la compra de semillas.

En su futuro piensa seguir trabajando, sus tiempos libres se dedica al deporte que es el Futbol.
texts.en:
Young Eric is 19 years old.  He is single and lives with his grandparents in the province of Canton Rios Ventanas.

Young Eric says that he works in agriculture in the planting and harvesting of corn.  He will invest the loan in the purchase of seeds.  

For the future , he plans to continue working.  His free time is dedicated to soccer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting

loans.name: Pedro Adolfo

texts.es:
Pedro es casado, junto a su esposa tienen dos hijos de 18 y 20 años de edad, toda la familia depende de los ingresos que él genera, sus actividades económicas son la administración de una pupusería y de un chalet, negocio que nace por la necesidad de tener un sustento diario para su familia, trabaja de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
Invertirá en golosinas, bebidas, dulces, pan, etc., la finalidad de la compra es pagar un costo menor por la mercadería y surtir mucho más su inventario, la esperanza de Pedro es seguir trabajando, brindar un mejor servicio y atraer a nuevos clientes.
La visión de don Pedro es lograr que su negocio sea más rentable y que mantenga la fidelidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pedro is married. He and his wife have two children who are 18 and 20 years old. The whole family depends on the income that he generates. His occupation is running a shop where he sells stuffed tortillas (pupuseria), and a snack bar, a business that was born of the need to have daily sustenance for his family. He works from six in the morning until four in the afternoon.
He will invest in candy, drinks, sweets, bread, etc. The aim of the purchase is to pay a lower price for the merchandise and to stock her inventory much more. Pedro's hope is to continue working, provide a better service, and attract new clients.
Pedro's vision is to achieve the goal that his business becomes more profitable and that he will maintain his client's loyalty.

loans.use: to invest in candy, drinks, sweets, bread, etc. to pay a lower price and stock his inventory.

loans.name: Duyen's Group

texts.en:
Duyen is 30 years old and is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has four members including her husband, her daughter and her son. The family lives in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her husband’s salary and his income is just enough to cover the family's living expenses at a limited spending level. She wants to raise pigs and goats but she does not have enough money to invest in the breeding model in term of expanding the breeding facilities.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have good conditions to expand the breeding model and to develop it well. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise pigs and goats.

loans.name: Men's Group

texts.en:
Men was born in 1974 and is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from breeding animals. The annual income is not worth much and she wants to buy mash for her pigs and chickens. Because she does not have enough money to buy mash, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in the animal breeding effectively with high productivity. She will work hard to get the money to repay the loan for M7-MFI.

loans.use: to buy mash for pigs and chickens

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer independiente y muy trabajadora. Vive con su pareja con crió a su hijo de 20 años. Estudió la carrera de contaduría. Actualmente vive en Coahuila y se dedica únicamente a su negocio desde hace ocho años. Inició en este negocio porque su anterior trabajo lo de daba la oportunidad de convivir con su familia y era muy desgastante. Después de este tiempo, Gabriela ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes sólida.
El negocio es un mini súper, en donde vende una gran variedad de productos, sin embargo, Gabriela siempre ha querido ver más próspero su negocio y por eso solicitó un crédito. 
El dinero del crédito que solicitó, le ha ayudado a comprar más mercancía para que así, sus ventas puedan incrementarse y sus ganancias sean mayores. Con el crédito, pudo implementar en su mini súper la venta de perfumería, papelería y juguetería.
Su meta en el negocio es lograr un incremento en sus ventas y ganancias, lo que le brindará mayores beneficios en su vida profesional y personal.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 44 years old.  She is a very hardworking and independent woman.  She lives with her partner, with whom she raised her 20-year-old son.  She went to school for a degree in accounting.  Currently, she lives in Coahuila and has worked exclusively at her own business for the past eight years.  She started this business because her previous job didn’t give her the chance to live with her family and was really exhausting.  

Over the years Gabriela acquired a solid customer base.  Her business is a small grocery store where she sells a wide variety of products.  Nevertheless, Gabriela has always wanted her business to be better off and because of this, she asked for a loan.  The money from the loan she requested has helped her to buy more merchandise so that her sales can increase and her earnings can improve.  With this loan, she managed to start selling fragrances, office supplies, and toys in her store.

Her goal in business is to achieve an increase in sales and earnings, which will give her greater benefits in her professional and personal life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise so her sales can increase and her earnings can improve

loans.name: Akylai

texts.ru: Акылай, 28 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, по характеру ответственная, доброжелательная, вежливая. Акылай занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Акылай ее деятельность приносит около 13,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. На 0,59 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Акылай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 телят для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Акылай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Akylai is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She has secondary education, and is responsible, friendly, and respectful by nature. Akylai is a farmer. Thanks to Akylai's persistent hard work, her business brings in about 13,000 som (KGS) a month. On her farm there are two cows. On 0.59 hectares of land she cultivates corn. 

With the aim of further developing her business, Akylai has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to buy five calves for fattening up and resale. Akylai plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further augmentation of her business.

loans.use: to buy five calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Besi Margarita

texts.es: La entrada de la vivienda de Besi es de difícil acceso, y en ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad. Besi se gana la vida con su tienda de productos básicos, actividad que le permite sostener a su familia desde hace 5 años. Ella desea construir las gradas de acceso a su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava y ladrillos, para construir las gradas de acceso a su vivienda.
texts.en: The entrance of Besi's house is hard to access. She lives with her life partner and her two sons who are 15 ad 19 years old. Besi makes a living with her shop of basic products, an activity which has allowed her to support her family for the last 5 years. She hopes to build the steps to access her house, which is why she asks for a loan from FUSAI, to buy: cement, sand, gravel, and brick, to build the steps to access her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and brick, to build the steps to access her house.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
As a farmer from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Thy, 49 years old, is working very hard on the rice field near her house. She is a hard-working mother of three children, two married. She can earn approximately 5 USD a day. Being a farmer is the main work that she has done for more than twenty years.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, Thy is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and other related materials.

So she hopes that this equipment will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy some farm supplies

loans.name: Carla Stephany

texts.es:
Carla continúa estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas y trabajando en el banco. El crédito anterior lo invirtió pagando las cuotas de la universidad, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo continuar trabajando normalmente. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el tercer año de universidad, le faltan 2 para terminar, su hija continúa asistiendo a la escuela y le gusta ir a clases, “me siento satisfecha por terminar un año más de mi carrera, ahora me pongo al día para el año que viene…” comenta. La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios no se cruzan entre sí porque trabaja en horarios de oficina y estudia por las noches, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para pagar las cuotas de la universidad y recibir un descuento. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar para obtener un mejor puesto laboral, ella desea pagar las cuotas de la universidad por adelantado. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carla solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de la universidad por adelantado y recibir un descuento.
texts.en:
Carla is continuing to study for a degree in business administration and is working for a bank.  With her previous loan, she paid her university fees, and she was able to make her loan payments on time because she continued to work as usual.  At this time, she is in her 3rd year at the university; she needs 2 more to finish.  Her daughter continues to attend school, and she enjoys going to her classes, "I feel satisfied because I have finished another year toward my degree, and now I'm ready for the coming year," she comments.  

The advantage of her activities is that the schedules don't conflict, because she works in the office during the day and studies at night.  The disadvantage is that she lacks the money to pay her university fees in advance to receive a discount.  Her dream is to finish her studies so that she can get a better job.  She wants to pay her university fees in advance.  This is the 2nd loan that she has taken with the institution in the 3 years that she has been undertaking this activity. 

This is why Carla is requesting a loan to pay her university fees in advance, so that she can receive a discount.

loans.use: to pay her university fees in advance so that she can receive a discount

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Fifty-eight year old Cresencia earns a living weaving native baskets made of buri (palm).
She is a married woman with four grown children. She resides in the rural area of Antequera, Bohol.
She also engages in food vending to have supplemental income.

She would like to improve the number of baskets she can make in a week but she has very limited resources to make it possible. Therefore Cresencia is requesting a Kiva loan from its field partner CEVI to buy basket materials like nito (a kind of palm) and wicker (pliable twigs). She will use some of the loan amount as capital for food vending.

She will be able to produce a higher quantity of finished products and also boost her food vending livelihood.

loans.use: to buy basket weaving materials like nito (a kind of palm) and wicker (pliable twigs) and provide capital for food vending.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio lives in Trinidad with his wife who is a teacher. While she teaches, Antonio raise hogs at home. This has been his business for five years now. Antonio even has a sow that produces piglets. He is taking good care of his sow so that she will give him piglets in the future.

Antonio is asking for a loan to buy sacks of pollard feed and also new sets of piglets that he can raise to sell in four months.

He hope that with this additional capital he can improve his business and make it more sustainable. In the future, he hope to have a concrete barn for his pigs.

loans.use: to buy pollard fee and piglets

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is from the town of Lila. She is 44 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. She is a fish vendor. Her husband is working abroad.

For the past five years, she has been selling fish, serving neighbors and town settlers in her place.

She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials like foam (fish storage), a pail, cellophane, and a variety of supplies of fish.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase materials like foam (fish storage), a pail, cellophane, and a variety of supplies of fish.

loans.name: Angel Adriano

texts.es:
El Sr. Angel  tiene 44 anños ded edad  tiene 2 hijos  vive con su pareja en la Provincia de los Rios Cnaton Ventanas .

El Sr. Angel manifiesta que con el credito desea invertir en la compra de semillas para la siembra de maiz

Se dedica a la agricultura siembra y cosecha de Maiz en su futuro pienza en comprar un terreno.

Su tiempo libre se dedica a jugar bingo.
texts.en:
Angel is 44 years old.  He has 2 children and lives with his partner in the Ventanas canton of the Los Ríos province.  He works in agriculture, sowing and harvesting corn.  He states that he wants to invest this loan in the purchase of corn seeds to plant.  

He is thinking of buying a plot of land in the future.

In his free time, he likes to play bingo.

loans.use: to buy corn seed

loans.name: Jorge Manuel

texts.es:
EL Sr. Manuel tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos vive solo en la Provincia de los Rios en el Canton Ventanas.

El Sr. Manuel manifiesta que el credito va hacer invertido en la compra de semilla e insumos en su futuro piensa comprarse una casa 

El tiempo libre se dedica a jugar Indor.
texts.en:
Manuel is 36 years old. He has two children. He lives alone in Ventanas Canton, in the Province of los Rios.

Manuel states that he will use the loan to invest in buying seeds and supplies. In the future he is thinking of buying a house.

In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Jenny Liliana

texts.es:
Sra. Jenny tiene 23 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo vive con su paraeja en la Provincia de los Rios Canton Ventanas .

La Sra. Jenny se dedica a la agricultura siembra y cosecha de Maiz.

La Sra. manifiesta que el credito va hacer invertido en la compar de semilla para la compra de semilla en su futuro piensa compra un terreno .

Su tiempo libre se dedica a bailar.
texts.en:
Jenny is 23 years old.  She has one child and lives with her partner in the Ventanas canton of the Los Ríos province.  Jenny works in agriculture, planting and harvesting corn.  She states that he is going to invest this loan in the purchase of seeds.  

She is thinking of buying a plot of land in the future.

In her free time, she dances.

loans.use: to buy corn seed

loans.name: Inayat

texts.ru: Инаят, 61 год, замужем, она счастливая многодетная мама 8 детей. Образование- среднее. В хозяйстве Инаят есть 4 коровы, 10 овец и 3 лошади. На 0,15 Га земли, она выращивает картофель для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Инаят обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Инаят планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и хочет накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Inayat is 61 years old, married, and she is a happy mother of eight children. She has secondary education. On her farm Inayat has four cows, ten sheep, and three horses. On 0.15 hectares of land, she cultivates potatoes for sale. 

With the view of further developing her farm, Inayat has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy cows for increasing her herd. Inayat plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business, and wants to save to renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy some cows in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Nhu's Group

texts.en:
Nhu, a Kinh ethnic majority woman, has been a member of the M7-MFI program since 2012. She currently lives with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from a clothes business and the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family including paying for her daughter’s education fees. She wants to raise pigs to sell but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in pig breeding effectively. Next year selling pigs will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to raise pigs

loans.name: Fathullo

texts.ru: Фатхулло 47 летный отец 5 детей. Его дети взрослые и воспитанные. Старший сын учится в университете города Душанбе. Младшие учатся в средней школе. Фатхулло хочет, чтобы его дети имели высшую образованию как сам Фатхулло. У Фатхулло есть высшая медицинская образования. Он фармацевт, и работает в аптеке. Иногда он помогает соседям медицинской помощи. Фатхулло серьезный и честный отец. Он любить своих детей и всегда поддерживает их. Фатхулло с одной целью обратился за кредитом. Он хочет взять кредит и оплатить за обучения старшего сына. У Фатхулло возникли финансовые проблемы, и он не может оплатить за обучения сына. По этой причине Фатхулло просит кредит.  Вы можете поддержать эту мужчину!  Фатхулло благодарен за Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Fathullo is 47 years old and has five children. His children are adults and well brought up. His elder son is a university student in Dushanbe city. His younger children are studying in middle school. Fathullo wants his children to obtain higher education, like Fathullo himself. Fathulla has higher education in medicine. He is a pharmacist, and works in a pharmacy. Sometimes he helps the neighbours with medical queries. Fathullo is a serious and honest father. He loves his children and always supports them. 

Fathullo has applied for a loan with one goal. He wants to take a loan and pay for his elder son's education. Financial problems have cropped up with Fathullo, and he cannot pay for his son's education. For this reason Fathullo is requesting a loan. You can help support this man! Fathullo is thankful for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ISABEL”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Filomena la socia continua con su negocio de agricultura, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua cultivando cafe, cacao y plátanos para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera mediantes su negocio poder obtener más ganancias para de esta manera continuar apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas, abono entre otros.
Los socios en general  agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
El socio que sale a la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank "Santa Isabel."  This group is located in the Santa Ana district of La Convencion province, in the department of Cusco. 

Filomena, a member of this group, is continuing to work as a farmer.  She has been in this business for years, and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into the business every day.  She is continuing to cultivate coffee, cocoa, and bananas for the customers who demand these products. Filomena is an enterprising woman who hopes to obtain more income through her business.  This way she can continue to support her family.

Filomena is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies.

All of the members of this group want to thank those who are supporting their dreams, and they promise to comply with the payment terms of their loans.  The member of the group in the photo at the bottom right had asked permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: para comprar semillas, abono entre otros.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Ms. Lan is 55 years old and she is a single parent with 2 children.

She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables for more than 10 years. Lan lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village and, moreover, her job is unstable.

Her family has no latrine. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. Lan is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a hardworking 43-year old woman who earns a living by being a dealer of Avon products, such as cologne, whitening soap, body spray, and household wares. She also raises hogs.

To cater for the family's needs, she also sells electronic load and sells purchase order (p.o.) cards, which could be used as cash substitutes in particular groceries, and are payable when due. She is married and has two children, both of whom are attending school.

She wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with CEVI to purchase additional top-up electronic load and purchase orders (p.o.) cards and to buy a pig, to continue improving her business. She used the previous loan to rebuild her livelihood and hopes to continue doing so.

For the future, Esterlita is looking forward to doing her best to expand her business to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional top-up electronic load and purchase order (p.o.) cards, and to buy a pig.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio es un apersona dedicada a cultivar granos básicos y a comercializar ganado, tiene su propio negocio hace 24 años, con un horario de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, aprendió estas actividades de su padre, la ventaja que tiene don Lucio en su negocio es que ya tiene muchísima experiencia; Lucio vive con su esposa y dos hijos, en totalidad su familia tiene 3 miembros.
Él ha solicitado un crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de una novilla e insumos agrícolas para seguir trabajando en el campo, pretende aumentar el ganado y tener cosechas mucho más abundantes.
Su sueño es tener más animales para ser propietario de una ganaría mucho más grande y de esta manera tener una situación financiera que le permita darle a su familia un estilo de vida más digna.
texts.en:
Lucio is a person whose occupation is to farm basic grains and to sell livestock. He has had his own business for 24 years, with a schedule from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon. He learned these occupations from his father. Lucio's advantage is that he already has a lot of experience. He lives with his wife and two children; in total his family has three members.
He is asking for a loan to use in the purchase of a heifer and agricultural inputs to keep working in the fields. He hopes to increase his livestock and have more abundant harvests.
His dream is to have more animals in order to be the owner of a much bigger amount of livestock, and in this way have a financial situation which will allow him to give to his family a more dignified standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and agricultural inputs to keep working in the fields.

loans.name: Grupo Las Cruces Escuela Group

texts.es:
Ana es una madre de familia de 60 años de edad, es casada con una familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre veinticinco y cuarenta y cinco años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de del cantón las cruces.
Ana (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía)  para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de gaseosas y granizadas con este negocio lleva ella 10 años de realizarlo, a pesar de su avanzada edad aún tiene fuerzas y ganas de seguir  superándose.  Junto a un grupo de personas Ana ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio pues la época de verano ya comienza por lo tanto su negocio va a tener demanda, ella comprara refrescos, hielo y colorantes. Su mayor anhelo es contar con su propio local de negocio, fortalecer su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 60, is married and the mother of a family with four children between the ages of 25 and 45. They live in a community in Las Cruces Canton.

Ana (the first one on the left in the photograph) earns a living buying and selling soda and shaved ice. She has had this business for 10 years and, despite being older, she still has the energy and desire for self-improvement.

Ana has decided to request a loan with a group of people to invest in her business. Summer's coming and her business will be in demand. She's going to buy soft drinks, ice, and food coloring.

Her biggest desire is to have her own store to strengthen her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products for her business, including soft drinks, ice, and food coloring

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина жительница города Худжанд. Она с молодостью интересовалось шитьем, вышивкой национальных изделий.  Этому ремеслу Заррину научила ее тетя. Вышивание  ее любимое дело. Заррина замужем и имеет двоих детишек. Ее муж находится в городе Москва. Он там работает и зарабатывает на жизнь. Заррина живет вместе свекровью и детьми. Ей помогает свекровь. Заррина мечтает научиться вышивать лучше и быть самой искусной мастерицей в своем деле. Она запрашивает кредит для купли ткани и швейные принадлежности. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей расширить деятельность.
texts.en:
Zarrina is a resident of Khujand city. From a young age she has been interested in sewing and embroidering national goods. Zarrina was taught this trade by her aunt. Embroidery is her favourite work. Zarrina is married and has two young children. Her husband lives in Moscow. He works there and makes his living there. Zarrina lives with her mother-in-law and children. Her mother-in-law helps her. 

Zarrina dreams of learning to embroider better and being the skilled master of her own business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase fabrics and sewing supplies. The requested loan will help her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Cineza

texts.en:
Cineza is an entrepreneur at heart. She is 45 years old with six children. Her eldest is 21 and the youngest is three.

Her husband does not earn much from his painting work. Cineza, on the other hand, helps by raising hogs, selling dried fish and providing a hair-cutting service to the people in the community of Trinidad, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy sacks of feed and more stock of dried fish that she can resell. Cineza's income from these businesses is primarily used for her children's needs such as food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and pollard (pig feed).

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Rith, who is 30, comes from Kampong Cham Province. He is a farmer and a security guard in a private company, and the father of one child. His wife is also a farmer on the cassava farmland. To make a living, Rith manages and operates a farming business, growing cassavas to sell. He earns an average of $7.00 (USD) a day. So far, he has been in this career for six years. 
To ensure a good harvest, he requires some workers to assist him with the harvest on the cassava fields, but he doesn’t have sufficient money to do so. Therefore, he would like to apply for a Kiva loan to hire workers to harvest on his cassava fields. He would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to hire workers to harvest on his cassava fields

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 60 years old and married with ten children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma has a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned good, noodles and other groceries.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Argie is 29 years old and both of her children are enrolled in school. Argie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Argie requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Argie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Argie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es:
José, vive en una una zona rural en compañía de su esposa y sus dos hijos, tienen  doce años de residir en dicho lugar, no tienen más entradas de dinero que las que generan al cultivar maíz y pipianes, tiene más de 15 años de practicar esté oficio, también posee ganado de clase, sus padres le enseñaron el oficio.
El capital le servirá para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar la preparación de dos manzanas y media terreno en el que podrá cultivar maíz y pipianes, tiene buenas expectativas para sacar cosechas más abundantes, pues en la zona donde trabaja la tierra es muy fértil y húmeda.
Los planes de José son trabajar para tener cosechas más abundantes, almacenar granos para alimentar a su familia, vender su producto a buenos precios y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
Jose lives in a rural area with his wife and his two sons. They have lived in this place for twelve years. They do not have any more source of income besides farming maize and squash. He has had this occupation for 15 years. He also owns some livestock. His parents taught him about this trade.
The capital will be used to buy agricultural inputs and to pay for the preparation of two-and-a-half units of land (one unit = 7000 square meters), where he will be able to farm maize and squash. He has good expectations to have more abundant harvests, because in the zone where he works the land is very fertile and wet.
Jose's plans are to work to have more abundant harvests, to store grains to feed his family, sell his product at a good place, and to cancel the acquired debt.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for the preparation of two-and-a-half units of land where he will farm maize and squash.

loans.name: Rakhat

texts.ru: Рахат успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 3 коровы. На 0,60 Га собственной земли она выращивает перец для реализации, также продает молоко. Ежемесячный доход Рахат составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахат вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на оплату услуг по сбору экологически чистого урожая. Доходы от кредита Рахат планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Rakhat successfully repaid her loan, which she used for its intended purpose. She is grateful to Kiva and to everyone who supported her. On her farm she now has three cows. On her 0.6 hectare plot of land, which she owns, she grows peppers for profit; she also sells milk. Her monthly income is 12,000 KGS. In order to further grow her business, Rakhat has applied for another loan from Bai Tushum Bank for 60,000 KGS. She will use this loan for the costs of harvesting her organic crops. Rakhat plans to reinvest the profit she makes in the further growth of her business.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting of eco-friendly peppers

loans.name: Vui's Group

texts.en:
Vui, a Thai ethnic woman, has been joined in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January 2011. Her family consists of four members, including her husband, her son, and her daughter, living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from breeding and cultivation. Each year the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount.

She wants to take a loan to pay for her children’s education fees because she does not have enough money to pay in the coming term of this school year while her son is at primary school and her daughter is at kindergarten.

She hopes that the loan will help her two children have better conditions for learning, and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay her children’s education fees.

loans.name: Thao's Group

texts.en:
Thao, born in 1990, a Thai ethnic woman, has been joined in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January 2010. She is living with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. She wants to raise pigs to get more income for the family but the saved amount is not enough to invest in the breeding. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

Thao hopes that the loan will help her family invest effectively in breeding at high productivity to improve the living standards of the family well, and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise pigs.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia está  siguiendo la carrera de contaduría pública, a la vez trabajando para así poder mantenerse a él y a su familia y también cubrir los gastos de sus estudios.
Ella comenta que su meta es terminar sus estudios y ascender a un mejor puesto en su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de transporte que tiene y también para cubrir los gastos de sus materiales de estudios.
texts.en:
Lucia is continuing her career in public accountancy, and works at the same time in order to sustain herself and her family, and cover the university expenses.

She says that her goal is to finish her studies and get promoted to a better position at work.

She is requesting this loan to be able to cover her transport expenses and buy university supplies.

loans.use: to cover her transport expenses and buy university supplies.

loans.name: Monrovia Group

texts.en:
Debora is in her late 30s and is married with two children who are both at school. She has been running two projects - selling secondhand clothes door-to-door since 2007, and a food cafe. She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Debora’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her secondhand clothes stock and to start a food cafe. She has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees for her two children, to repay the loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase the secondhand clothes and to buy food ingredients. She also dreams of selling wheat flour at wholesale price.

Debora will share this loan with her group MONROVIA, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock of secondhand clothes and to buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 23 year old married woman with no biological children of her own yet but she supports six other dependents in her family.

Fatuma has been running a beauty salon for the last three years and it has been successful. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase hair oils, relaxer, hair conditioner shampoo, nail polish,nail polish remover and new combs.

With the anticipated profit she will be able to repay her loan and add new stock of hair products. 

She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hair oils, relaxer, hair conditioner shampoo, nail polish,nail polish remover and new combs

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмира успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 30 овец, 4 лошади. На 1,80 Га земли она выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Зимой скот содержат в сараях, в летнее время отправляют на пастбища. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 31,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кобыл коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Эльмира вложит в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку дома.
texts.en: Elmira sucessfully repaid her loan, which she used as intended. She is grateful to Kiva and to everyone who supported her. On her farm she has three cows, 30 sheep, and four horses. She grows clover for the farm on her 1.8 hectare plot. In the winter the animals are kept in the barn, and in the summer they go out to pasture. Her monthly income is approximately 31,000 KGS. In order to further grow her business, she turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase mares and cows and increase her herd. Elmira plans to reinvest the profit in the further increase of her herd and save up money to purchase a house.

loans.use: to buy mares and increase her herd

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos, de 36 años de edad, es un hombre joven y muy responsable, está casado, vive con su esposa y su hija de 17 años de edad que estudia bachillerato, su esposa es ama de casa y se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

Carlos, se dedica a trabajar como empleado en una ferretería cerca de su casa, él trabaja ahí desde hace varios años, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.- Carlos, también tiene un pequeño negocio propio en donde vende cerámicas a domicilio, él compra los diseños de la cerámica y la transporta hasta las casas de sus clientes, porque es un material delicado y debe ser transportarlo con cuidado. 

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para reparar su vehículo y otra parte para comprar cerámica. 

Los sueños de Carlos, son seguir trabajando y poner su propia ferretería.
texts.en:
Carlos is 36 years old. He is a very responsible young man. He is married and he lives with his wife and his 17 year old daughter who is studying in secondary school. His wife is a housewife and does domestic work.

Carlos works as an employee in a hardware store close to his house. He has worked here for a number of years and thanks to his job has been able to get ahead with his family. Carlos also has a small business where he sells ceramics to homes. He buys the ceramic designs and delivers them to the homes of his clients as it is a delicate material and has to be transported with care.

Carlos needs the loan to repair his vehicle and the other part to buy ceramics.

Carlos' dreams are to continue working and to open his own hardware store.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and the other part to buy ceramics.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres De Zunilito Group

texts.es:
Gloria es una joven de 20 años de edad es soltera vive junto  a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Gloria (la que se ubica en medio de las tres) para obtener sus ingres y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de curiosidades y regalos, con este negocio lleva 3 años de realizarlo pero también trabaja como modista para una institución.
Gloria con el deseo de mejorar su negocio, junto a un grupo  de personas a decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mercadería tales como: juguetes, ropa para damas, pintura para uñas, maquillajes, esta inversión lo realizar ella para abastecer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes en la época navideña. Sus aspiraciones en la vida  son: fortalecer su negocio y mejorar los ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 20 year old young woman. She is single and lives with her parents and siblings in a Suchitepéquez community.

Gloria (the one who is in the middle) makes a living selling curios and gifts. She has had this business for 3 years but also works as a dressmaker for an institution.

Gloria, wanting to improve her business decided to request a loan, with a group of people, to buy merchandising such as: toys, ladies clothing, nail polish and make up. She is making this investment to improve the supply to meet the needs of her clients during the Christmas season.

Her aspirations in life are to strengthen her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy products for her business such as: toys, ladies clothes, nail polish and make up.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a repeat client of UGAFODE Microfinance. She deals in newspaper vending in Kampala and also runs a clothes shop to increase the income.  She has applied for a loan to purchase stock of newspapers to sell. She greatly enjoys her business because her business is strategically located near the market and has many customers. Her challenge is that the capital is inadequate to purchase in bulk and also open another business in order to diversify her sources of income. .

loans.use: to boost her business by buying a stock of newspapers.

loans.name: Bwikya Institute

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ramadhan. He is the Principal of Bwikya Institute, a mixed school in the urban area of Hoima with 580 students. Bwikya Institute has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Bwikya Institute School will repay its loan from the school fees it collects each term. Ramadhan ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by both reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases and increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Esmeralda Lissette

texts.es: Esmeralda es una mujer trabajadora de 41 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, además cuenta con una tienda de productos básicos, con lo que logra obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 19, 16 y 13 años de edad, a los que apoya en sus estudios. Esmeralda desea construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a hardworking woman.  She is 41 years old and works selling beauty products from a catalog.  She also has a small convenience store, with which she is able to get better earnings.  She lives with her partner and her three children, ages 13, 16, and 19, whom she is supporting in their schooling.

Esmeralda wants to build a perimeter wall around her home, but she doesn’t have the liquid assets needed.  Because of this, she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to build a perimeter wall around her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar for building a perimeter wall around her home.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es: José habita en vivienda humilde pero propia desde hace 14 años, y en ella vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos una hija de  21 años y dos varones de 17 y 14 años de edad a los que siempre busca la manera de brindarles lo mejor. Él es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a la venta de ganando y la agricultura, lo cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia y apoyar sus hijos con los estudios. José desea mejorar el piso y paredes de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía el piso se encuentra deteriorado, además desea encementar las paredes donde se hace anidación de plagas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para encementar las paredes y piso de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
José has lived in a humble home, but his own home, for the past 14 years. In this home he lives with his wife and his 3 children: a 21 year old daughter, and two sons ages 17 and 14. He is always looking for ways to offer them the best. He is a hardworking man who works in the sale of livestock and in agriculture, which allows him to get his family ahead and support his children in their studies.

He would like to improve the floor and walls of his home, since as can be observed in the photo, the floor is damaged. Furthermore, he would like to also cement the walls where there have become nests of pests. It is for this that he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel and labor in order to cement the walls and floor of his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and labor in order to cement the walls and floor of his home.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha, 48, is a married woman who lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children who are currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural products to the local dealers. On average, she can generate earnings of USD 5.00 per day.

The current farmland that she owns is small and it can provide a smaller benefit to her. She wants to enlarge her farmland area but she cannot afford to. Therefore, now she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. She hopes this additional farmland will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Torees Group

texts.en:
Michael, who is in his late 30s, is single with two school-age children. He has been running a fruit, vegetable and general shop business in Kiswahili Gengeduke for seven years now.  He works from 8am to 6pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Michael's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use the loan to restock the out-of-stock items in his general store. He dreams of owning a restaurant. 

Micheal will share this loan with his loan group Torees, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in their general store.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
For many years now, Remedios has been a fish vendor, and she has rented a stall inside the local market, serving  mostly town dwellers and nearby residents.  She is a married woman and has four dependents, one of whom is still attending school. She resides in the town of Baclayon.
 
She would like to gain access to financial services to help improve her present situation. Remedios has requested a loan which will be used to purchase a weighing scale, a banyera (fish storage) and additional capital to buy various fish. These are vital for her to continue to manage her day to day livelihood activities and make progress.

She hopes that with the continued support from Kiva through CEVI, she should be able to finance the schooling of her child and improve her family's status of living.

loans.use: to purchase a weighing scale, a banyera (fish storage) and additional capital to buy various fish

loans.name: Rubona Visionary Dev't Group

texts.en:
Harriet is a 37-year-old, hardworking, married woman with two children, all school-going, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She grows both food and cash crops like beans. Beans and coffee earn her income and support her family. She also ventures in the tailoring or sewing of clothes for the people around her home to increase her earnings.

She has a vision of educating her children and developing herself, but her main setbacks are bad weather and competition from similar businesses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more pesticides for her coffee gardens. *The extra person in the photo is a group member who has savings and has guaranteed his fellows but has not taken a loan. Some children came with their parents and stood for the photo as well

loans.use: to buy more pesticides for her coffee gardens.

loans.name: Cristofer

texts.es: Cristofer es un joven emprendedor que se dedica a actividades agrícolas, específicamente al cultivo de cebollino. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de fertilizantes agrícolas y el pago de mano de obra necesarios para el desarrollo de su cultivo. De esta forma logrará mejorar los ingresos familiares, los cuales dependen directamente de esta actividad.
texts.en: Cristofer is young entrepreneur who works in agricultural occupations, specifically farming green onions. He asks for a loan of one million colones (₡ 1 000 000), for the purchase of agricultural fertilizers and to pay the workers that are needed to develop his crop. In this way he will manage to increase the family income, which depends directly on this activity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to farm green onions.

loans.name: María Eva

texts.es:
María, de 66 años de edad, está casada, tiene 2 hijos pero ninguno vive con ellos.

María, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y su esposo es agricultor, pero también tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa donde vende productos de primera necesidad, ella tiene más de 10 años de tener su tienda. 

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar sodas, azúcar, aceite y para vender verduras en esta época que se acerca. 

Los sueños de María, son poder seguir trabajando para tener una vida tranquila junto a su esposo y poder disfrutar de su familia.
texts.en:
María, age 66, is married and has two children, although neither lives with her.  María works doing her household chores, and her husband is a farmer.  She also has a small store in her house where she sells staples.  She has had her store for more than ten years.  

María needs this loan to buy soda, sugar, oil, and vegetables to sell in the upcoming season.  María's dreams are to be able to keep working in order to have a peaceful life with her husband and enjoy her family.

loans.use: to buy soda, sugar, oil, and vegetables in the upcoming season

loans.name: Bakbubu

texts.ru: Бакбубу, 62 года, замужем, мать 4 детей, младшая дочь живет с родителями. У Бакбубу- среднее образование, она пенсионерка и дополнительно с 1972 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Бакбубу очень любит свою деятельность, на земельной доле 2,10 ГА она выращивает перец, фасоль и клевер. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 3 лошади. В магазине возле дома занимается торговлей продуктами питания. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет 30,000 сом (KGS). Накопления Бакбубу старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Бакбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку лошади. Свои доходы Бакбубу планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, постройку сараев.
texts.en: Bakbubu is 62 years old and married with four children, the youngest of whom lives with them at home. Bakbubu has a secondary education and is retired, but has supplemented her income with farming and livestock breeding since 1972. Bakbubu loves her work -- on her 2.1 hectare plot she grows peppers, beans and clover. She also has two cows and three horses on her farm. In the shop beside her house she sells food products. Her monthly income is 30,000 KGS. Bakbubu tries to reinvest her profits in her business. Bakbubu applied for a loan of 40,000 KGS from Bai Tushum Bank to purchase a horse. She plans to reinvest the profits in the further growth of her business and in the construction of a barn.

loans.use: to purchase a horse

loans.name: Tony Melvin

texts.es:
Tony, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y junto a su pareja tienen 2 hijos que están estudiando.

Tony, trabaja como transportista en un pick-up, halando persona y también es agricultor y en su pick-up hala la cosecha de maíz hasta su casa.

Tony, necesita el préstamo para mejorar su negocio y para reparar su pick-up porque es su medio de transporte para realizar su trabajo.

Su principal sueño es, mejorar más su tienda y tener otro medio de transporte mejor para trasladar personas.
texts.en:
Tony is 30-years old. He went to school until high school. He is married and together with his wife they have 2 children who are in school. 

Tony works as a carrier in a pickup, transporting people. He is also an agriculturalist and, with his truck, he hauls the corn harvest to his house.

Tony needs the loan to improve his business and repair his pickup because it is his form of transportation to do his job. 

His main dream is to improve his store and have another better form of transportation to take people.

loans.use: to improve his business and repair his pickup because it is his form of transport to do his job.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Samaila is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Samaila will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Samaila now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with it.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Johannes

texts.en:
Johannes, 56, is married and has four children. He is an active and respected member of the community, having been involved in development projects for a number of years.

He gets income from rooms that he built and rents out of his backyard. He is requesting a loan to buy building material as he is intending to add one more room and upgrade the other two existing rooms. With this loan he will buy cement, tiles, steel frames for doors and windows, iron sheets for roofing, and paint among other construction materials.

He is diligent and patient and hopes to generate enough income to buy a farm one day.

loans.use: to buy building material like cement, tiles, steel frames for windows, and iron sheets for roofing.

loans.name: Milton Jeovany

texts.es:
Milton, de 28 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos.

Milton, se dedica a trabajar con su moto taxi y de esa forma genera ingresos de manera honrada y humilde para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

Milton, necesita el préstamo para reparar la moto-taxi, porque se le ha dañado y esa es su herramienta de trabajo.

Milton, sueña con encontrar un trabajo estable en donde pueda tener un salario fijo.
texts.en:
Milton is 28 years old.  He is in a relationship and has two children.  Milton works as a moto-taxi driver.  This is how he earns an income in an honest and humble way, in order to meet the needs of his family.  Milton needs this loan to repair his moto-taxi, because it is the tool of his trade but it has been damaged.

Milton dreams of finding a stable job where he could have a fixed salary.

loans.use: to repair his moto-taxi

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is a maize farmer from Gayya village. As a Babban Gona member, Micah is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Micah would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Micah can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Micah no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Micah hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Akama Kiunyuni Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Muthoki; she is 55 years old, married and blessed with seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from enterprise development training.
She does poultry farming to earn a living. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand her enterprise by buying more chicken.  This will ensure she meets the growing demand for eggs and chicken in her locality. This will help her get more income that she will use to cater to her family's needs such as food, quality healthcare and better clothing.
Muthoki is grateful to Kiva for the support and help.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and earn more income to provide for her family's basic needs such as food, quality healthcare and better clothing.

loans.name: Maria Lucy

texts.es:
La socia Maria Lucy al banco comunal VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA. 
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de panadería, la socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de pan para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como harina, mantequilla, azúcar entre otros. La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Lucy is a member of the community bank VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA. This member continues to dedicate herself to her bakery business. She is a determined and entrepreneurial woman who hopes, through her business, to obtain greater earnings and in this way continue to support her family. She continues to churn out different types of bread for her customers. She desires to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family. This member is applying for a loan to buy supplies such as flour, butter, and sugar among other items.

This member is grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, butter, and sugar among other items

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a hardworking mother and has four young children. Her means of living is through farming. She grows and sells rice. She resides in the rural town of Getafe. Her partner in life is a driver. His income goes for food.

For the past two years, Janeth has owned a rice paddy and has sold rice to the local dwellers in her area. She faces challenges in her livelihood, like lack of capital, and the high cost of farm maintenance .

Janeth would like to purchase farm supplies like fertilizer, rice seedlings and pesticide. These are vital tools to have a bountiful harvest and lessen her financial need.

A loan enables her to provide for the needs of her family and to continue expand her farm to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like fertilizer, rice seedlings and pesticide

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman from the community of Trinidad in Bohol. She is 36 years old and a mother of four school-aged children.

For the last five years, she has been helping her husband in raising their children by selling special pancakes. Out of this, she usually earns 2,700 PHP per month.

She is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar and oil for her pancakes. She plans to increase her production so she can sell both in the morning and afternoon, when people buy the most snacks.

Zenaida's only dream is that her children are well-provided for when it comes to food.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Helbert

texts.en:
Helbert is a 29-year-old married father of one. He owns a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. His store is very new and he needs an additional capital to increase his inventory.

With the loan, he plans to buy stocks of toothpaste, shampoo, cigarettes, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar, and bath soap. Helbert is determined to manage his business well so he can make business expansions someday.

Helbert hopes to continue supporting his child's education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, shampoo, cigarettes, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar and bath soap.

loans.name: Enelie

texts.en:
Enelie raises hogs to cater the needs and expenses of the entire household. She is from the town of Talibon, together with her husband and five children. Her oldest child is 14 while the youngest is 3.

Her husband is a farmer. He works in the field and grows rice.

In addition to hog raising, she also engages in buying and selling of fruits and vegetables. She has been doing that for five years now, serving neighbors and local residents in her community.

Enelie would like to improve her livelihood, but as of these time, buying and selling is at its peak. She has no enough funds to acquire supplies.

She decide to join CEVI to access financial services in order to to invest in sweet potatoes, vegetables, and fruits.

She is hoping that someday she will be a successful mother and businesswoman for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to invest in sweet potatoes, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a clothing retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more clothes to offer for sale.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Olivia dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to offer for sale.

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Sokheang, 40 years old, is a farmer on a rice field who lives in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hardworking mother of two children. She can make a net profit of approximately USD 5 a day.

During this time, Sokheang is facing a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to buy some farming materials, but she can’t afford them. Therefore, she would like to get a Kiva loan now. She has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy some rice seeds to use on her rice field and also to repair her water pump machine. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy some rice seeds to use on her rice field.

loans.name: Levi
