texts.en: Stretches of lands are in abundance in the community of Trinidad, a town in Bohol, Philippines. Most people from this place are engaged in agriculture. Like Levi, a 50-year-old mother to three dependents aged 10, 14, and 18. She is engaged in farming sweet potatoes with her husband. In addition to this, she also buys and sells bananas, sweet potatoes, and vegetables. Levi also cooks snacks and dishes to sell in the community. Levi is asking for a loan to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, and vegetables that she can resell for a profit. In the future, she hope to make her business successful for her children's healthy diet and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, and vegetables.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Two years ago, Cecilia successfully started her rice retailing business in the town of Mahaplag, Leyte. She has been doing this to earn a living while her husband does farming.

Aside from retailing rice, Cecilia also raises pigs. She wishes to improve her business in the future for sustainability. To do this, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP for additional capital to buy more rice to sell, and to be able to buy more piglets to raise. In this way, she will be able to enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more rice.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
The woman in the picture is Fe. She operates her own sari-sari store (a Filipino-coined term for a small variety store) for a living. The store is occupying a small space of their humble house in Cavite. Operating for many years now, she has managed to keep the business running and growing.

At some point, she experienced a lack in needed capital to buy her products because she would have to compromise her funds to pay their bills. Instead of buying groceries, she would have to consider the household needs first, what they have to eat for the day, the payment for the electricity and water, etc. There are also instances when neighbors would not pay their bills on time, causing her business to suffer.

Fe has been faithful in her responsibilities and once again she is knocking on the hearts of the ever supportive lenders. By borrowing supporting capital, she believes this could resolve her inadequacies in business. She hopes to improve her inventory by adding more grocery items like assorted groceries, beverages, office supplies and other common commodities. She is applying for a loan amount of Php 20,000 and praying that her request will be granted. She promised to use the amount for the said purpose and pay it back to the best of her ability.

She wants to increase her sales and expand her store in the next few years. She is a faithful member of Center for Community Transformation. Microentrepreneurs, like Fe, are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 members. They meet on weekly basis to share the goodness of God in their lives and their experiences on the very unique work of transformation that CCT offers.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items like assorted groceries, beverages, office supplies and other common commodities.

loans.name: Ma. Zenaida

texts.en:
Ma.Zenaida is 46 years old. She is married and has six children. Four of her children are enrolled in school.

Ma. Zenaida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma.Zenaida requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. Ma. Zenaida has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Zenaida would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr:
Lucie vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit que vous lui avez accordé dernièrement. Ceci lui a permis d'améliorer  son gargote, de proposer d'autres menu en plus de ce qu'elle a déjà fait avant l'obtention du crédit. Elle renouvelle sa demande de prêt pour développer et améliorer le commerce de friperie et en créer une toute nouvelle activité: vente de miel en bouteille. Elle continue encore l'exploitation de gargote.
Votre aide la motive vivement à continuer de travailler encire plus dur qu'auparavant afin de pouvoir réaliser ses rêves et objectifs.
texts.en:
Lucie thanks you so much for the loan that you last granted her. This has allowed her to improve her small restaurant by offering additional menus than she had before getting the loan. She is renewing her loan request to develop and improve her used clothing business and to create a new business: selling bottled honey. She is continuing to run her small restaurant.

Your help greatly motivates her to continue to work even harder than before in order to be able to realize her dreams and goals.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and honey (1 pack of used clothing and 100 liters of honey)

loans.name: Aiganapule

texts.en: Aiganapule is 44 years old and is a divorced woman with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years.  Aiganapule has requested a loan to buy  sugar, flour, yeast, cooking oil, fry pans, etc.   She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Aiganapule hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sugar,  flour, yeast, cooking oil, fry pans, etc…

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan, who is 27, comes from Prey Chhor district, Kompong Cham Province. He is a farmer, and the father of three children. His wife is also a farmer. To make a living, Phan manages and operates a farming business. On average he earns 5 USD a day. So far, he has been in this career for 8 years. To ensure a good harvest, he requires some workers to assist him to harvest his rice fields, but he doesn’t have sufficient money to do so. Therefore, he would like to apply for a Kiva loan to hire workers to harvest his rice fields. He would like to thank all lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to hire workers to harvest his rice fields.

loans.name: Ross Mark

texts.en: Ross Mark is 28 years old with 2 children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Ross Mark is engaged in planting and harvesting rice for sale and for family use. His farm is still doing well. However, he needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, he took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, YON, 56 years old, is an experienced and industrious farmer. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around 2 USD a day to support her family's daily needs. She is a lovely mother of ten children: six married.

To expand her farming business, she would like to get cows to help her plow her farmland, yet she can’t afford them. Therefore, she has decided to apply for a KIVA loan to help her. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to get cows to help her plow her farmland

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn believes that one should endure any hardships and difficulties with footsteps before reaching on top. And she aims to be on top; that is why she is really working hard to build a stable source of income for her family.

Marilyn has her own variety store and transport unit, which are helping her provide for their daily needs. She wants to prosper through these businesses and automatically grabs every opportunity that comes along her way.

She already availed her first loan through Kiva and repaid it successfully. So this time, she is asking again for your support to be able to raise the necessary amount which she needs to buy more supplies of groceries and other products for her store, and to pay the registration and maintenance costs of her tricycle unit. A 30,000 PHP worth of loan assistance will definitely increase her inventory, which means a bigger return on her investments.

Marilyn wants to expand her sari-sari store (general store) someday, for she dreams to give her children a good and quality education.

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for varieties of grocery goods to sell, and to pay registration and maintenance costs of the tricycle unit used for transport.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Divina is 64 years old and has children who are in school.

Divina has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Divina requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more ingredients and utensils for her restaurant business.

Divina has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Divina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and utensils for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Bernaditha

texts.en:
Bernaditha is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Bernaditha dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vilma Nohemi

texts.es:
Vilma es una joven de 28 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia ella vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad denominada Cantón Maza.

Vilma es una mujer que se sacrifica todos los días para darle a su familia lo necesario, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica en el mercado central de su comunidad lleva 5 años de realizar esta actividad.
Vilma con el afán de ofrecerles a sus clientes un mejor servicio ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más productos de ropa típica como: cortes, fajas y cortes,  pues la época de fin de año se está acercando y con ello la demanda incremente, Vilma lo que busca con esta inversión es obtener mejores ingresos. Su esperanza de vida es fortalecer su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma is a young woman who is 28 and single, with a lovely family. She lives with her parents and siblings in a community called Canton Maza.

Vilma is a woman who makes sacrifices every day to provide for her family's needs. She makes a living buying and selling traditional clothing in the central market of her community, which she has been doing for 5 years.

Vilma, in an effort to offer her customers better service, has decided to request a loan to buy more types of traditional clothes such as belts and skirts. Since the end of the year is approaching, the demand increases. With this loan Vilma hopes to increase her income. Her goal in life is to increase her business and get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy more styles of traditional clothing such as skirts and belts.

loans.name: Reynilda

texts.en:
Reynilda is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has three children. Her oldest child is 13 years old while her youngest child is four years old. Reynilda is so happy to have her family. Her children are her inspiration to go on and continue believing that in the future they can have a better means of living.

To help her husband augment their livelihood she started her own business. She has a hog raising business. She has been doing this proficiently for 10 years. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and buy feed as well. Aside from this, she also needs to buy “tongog” (a tannin powder used to give color to the coconut wine). This “tongog” is used by her husband, who is a “tuba” (coconut wine) gatherer. Reynilda wants to enhance this business in the future so she can have enough money to give a good education to her children for them to have better life.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed, and to buy "tongog" (a tannin powder).

loans.name: Handolina

texts.en:
Handonila is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Handonila dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shefaa

texts.en:
Shefaa is a 54-year old woman. She is married and has two children, and she lives with them in a sector in Jordan called ‎Al Hashmeye.‎

She has worked making her own clothing line for 10 years, a business with ups and downs because the market is very ‎saturated with clothing. She manages creating different items, so she started sewing curtains besides clothing, and that will ‎impact and attract her customers. Shefaa works hard for 12 hours a day, devising, designing, and sewing fabric. She ‎knows that the future of her children depends on her and her husband. She hopes to be able to provide a good life and good ‎education for her children.

Currently, she is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine, fabrics and yarns, which will help ‎her to increase her products and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, fabrics and yarns.

loans.name: Muong Phang 42 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy, 27, is a Thai ethnic woman who has been married and has three children at the ages of 10, 8 and 1. She lives with her husband and children in a Thai ethnic traditional house at a small remote village. 

She works very hard at agricultural production doing several activities, such as growing rice and breeding pigs, chicken, and duck, while her husband works as a carpenter to earn a living and send the two first children to school fully. 

Mrs. Thuy has always wanted to increase production to provide her children the best conditions for them to escape from poverty. This is the sixth time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program, and she will use the loan to buy baby fish and food for them. 

She hopes that her investment will go well and help her reap good income. Mrs. Thuy dreams a more abundant life for her family and a brighter future for her children. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish and food for them.

loans.name: Qarqizmo

texts.en:
Qarqizmo is an 18-years-old freshman in the International and Business Law Program at AUCA. She was born in Tajikistan and finished school there. While studying at school she was one of the best students, and after graduation, she went to the USA by FLEX program and lived there with an American host family.

This one-year exchange program changed her life a lot. She became broad-minded, got acquainted with the foreign life and culture, and faced the modern education system. After her return, she tried to enter the best university and chose to study at AUCA.

To study at AUCA, Qarqizmo had to pass entrance exams and move to Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan to live there far from her family. Her father, mother, sister and brother stayed at her hometown and continued to support her in everything. Qarqizmo is from a low-income family, where even with two members working of it, they still save money on everything. 

As we know, Tajikistan is one of the central Asian countries with economic problems. The citizens of which usually go to Russia to earn a living as migrants. The last economic crisis covered all central Asian countries, caused a lot of financial problems in the country, and made people's lives more difficult.

Qarqizmo compares Kiva's loan to water. For example, grass or trees can’t grow/live without water, as well as Qarqizmo can’t continue her studies without Kiva's loan, which will cover part of her university tuition. 

She thanks Kiva lenders for their positive attitude and promises to use the water in proper manner.

loans.use: to pay for her higher eduction.

loans.name: Ramavoarisoa Claire

texts.fr:
Ramavoarisoa Claire vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit qui lui a permis d'augmenter les marchandises, renforcer le fonds de roulement. 
Elle renouvelle sa demande de crédit pour pouvoir encore développer l'activité de vente de chaussures  mais aussi pour créer une toute nouvelle. Elle va acheter une machine à coudre surjeteuse car les deux époux sont tous les deux couturiers. 
Elle voudrait pratiquer dorénavant sa connaissance en couture pour améliorer le revenu afin de pouvoir réaliser ses et objectifs.
texts.en:
Ramavoarisoa Claire thanks you so much for the loan that has allowed her to augment her merchandise and reinforce her working capital.

She is renewing her loan request to be able to further develop her business of selling shoes and to create a new one. She is going to buy an oversewing sewing machine, as both she and her husband are both dressmakers.

She would like to practice from now on her sewing expertise in order to increase her revenue to be able to realize her goals.

loans.use: to buy supplemental pairs of shoes and an oversewing sewing machine.

loans.name: Helisoa

texts.fr:
Helisoa souhaite reprendre un autre prêt afin d’augmenter de nouveau son stock de bananes à vendre. En effet, elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire les besoins de ses clients.
Le prêt précédent lui a permis d’augmenter considérablement les bénéfices et d’assurer sans difficulté la rentrée scolaire de ses enfants.
Ce prêt va lui permettre d’acheter plusieurs tonnes de bananes qu’elle va vendre en gros. Elle espère gagner beaucoup de bénéfices pour augmenter le niveau de son épargne afin d’assurer l’avenir de ses enfants et de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Helisoa wants to take on another loan so she can increase once more her supply of bananas for sale. Indeed, she is unable to meet her customer's needs.

The previous loan enabled her to significantly increase profits and ensure a smooth back-to-school process for her children.

This loan will enable her to buy several tons of bananas she will sell wholesale. She hopes to generate much profit and increase the level of her savings, so she can ensure her children's future and build a house.

loans.use: buy a stock of bananas

loans.name: Navruz

texts.ru: Это Навруз. Ему 42 лет. Навруз житель города Душанбе. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Навруз простой человек. Он талантливый человек, он умеет все. Его дети учатся в школе. Жена работает в магазине. Навруз хочет начать свою деятельность, чтобы зарабатывать и обеспечить семью. Он решил открыть авто мойку. Потому, что он раньше работал в авто мойке. Сейчас он хочет открыть свою собственную авто мойку и зарабатывать себе. Ему нужно денег  для купли моечный аппарат «RARCHER» и другие принадлежности. Навруз очень надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This is Navruz. He is 42 years old. Navruz is a resident of Dushanbe city. He is married and has two children. Navruz is a simple man. He is a talented person, and can do anything. His children study in school. His wife works in a shop. 

Navruz wants to start his own business, in order to earn a living and provide for his family. He has decided to open a car wash, because he worked in a car wash previously. Now he wants to open his own car wash and earn a living for himself. He needs money to buy a 'RARCHER' washing device and other supplies. Navruz is hoping very much for your support.

loans.use: to buy a 'RARCHER' car wash device to open a car wash

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic household commodities ranging from powdered milk, soft drinks, salt, sugar, seasonings, soap, and shampoo to assorted canned goods. She is married woman with six grown children. Her sari-sari (variety} store is located in front of her home, serving neighbors and nearby residents. In addition to that , she also raises and sells hogs.

She would like to boost her business, but the main problem is the lack of capital to fill her store with a variety of stock. With a loan, she could manage it properly and continue to expand.

Gloria would like to purchase groceries, drinks, and piglets.

loans.use: to purchase  groceries, drinks, and piglets.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a woman who is 57 years old. She is from Mahaplag, Leyte and sells “tuba” to earn a living. “Tuba” is a local term which means coconut wine. This coconut wine is very popular in the Philippines. It consists of pure sap, with no bark mixed in, and it is generally milky white in color. “Tuba” gatherers will just use tannin powder known as “tungog” to add color to the wine.

With a greater demand for it, Adelina needs a bigger amount of loan to buy more “tuba” wine to sell. In addition to this, she needs an additional amount to buy grocery items. Definitely, she is thinking of starting up a sari-sari (variety) store business. In this way, she will be able to help her husband, who is a farmer, in supporting their school-aged children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy tuba wine and grocery items

loans.name: Medilyn

texts.en:
Medilyn is married with an only child. She manages her own cafeteria to make a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the cafeteria. Aside from this, she runs a grocery store that sells a variety of goods in their community. To improve it, she requested a new loan from GDMPC to purchase more grocery goods to increase inventory in her store.
In the future, she wants to improve her business to have a better source of income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to increase her inventory.
